loans.name: Tabempa Group

texts.en:
Patrick B. is 38 years old and married with four children. He is the leader of a group that has been working together for one year. Patrick runs a transport service and at the same time sells palm oil. He diversified the business with his previous loan. He says his main dream is to see his four children through their education and he would like to generate income and save for that purpose. He is requesting a loan to add on his savings and purchase one more motorbike.

Of the other group members, Joseph has a small general store and Sampa sells firewood. The group is requesting a loan of Le.2,400,000 ($US825) to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase stock of firewood, palm oil and groceries and to expand a transport service.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is a hard-working person who, together with her husband, has been able to help the family business prosper. They have been working in this business for more than 20 years. They still have 2 children at home and live in the north part of the city.

This is the fifth loan she has requested, and she has an excellent credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mercedes es una persona muy trabajadora que junto a su marido sacaron adelante un negocio familiar trabajando en el mismo hace mas D. 20 años teniendo todavia a su cargo 2 hijos, ellos viven en la zona norte D. la ciudad.

Actualmente es el quinto credito que solicita D. forma individual, teniendo un excelente historial crediticio.

loans.use: Buy materials for making hats.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en:
Gabrilla Thular is the Tamaraneh group leader. Thirty-two years old and married with four children, he owns a grocery shop in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone. With his previous loan, he increased his stock. Garbilla now feels strong to access a larger loan and would like to expand the business.

Manuel is a carpenter and would like to buy carpentry tools; Safoa would like to purchase more materials to increase the production of Gara tye dye; Aminata would like to increase her stock of dried fish; and Joseph wants stock for his grocery store. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le,3,000,000 ($US1,025) for these purposes.

loans.use: To purchase stock of fish, cotton materials and dyes, carpentry tools and drinks.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando is a very responsible person whose business is making cakes. The entire family is involved in the business and his wife sells the cakes he makes.

This is the sixth loan he has requested and he has an excellent credt record.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Rolando es una persona muy responsable que se dedica a la reposteria de este negocio vive toda la familia ya que su esposa comercializa las tortas que el realiza.

Actualmente es el sexto credito que solicita de forma individual, teniendo un exelente historial crediticio

loans.use: Buy supplies for decorating cakes.

loans.name: Malaneh But Group

texts.en:
Kadiatu T. is very grateful to Kiva for the $200 loan that enabled her to expand her business. She said the loan was a real seed that has multiplied. With the profit, she was able to meet her children's college expenses and started building her business capital.

Kadiatu, together with her group members Memunata, Amie, Sallamatu and Kadiatu K., sells palm oil, rice, peanuts and kola nuts. Memunata also sells used clothes.

The group would like to further expand their businesses and so they are requesting a loan of Le.4000000 ($US1,375).

loans.use: Increase stocks of rice, palm oil, peanuts and bails of used clothes.

loans.name: Alberto Alfonso

texts.es:
Señor Alberto is 48-years-old; lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood; is married; and has 3 children, who are married and independent. His wife is a housewife.

Don Alberto works as a taxi driver. He has done this for 3 years; previously he worked as a welder. He would like this loan to improve the infrastructure of his house by purchasing rafters and zinc to repair his roof, which is in bad shape.

His future plans are to buy his own vehicle to obtain more income.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Alberto tiene 48 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es casado y tiene tres hijos que ya están casados y son independientes, su esposa es ama de casa.

Don Alberto trabaja como taxista, tiene tres años de estar laborando, anteriormente trabajaba como soldador. El préstamo lo quiere para infraestructura en la mejora de su vivienda en la compra de perlines y zinc para reparar el techo que lo tiene en mal estado.

Su plan futuro es comprar su propio vehiculo, para obtener mayores ingresos

loans.use: To purchase zinc to replace the roof on his home

loans.name: José Andres

texts.es:
In the municipality of Esteli, Mr. Jose M. has been selling cattle for more than 30 years. This has helped him move on in his business. He's father to one son who he needs to feed and provide to his daily needs.

One of his main needs is the need to purchase cattle in order to improve his business. For this reason he went to Ceprodel and requested a loan. Not only will his business benefit from it, so will his family.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Condega de la ciudad de Estelí, el caballero José M. se dedica con basta experiencia al negocio de ganadería habiéndose desempeñado en esta labor desde hace mas de 30 años lo que ha permitido que alcance gran experiencia en su negocio. Es padre de un hijo al que tiene el deber de alimentar y proporcionarle las condiciones de vida necesarias.

Una de las necesidades que hoy en día atraviesa esta caballero es que necesita invertir en la compra del ganado para su desarrollo. Por esta razón él acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario con el cual adquirir el ganado y además salir adelante con el mantenimiento de su hogar. Con el crédito se beneficia tanto él como su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CEPRODEL - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Juana Adilia

texts.es:
Doña Juana lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, is 38-years-old, and is married. Her husband works in transportation and helps with the home's expenses.

Juana's business is a restaurant. She has 8 years of experience and started with her own resources. She would like this loan to invest in working capital for the purchase of products to sell her food.

Her short-term plan is to make her location better for her customers, to have more sales, and to improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Juana habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada. Su esposo es transportista y ayuda a los gastos del hogar.

El negocio de la Sra. Juana es una comideria, tiene ocho años de experiencia e inició con recursos propios. El préstamo lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos para la venta de comida.

Su plan a corto plazo es tener un local mas acondicionado para sus clientes y así tener más ventas y mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: To purchase products for food sales

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina Blandón is a native of the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. With much effort, she looks for ways to improve her financial situation with the goal of continuing to manage the schooling of her three small children.

Today, she faces the need to make improvements to her home, which after starting to deteriorate, she began with its reconstruction but due to lack of funds, has had to do in phases until she can finish it. Today, she turns to Ceprodel with the goal of receiving a loan for the purchase of construction materials to continue with the maintenance of her home and offer the best possible living conditions to her children, who she loves dearly.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Agustina Blandón es originaria del municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega y con mucho esfuerzo busca la manera de mejorar su situación económica con el propósito de continuar con el mantenimiento de los estudios de sus tres pequeños hijos.

Hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda por lo que al haber estado en deterioro comenzó a reconstruirla pero por falta del recurso económico lo ha venido haciendo por etapas hasta finalizar. Hoy en día acude a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con el mantenimiento de su hogar y proporcionarle las mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos que tanto ama.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Aristides Florencio

texts.es:
Aristides C. sells pork meat in the municipality of Somotillo in his native city of Chinandega. His great efforts are for the purpose of maintaining his young school-aged daughter, and to do this he is looking for a means of selling the meat in an establishment of his own.

It is very important to mention that he has been selling meat for the past 7 years, and he has improved his business’ condition thanks to the support given to him by Ceprodel, being that it allowed him to pay for the schooling of his children. Today, he is requesting a loan to purchase meat to sell in his sector.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio del caballero Aristides C. es la venta de carne de cerdo comercializada en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega de donde él es originario. Sus grandes esfuerzos los lleva a cabo para mantener a su pequeña hija en edad escolar y para esto busca la manera de vender la carne en su establecimiento propio.

Es de mucha importancia destacar que desde hace 7años se dedica a la venta de carne y hoy en día ha mejorado su condición gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel ya que le ha permitido salir adelante en el pago del colegio de sus hijos. Hoy en día la razón por la cual solicita el crédito es para la compra de la carne para comercializarla en su sector.

loans.use: Purchase pork meat to sell in his sector.

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
For the past 12 years, Cesar Augusto S. has been working in his welding workshop, which he tends to very cordially in his home in the city of Chinandega in the municipality of Somotillo.

He has been remodeling his workshop little by little with the passing of time, and has made investments to improve his business’ conditions and the living standards of his family, which consists of his wife and two small children.

Today, he looks for support from Ceprodel to receive a loan to make improvements to his workshop by expanding it to offer better conditions to his customers. For this reason, he trustingly waits for his loan to be granted to continue with the success of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 12 años el señor Cesar Augusto S. se dedica a trabajar en su taller de soldadura atendido muy cordialmente por él mismo en su propia casa de habitación en la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en el municipio de Somotillo.

El taller lo ha venido remodelando poco a poco a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido y ha venido realizando inversión para mejorar las condiciones del negocio y la de su familia compuesta por su cónyuge y sus dos pequeños hijos.

Hoy en día busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para el mejoramiento del taller por medio de la ampliación del local para brindar mejores condiciones a sus clientes. Por esta razón es que espera confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado y así saldrá adelante en su negocio.

loans.use: Expand his welding workshop to offer his customers better conditions.

loans.name: Gladis Yolanda

texts.es:
Gladis S. is a woman whose work is dedicated to selling different types of products in her grocery store. She has developed it over 7 years in her community of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega.

Her great efforts are owed to the obligation of supporting her children, who are in secondary school, and to meeting the needs of her home. To carry out her work, she has to constantly obtain resources to buy her products and sell them. Because of this basic motive, she is turning to Ceprodel for support to obtain a credit to get ahead and to offer better products to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Gladyis S. es una dama cuya labor a la que se dedica es el negocio de venta de diferentes tipos de productos ofrecidos en su pulpería la cual desde hace 7 años la ha venido desarrollando en su comunidad de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Sus grandes esfuerzos se deben a que tiene la obligación de mantener a sus hijos en el colegio y además a suplir las necesidades del hogar. Para llevar a cabo este trabajo requiere constantemente obtener recursos para la compra de sus productos para comercializarlos. Por este motivo busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito con el cual salir adelante y brindar mayores productos a sus clientes en su municipio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Gloria Del Transito

texts.es:
Gloria C. has been running her sewing business for the past 8 years from her home in her native city of Chinandega in the municipality of Somotillo.

She characterizes herself as an excellent seamstress who has been creating all types of dresses, shirts and pants for men, women and children.

Thanks to Ceprodel, through the granting of loans, she has improved the conditions of her business by purchasing sewing machines and showcases, among other things. Today, the purpose for requesting this loan is to purchase a sewing machine and equipment such as threads, needles, fabrics, etc. With this loan, she will benefit as much as her family.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gloria C. se dedica a su negocio de costurería desde hace 8 años atendiéndolo en su casa de habitación de donde es originaria en la ciudad de Chinandega, en el municipio de Somotillo.

Ella se caracteriza por ser una excelente costurera que se ha dedicado a la elaboración de todo tipo de vestidos, camisas, pantalones, ect. tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.

Gracias a Ceprodel por medio de la entrega de los créditos, ha logrado mejorar sus condiciones del negocio en la compra de las maquinas, vitrinas, etc. Hoy en día el motivo por el cual solicita el crédito es para la compra una maquina de trabajo y de las herramientas de trabajo como lo son hilos, agujas, telas, etc. Con el crédito se beneficia tanto ella como su hogar de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine and equipment such as threads, needles, fabrics, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria M. O. is a native of the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. Currently, engaged in providing well-being to her two school-aged daughters, she looks for a way to invest in the reconstruction of her home, which has suffered from many strikes to it with the passing of time that have prevented it from being inhabitable.

She initiated the reconstruction of part of her home, and today she requests a loan from Ceprodel to purchase construction materials and to pay for the manual labor. For this reason, she trusts that she will receive this loan so that she can improve the living conditions of her young daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gloria M. O. es originaria del municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Actualmente, comprometida con el bienestar de sus dos pequeñas hijas en edad escolar, busca la manera de invertir en la reconstrucción de su vivienda por lo que a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo, ha sufrido azotes que impiden que se habite en ella.

Inició la reconstrucción por parte de su vivienda y hoy en día solicita a Ceprodel el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y para el pago de la mano de obra. Por este motivo es que muy confiadamente espera que su crédito le será otorgado y de esta manera mejorará las condiciones de vida de sus pequeñas.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials and pay for the manual labor.

loans.name: Gretel Yanitza

texts.es:
Mrs. Gretel P. works at a market. She attends to the neighbors of the region of Chinandega. She is a lady who has fought to advance in life for many years.

Commited to the well-being of her two kids, she works very hard every day to improve her business and add more goods to her inventory. Because of this situation, she hopes to purchase more goods and be able to offer them to her clients and this way improve her way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gretel P. se dedica al negocio de pulpería atendiéndola en su comunidad en Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una dama que por mucho tiempo ha luchado para salir adelante y para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.

Comprometida con el bienestar de sus dos pequeños hijos, ella a diario se esfuerza para mejorar el negocio y adquirir mayores cantidades de productos para comercializarlos. Por esta situación es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar su mercadería para ofrecerla a sus clientes y así mejorar su condición.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Jackeli Del Carmen

texts.es:
Jakeli Gonzáles sells clothing in her own home, which is located in the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. She is a lady who has made great efforts to maintain her home and to guard the well-being of her family.

It is necessary for Jackeli to invest in merchandise for her business; growing competition necessitates that she offer more clothing to keep clients. For this reason, she has sought the support of Ceprodel to obtain a loan that would permit her to buy more merchandise. Today, her credit record is perfect, given that she has repaid all loans obtained through the Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Jakeli Gonzáles se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa en su propia casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una dama muy esforzada que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al trabajo para mantener su hogar y hoy en día velar por el bienestar de su familia.

Actualmente el negocio de la señora Jakeli atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en mercadería ya que al crecer su competencia le es necesario a ella también ofertar mas ropa para acaparar a los clientes. Por esta razón es que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito que le permita la compra de la mercadería para su negocio. Hoy en día su record crediticio se encuentra en perfectas condiciones ya que ha cancelado satisfactoriamente todos los créditos con la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José Manuel M. is a native of the district of Somotillo. He has worked arduously in order to improve the living conditions of his beloved family. For several years, he has been looking for ways to improve his home and has begun reconstruction of his deteriorating house. Today, he is in the position of not having sufficient financial resources to continue with the final stage of reconstruction. For this reason, he approached Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan for the purchase of construction materials and manpower.

The loan, which will greatly reduce the risk of suffering an accident as a result of the poor condition of the home, will benefit his family as much as it will benefit José.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

El señor José Manuel M. es originario del municipio de Somotillo y se dedica a laborar fuertemente por el compromiso de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su amada familia. Por varios años ha venido buscando la manera de mejorar su vivienda y lo ha comenzado a hacer reestructurándola por la razón de que había estado deteriorada. Hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de que no posee el recurso económico para continuar con la etapa final de la reconstrucción y para ello acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y mano de obra.

Con el crédito se beneficiará tanto él como su familia de esta manera reducirá en gran escala el riesgo de sufrir un accidente a causa del mal estado de su vivienda.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Juana Emilia

texts.es:
Juana Almendares is a lady who has encountered economic difficulties, but thanks to her concerted efforts, has managed to persevere and provide stability for her young, school-aged children. She is involved in the production and sale of refreshments, which she prepares herself and sells from her own home in the municipality of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega.

Her business requires investment in the purchase of the raw materials with which to make the refreshments; it is for this reason that Mrs. Juana has approached Ceprodel for a loan. Upon acquiring raw materials, she plans to continue with the sale of refreshments in her community of Somotillo.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La dama Juana Almendares es una dama que a través de la historia ha atravesado difíciles circunstancias económicas pero que gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos ha logrado salir adelante y proporcionarle el bienestar a sus pequeños hijos que hoy se encuentran en edades escolares. Ella se dedica al negocio de la elaboración y venta de refrescos los cuales ella misma los prepara y ofrece en su propia casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega.

El negocio hoy en día atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los refrescos y es por este único motivo que la señora Juana acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito con el cual logre adquirir su materia prima y de esta manera continuar con la venta de sus refrescos en su comunidad de Somotillo.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Justino Cipriano

texts.es:
Justino P. washes cars in the city of Chinandega. This business is located right in his home. He's visited by clients on a daily basis, these client's whishes are to improve the looks of their cars or motorcycles. This is where Justino washes them and leaves them looking neat and free of dirt.

It's important to point out that this is Justino's ONLY income. He supports his wife and two children. He's currently waiting for Ceprodel to approve the loan in order to buy a pressure washer and this way clean cars in a more efficient way.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La labor a la que se dedica el señor Justino P. en el municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega es al lavado de vehículos el cual atiende en su establecimiento ubicado en su casa de habitación. A diario es visitado por clientes cuyo propósito es mejorar la apariencia de su vehiculo o moto, es allí donde el señor Justino lava los vehículos dejándolos nítidos y sin ninguna suciedad.

Es necesario destacar que este negocio es el único sustento para su hogar compuesto por su esposa y dos hijos. Actualmente espera en que Ceprodel le otorgará el crédito para comprar una bomba de presión y de esta manera llevar el proceso del lavado del móvil de una manera mas eficiente.

loans.use: Purchase of pressure washer

loans.name: Luz Idalia

texts.es:
The preparation of food requires much persistence, dedication and effort, as when a particular dish necessitates cooking at high temperatures. Conscious of this situation, Luz Idalia Yanes has her own food preparation business, which she runs from her own home.

Every day Luz prepares foods to offer to her clients, who visit her at her home. The business requires raw materials for the dishes. For this reason, Luz was motivated to approach Ceprodel for a loan to purchase ingredients that will allow her to make the food specialties she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La elaboración de alimentos requiere de mucho empeño y dedicación e implica mucho esfuerzo por lo que se debe de estar a altas temperaturas cocinando para ofrecer determinado platillo. Consciente de esta situación la señora Luz Idalia Yanes posee su propio negocio de venta de elaboración de comida atendiéndolo en su propia casa de habitación.

Todos los días ella prepara sus alimentos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes los cuales la visitan en su casa de habitación. La necesidad que el negocio atraviesa es que requiere la materia prima para elaborar los platillos. Por este motivo ella acude a Ceprodel con el objetivo de obtener un crédito para la compra de los ingredientes y así iniciar a preparar sus alimentos para ofertarlos.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Port

texts.en: Mrs. Port S. is a Khmer noodle (Num Banh Chok) vendor in the Ang Ruon Market where she earns an average of $4 per day. She is a widow and lives with her two children in the Ang Ruon Village, Siem Reap Province. Her business is stable, but she wishes to expand in order to better care for her family. She requests a loan of $700 to purchase a store from which to sell her noodles. (The picture is of one of S.'s daughters.)

loans.use: To purchase a store from which to sell her noodles

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun S., 28, is the mother of two children, both of whom are too young to attend school. For the last year, she has made a living working in a beer factory. Her husband, Ung Monkol, is a taxi driver whose income is falling because gas prices keep going up. Prices have driven some taxis out of business, but Ung has regular customers who provide him with a steady income.

Lun S. is applying for a loan to replace her husband's old and unreliable motorbike with a more efficient one that uses less gas and needs fewer repairs. In the future, the young couple plan to open a small stall from which they will sell groceries. (Mrs. Lun is pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim C., 42, has the biggest stall in the village selling groceries. She just started doing this business in 2007. Her revenue is about $20 each day. Her husband Mr. Chin Chea sells fish in large amounts in the market in the village. This couple has four children, two of whom are married and live away from home, while one is a garment worker and the other is a construction worker and live at home.

Because the children sometimes spend money on a motor taxi to get to and from work, Kim would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: Kim would like to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon T., age 56, is a widow and resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She has four children, one of whom is married and two are working selling meatballs. Nuon is a vendor selling fruits in a busy market. She makes $5 of profit per day.

Now Nuon would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a cart for her children to sell meatballs from. Once they own a cart, they can sell their meatballs from house to house.

loans.use: Nuon would like to purchase a cart for her children to sell meatballs from.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea E., age 50, is a widow and has five children. One child is married; one is in security; one is a garment worker and the other two work in the Casino. The rice price is currently good in the market and if the family produces more rice to sell in the market they will have more money to support the family. To reduce the expense that Chea always spends to hire a small tractor to plow her farm, she would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a cow. This will help her a lot with the farming, allowing her to grow more rice to sell to support her family.

loans.use: Chea would like to purchase a cow to plow her land.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say L., age 36, is the mother of four children and resides with her husband (shown in the photo) in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Since 1998 she has worked on her plot of farmland growing vegetables. Her husband, Chan Mech, has a business selling fish in a busy market in the village. On average, he earns $5 per day. One of their children is a phone mechanic in Phnom Penh.
To catch more fish they would like to use the loan to buy a fishing area in the rainy season from the local government.

loans.use: Say would like to buy a fishing area for the next season.

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Moa S., age 42, is the mother of two children and together with her husband works selling groceries in the village. There are not many stalls selling groceries in the village. That is why her stall has many customers. She started doing this business in 2000 and on average she makes $18 each day in revenue. All of their children are students. This couple is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase groceries in bulk in order to save some money.

loans.use: Moa would like to purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngen N. is a villager in Tei Buon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She works in a brick making factory, while her husband, Mr. Sath Sem, works as a horse-cart driver. Her husband's business is in trouble because his horse died. In order to re-start Mr. Sath Sem's business, Mrs. Ngen N. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a horse for her husband's business.

Mrs. Ngen N. is a 39 year old mother of five: two are working as horse-cart drivers; two are enrolled in school; while the youngest is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Ngen N. obtained a loan to buy a horse for her childrens' business. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a horse for her husband business.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mr. Mom U. is a villager in Ra Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mr. Mom U. is a 48 year old father of five: one is working as a car driver; one is employed in a private company; and three are currently attending school. He is currently a healer in the local village, while his wife, Mrs. Yon Luy, is a subsistence farmer.  Mr. Mom U. is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding in order to improve his family's standard of living which remains poor. Previously, Mr. Mom U. borrowed some money from his relative to build a house.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S. A., 35, is a grocer in the village. She sells groceries in front of her house and earns $5 each day. Her husband is a policeman in Phnom Penh. They have two children and they are students.
To meet her customers' demands, she would like a loan to help her purchase more stuffs. The leftovers will be used to raise animals to sell.

loans.use: Sok would like to purchase groceries in bulk to resell and raise animals.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S., 28, is the mother of two children and resides with her husband (pictured because Meas was not at home) in Phnom Penh. Both have obs to support their family. Meas is employed by a garment factory and her husband, Vong Saran, is a driver in a company. Collectively they earn about $8 each day. Even though they both have a job, they sometimes still face financial crisis. The inflation rate in Cambodia is currently out of control so it's hard for the low or average income makers to handle their standard of living each day. The prices of goods are extremely expensive, even rice and gasoline.

Some people have to seek another source of income in order to sustain their living. Mrs. S. and her husband are trying to seek another source of income by requesting a loan from KIVA to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi when he is available from his work. This will provide their family with an additional source of income. In the future, they plan to set up a coffee shop.

loans.use: Meas would like to purchase a motor-bike to operate a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Sreang

texts.en: Mrs. Sreang C. is a subsistence farmer in Ra Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Aside of this business activity, she is a firewood seller. Her husband, Mr. Vann Huth, is a palm juice collector. She is a 24 year old mother three: one of whom is attending a local school, while the remaining two are too young to work or enroll in school. Mrs. Sreang C.’s business is facing difficulties because she cannot transport  fertilizers to fill the rice field; thus, she is asking for a loan to buy a cart.

loans.use: To buy a cart in order to transport  fertilizers

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Mr. Ham E. is a motorbike-taxi driver in Ra Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. His wife, Mrs. Phal Num, is a farmer. They have five children: three are attending school; while two others remain at home because they are too young to work or study. The family members live under poor conditions because Mr. Ham E. and his wife can only generate a small income. Thus, Mr. Ham E. would like to start a pig breeding business, and is asking for a loan to buy pigs. He hopes this new business will help improve the living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To start a pig breeding business

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Pon S. is the mother of three children and works raising pigs to sell on a piece of land near her house. Two of her children are employed as garment workers. Her husband (in the photo) is a motor taxi driver and earns about $2 a day to support their family. Now he would like to receive a loan from Kiva to replace an old and unreliable motorbike. The old motorbike uses a lot of gas which is why sometimes he makes no profit.

loans.use: Pon would like to replace an old motorbike for her husband's motor taxi business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en: Mrs. Sitha S. is a 51 year old widow with six children, living in Chhouk Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. All of her children currently attend school, except one who assists Mrs. S. with her grocery business. She would like to ask for a loan to buy more goods to expand her grocery business. Previously, Mrs. Sitha S. obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her customers in order to expand grocery business.

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Mrs. Dao N. is a farmer in Dem Popel Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 59 year old widow of four: two of whom are employed in a garment factory;and two others are attending a local school. Her family continues to live in poor conditions and she would like to start a cow breeding business in order to support her family. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy a cow both to breed and to utilize in her field.

loans.use: To start a cow breeding business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok R., 60, is the mother of four childR. and with her husband (in the photo) has a business hiring out their small tractor and grinding mill to the local people. Some farmers who don't have a cow or tractor to plow their farmland will come to ask to use the tractor from Sok’s family. Also their grinding mill is hired out by local people who want to take off the husks of their rice. These two businesses make the family sometimes $20 each day in revenue. To expand the business they would like to loan to purchase a small truck which will be used to transfer rice.

loans.use: Sok would like to purchase a small truck to transfer rice.

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Mrs. Song B. is a 54 year old widow with three children, living in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. One of her children is employed in a garment factory while the others assist her with her poultry and pig breeding businesses. Even though Mrs. Song B. has two business activities, she still cannot sufficiently support her family, therefore she would like to start a cow breeding business in order to improve her family conditions. Mrs. Song B. is asking for a loan to buy a cow. Previously, Mrs. Song B. obtained a loan from AMK to start her pig breeding business.

loans.use: To start a cow breeding business

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim N., 46, is a widow and the mother of two children, both of whom are employed by a garment factory. Sim has a business selling groceries to support the family. Since she first heard about Credit who provide loans to help poor entrepreneurs she has wanted to get a loan to earn extra profit. So now she will use the loan along with her savings to purchase a small truck. She will hire it out to earn an extra profit.

loans.use: Sim would like to purchase a small truck to rent out.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Mr. Pon E. lives in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mr. Pon E. is a 42 year old father of three: one of whom is a construction worker, while the other two are enrolled in school. Mr. Pon E. is a construction worker and a farmer, while his wife, Mrs. Than Lach, owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup for breakfast. His rice field has infertile soil therefore Mr. Pon E. is requesting a loan to buy more fertilizers. With the rest of the money, he would hire a laborer with a pump to water his field. Previously, Mr. Pon E. obtained a loan from AMK to start his wife's restaurant business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and hire a laborer

loans.name: Kuv

texts.en: Kuv L., 54, is a widow and has six children. She works selling a variety of fruits. She has a big stand and some small sellers always come to get the fruits from her store for re-sell. On average, she makes $10 a day. One of her children has a business running a motor taxi and another one is a fruit selller.  Kuv would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to distribute fruits to her customers.

loans.use: Kuv would like to purchase a motorbike to transfer fruits.

loans.name: Sokhamarith

texts.en: Mr. Sokhamarith P., father of four, lives in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Both he and his wife, Mrs. Mon Kim, are vegetable farmers. Aside from this business, he also works as a soldier.  His plantation currently faces a problems because he does not have enough money to hire a laborer with cows to plow his field and cultivate his potatoes. Mr. Sokhamarith P. would like a loan to hire a labourer with the necessary equipment and skills. Previously, Mr. Sokhamarith P. obtained a loan to buy watermelon seeds to cultivate on his field.

loans.use: To hire a laborer

loans.name: Khat

texts.en: Khat S. is a vendor selling drinking water and soft drinks on a stand around the ferry station and earns about $3 each day. Her husband (in the photo) is a driver and makes about $4 per day. This couple has two children and they are too young to attend school. Since they first heard about Credit they wanted a loan to purchase a motorbike to run a taxi business. Her husband will use the motor to earn an additional income when he is free from driving a car.

loans.use: Khat would like to purchase a motor-taxi for her husband to run part time.

loans.name: Ton

texts.en: Mrs. Ton M. is a villager in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She currently works in the rice plantation and pig breeding business, while her husband, Mr. Yeng Yim, is a subsistence farmer. Mrs. Ton M.’ plantation business has insufficient draft animals, thus, she is requesting a loan to buy a new cow to use as a draft animal. Mrs. Ton M. has five children: three are working as construction workers; while two attend school.  Previously, Mrs. Ton M. obtained a loan to start her pig breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a new cow to add with the previous one to use as a draft animal.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong S. and her husband have a business selling second-hand clothes and their combined income is around $5 each day. This couple has five children, two of whom are helping their parents sell clothes and the rest are students. Since they first heard about Credit from their neighbors they decided to take out a loan to increase their clothes inventory and the leftover will be used to buy land to resell.

loans.use: Hong would like to purchase more inventory for their second-hand clothing store.

loans.name: Hen

texts.en: Mrs. Hen H. is a villager in Tei Buon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She currently works in a bamboo selling business, while her husband, Mr. Mi Yu, is a horse-cart driver. They have two children: one is attending a local school while the youngest is too young to work or enroll in school. Although Mrs. Hen H. and her husband have two business activities, they are only able to generate a small income that is insufficient to improve their living conditions. Thus, Mrs. Hen H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to start a motorcycle-taxi business.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to use as a motorcycle-taxi business.

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Hak K., 44, lives with her niece in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She owns a generator which serves to recharge all the batteries in the village. People living in the village depend on batteries to power their lighting, television…etc. On average, she makes $10 each day. Her niece knows some computer programs and can install songs onto hand phones. After Mrs. Hak receives her loan, she would like to loan some money to help purchase a computer for her niece to set songs onto hand phones for other people and charge them for it. This will give them extra profit to support the family.

loans.use: Hak would like to purchase a computer to set a song.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en: Thou S., age 38, has a business with her husband collecting recyclable items and reselling them to the recycling plant. They earn around $6.20 each day. This couple has four children, two of whom are students. Since they know they can take out a loan from Credit which has a low interest and long term repayment, they would like a loan to purchase a motorbike to transfer the recyclable items.

loans.use: Thou would like to purchase a motorbike to transfer recyclable items.

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Eang C., 47, is the mother of six children and sells fruits and groceries in front of her house. She makes about $3.70 each day. Her husband has been a farmer since 1980 and normally he earns $2 a day. One child is married and lives away from home; two are garment workers; and two are students. To meet her high demand of selling fruits and groceries, she would like a loan to add more stuff to sell. The left over money will be used to buy wood to repair her leaking roof.

loans.use: Eang would like to add more groceries and fruits for sale at her home.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Chuon S., 35, earns around $6 a day from her grocery. In the village there are only a few people who run the same business as her. That is why there are a lot of customers who support her. Her husband is a worker digging wells inside and outside the village. On average, he makes around $10 a day but he has to share this money with the other workers who work with him. This couple has one child.
To save some money Mrs. S. would like a loan to purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.use: Chuon would like to purchase groceries in bulk for her stall.

loans.name: Abdurakhmon

texts.en:
Abdurakhmon D. is 48 years old. He is married with four children. His wife is a housekeeper. Abdurakhmon runs a farm. He has worked in agriculture for fourteen years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. His two older sons help him with the business.

On part of his plot he is growing wheat, rice, barley and different kinds of vegetables according to the season. On average every year, he grows 5 tons of wheat, 2 tons of rice and 1.5 tons of barley.

The business is stable and generates the main source of income for the family. However, this business requires lots of effort and input. Now it is the growing season and Abdurakhmon wants to grow wheat, rice and barley. Thus, he now needs to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 600 for a term of 7 months.

Abdurakhmon thanks all supporting him and he promises to be accurate with the loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Chhon

texts.en: Chhon S., 29, is a garment worker and earns $2 each day. Her husband is a member of stage performance in the village. They have a young child. Even though both husband and wife are profitable they still cannot support their family. So right now Chhon and her husband would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to run their business. This will give them extra profit to provide for their family.

loans.use: Chhon would like to purchase a motorbike to run her business.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.en:
Zafar K. is 34 years old. He is married with four children. His wife is an obstetrician at the central hospital. Zafar is a market vendor. He sells trousers, shirts, ties and other clothes for men at the local market.

Over 14 years of working at the market, Zafar already has got enough experience to do his work successfully and has clients who always come to him. Zafar is trying to satisfy the needs of any clients with various tastes and income levels. He works very hard to give his beloved children a good education and to make them happy.

Today Zafar is planning to increase his working capital in order to purchase summer goods for re-sale. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 700 for the term of 5 months.

Zafar promises to repay the loan promptly and thanks all supporting him. Be an important part of the growth of Zafar’s business! Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing goods for re-sale

loans.name: Chhoin

texts.en: Chhoin K. Soy, 54, works selling VCD, music Discs and tapes from herhome. She sells many kind of VCD and many people always come to buy the Discs from her home. Her husband has been a carpenter since 1991. He makes many kinds of chairs, tables and beds. On average, he earns $10/day. They have four children, two of who are married and live away from home. The business of selling VCD, music Discs and tapes is doing well so they request a loan in order to purchase more inventory for sale.

loans.use: To purchase more VCD, music Discs and tapes.

loans.name: Momo

texts.en:
Momo K. is 46 years old. She is married with five children. Her husband is a worker but his income is not sufficient to support the family. Thus, ten years ago, Momo began selling clothing. As she had always liked sales, it went well after the business was started, and she has continued selling clothing since then.

With the profit from her business, she takes care of her beloved children. As a rule Momo travels to the neighboring town, Istaravshan, to purchase new goods. She tries to choose merchandise of good quality and attractive prices which allows her to keep her clientele.

In July Momo is planning her next trip to Bishkek. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 for the term of 12 months. She will spend the loan money on new summer goods for kids and women. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of her children. With your help this will be possible. Momo promises to pay the loan on time and thanks everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchasing new summer clothing for kids to increase the range of goods she offers

loans.name: Hammat

texts.en:
Mr. Hammat Y. and his wife, Mrs. Srifas Mat, who live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, have been married for nine years and have one daughter in school and three more who are still too young and stay home.

Mr. Hammat and his wife have been fishing since they were young. However, fishing is not allowed during the season when fish lay their eggs. Therefore, the couple is creating another business of buying recycleable materials from villagers for resale to middlemen, who then take the items to Phnom Penh for sale.

Mr. Hammat is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase recycling materials for resale.

loans.use: To invest in a recycling business.

loans.name: Roeung

texts.en:
Miss Roeung N., 50, is single and she lives with her elderly mother and her sister’s family on an Island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Miss Roeung has been a silk weaver since 1979, having acquired the skill from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes the material to sell in Phnom Penh.

Miss Roeung is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk thread to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk thread for weaving

loans.name: Sdaeng

texts.en:
Sdaeng S., age 33, works collecting items in the village and sells them to  the factory for recycling. She makes on average around $10 in revenue each day. Her husband opened a small stand selling fruits. He earns $4.40 per day. They have three children, two of whom are students and one is too young to attend the school. 
Sdaeng’s husband now requests a loan from Kiva to purchase more fruits to sell in large amounts. This will allow him to makes more income (Mrs. Sdaeng is pictured with her husband at home)

loans.use: To sell fruits in large amounts.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mrs. Yan C., 50, is a widow who lives on an Island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has six children, two sons and four daughters. One of her sons is married and lives outside the family home. One of her daughters has full time employment in Phnom Penh and the other three weave silk at home. The youngest son attends a local school.

Mrs. Yan has been a silk weaver since 1983, when she learned the skill from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes the material to sell in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Yan is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase silk thread to continue her weaving business and zinc roofing for her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk thread for weaving and zinc roofing

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokha S., 43, is a widow with two daughters. Her first daughter is a garment factory worker and the younger one is in school. The family lives along National Road Number Five, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sokha has been selling lotus flowers, meatballs, and boiled eggs for seven years. She buys lotus flowers from her village to sell at market in Phnom Penh and sells meatballs and boiled eggs in the village. She is requesting a loan of US$500 to install a handrail in her house and to connect the house to potable water.

loans.use: To purchase home improvements.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram M. is 31 years old. He is married with four children. Two of his children attend a local school and the other two are still too young to attend school. However, Murod says the two older brothers are already teaching the younger ones the basics and they are already looking forward to going to school.

For the last 9 years, Akram has been in the business of baking the national bread called “lepeshka”. Akram is the main bread-winner in the family, but his wife helps him when it is possible. He has someone who supplies him with necessary materials at wholesale prices. Over the years, Akram has found customers who buy in bulk, usually buying the “lepeshka” for their cafes and restaurants. At the same time Akram runs a booth located in the central market of the city.

Today Akram is applying for a loan for the first time. He is planning to purchase ingredients such as flour and coal for baking extra national breads as he has big orders for them.

With this purpose in mind, Akram is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 1000 for the term of 12 months. Akram would like to thank everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing coal and flour required for baking the national bread, “lepeshka”

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun H., 57, and her husband, Mr. Sean Sou, 61, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1969 and have six sons. Four of the sons are married and live outside the family home; the other two have full-time employment.

Mrs. Saroeun and her husband have been farming for 39 years. They grow rice on their farm, far from their house. In addition, Mr. Sean is also a carpenter. Saroeun is requesting a loan of US$250 to purchase rice seed and to pay fees for plowing and transplanting rice seedlings.

loans.use: To finance the next rice crop

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Ven P. , 39, is a farmer and that make less than $1.00/day. Growing rice is a very unpredictable business that is very dependent on the weather and rains. Her husband is the key person who earns money to raise the family. He works as a taxi driver and earns $5 each day. This couple has four children, one of whom is married; two work as a garment workers.
Ven’s husband now would like a loan from Kiva to fix his car. The car is the main finance resource for the family.

loans.use: To fix a car.

loans.name: Veasna

texts.en:
Mrs. Veasna H., 49, and her husband, Mr. Yorn Phai, live on an Island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have seven children, three sons and four daughters. One of the daughters is married and lives outside the family home, while the other three weave silk at home. All of their sons attend a local school.

Mrs. Veasna has been a silk weaver since she was young, a skill she learned from her mother. Mr. Yorn is also a silk weaver. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes their material to sell in Phnom Penh. They have three looms in the family's weaving business.

Mrs. Veasna is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase silk thread to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk thread for weaving.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim S. is 43 years old. He is married with 5 children; the eldest is 20, and the youngest is only 7 years old. Karim manufactures carved wooden doors, window frames, and partitions in the traditional oriental style to order. He has been in this business for 25 years already. Over this period, Karim has become a real expert in his business and has a lot of clients. Since he has a lot of clients and demand, the business is very successful and brings in a stable and significant income, allowing Karim to improve living conditions for his family. Just now Karim has a big order for window frames and doors.

Thus, today Karim is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 950 to purchase input materials for his manufacturing business. The previous loan was managed by Karim without problems, and he promises to repay the current one on time. Karim is counting on your help and he expresses his gratitude to everyone for their support.

loans.use: Purchasing of input materials for manufacturing wooden window frames and doors

loans.name: Eoeun

texts.en:
Eoeun P., age 58, is a stay at home housewife that looks after her children and cooks food for her entire family. She is a disabled woman, who lost one leg.  Her husband, Mr. Moeun Chhorn, 44, has been  a construction foreman since 1984. He has a few workers and sometime his group does  construction outside of the the village. Normally he makes $7 each day. This couple has three children, two of whom are married and live away from home. The child that lives with his parents is a construction worker that builds  houses like his father.
The family faces a problem with the leaking roof, so they would like to loan from Kiva to purchase wood to repair it. This will allow the family to have a stable house during the raining season. (Mrs. Eoeun P. is pictured with her husband at home)

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair a leaking roof.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa S. is 45 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of five children of school age. Hanifa sells vegetables such as carrots, potatoes, onions and others at the central local market. She has been in this business for 15 years already. Over this long period, Hanifa had acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, she knows how to store the vegetables so that they keep their marketable condition and do not lose their flavor and useful properties.

Being located in the biggest central market, Hanifa's business has a faithful clientele and generates a stable income, allowing her to support her family. Today she is requesting US$ 700 for the term of 12 months. Hanifa plans to spend the loan purchasing vegetables in order to increase the range of goods she sells. She would like to thank all for supporting her and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Purchasing vegetables in order to expand her inventory

loans.name: Tun

texts.en:
Tun C., 54, grows crops on farmland located behind her house. She earns approximately $6.50 per day from the sale of her crops. Her husband, Svay Chun, sells firewood around the village. They have five children, all of whom are married, and they live in Dondeav Village, Siem Reap Province.

Tun C. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase two oxen to use to transport firewood for her husband's business. She hopes that the purchase of these oxen will improve working conditions and allow them to increase their household income to better provide for their family.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen to use for her husband's business

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn P., age 34, is a mother of six children and lives with her husband in the town of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling roasted eggs. Before they roast the eggs they make a small whole and pour out the insides, then mix it with some ingredients like sugar, pepper and salt. After they mix it, they pour everything back into the egg shell and then roast it. This kind of food is very popular among Cambodian people. It is not expensive but it is delicious. On average, she makes $2/day. Her husband is a farmer and earns around $1 each day. One child is a construction worker that  builds houses and other has a business selling eggs like her mother. 

As selling eggs is lucrative , Mrs. Phorn would like to request a loan to purchase a motorbike with a trailer to sell eggs outside of her  village. This will allow her to sell more eggs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike with a trailer.

loans.name: Seam

texts.en:
Seam S., 29, drives a motorcycle-taxi, earning approximately $5 per day. His wife grows crops on the farmland behind her house and earns approximately $3 per day from the sale of her crops. They have three children, all of whom are not yet of age to attend school. The family lives in Dondeav Village, Siem Reap Province.

Mr. S. is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase a new motorcycle for his taxi service. He hopes that the motorcycle that he purchases with the loan will enable him to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for his taxi service

loans.name: Bibirajab

texts.en:
Bibirajab S. is 48 years old. She is a widow and the loving mother of three children. Bibirajab has almost never had anyone's assistance in helping her children get ahead, so for 11 years, she has been selling the national bread, “lepeshka,” in the local market. This has been her only income to support and educate her children, and it has not been easy for her to have the entire responsibility for her family. But her love for her children is what drives her forward from day to day. She believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. That is why Bibirajab’s business is rather successful and stable; she has had her bulk buyers for many years already which allows her to have a stable income for her family.

Today Bibirajab is requesting a loan in the amount of 3400 Somoni (US$ 1000) as she is planning to purchase more “lepeshka” in order to enlarge her range of goods. Bibirajab promises to pay the loan in a timely manner over a term of 12 months. The well-being of this brave woman and her children is in your hands.

loans.use: Purchasing more  “lepeshka”  in order to enlarge her range of goods

loans.name: Lor

texts.en:
Lor S., 46, sells Cambodian porridge and noodles from her house and earns around $ 3.30 per day. Her husband, Mr. Mat Sos, 47, earns around $5 per day growing crops behind their house. They have five children and live in Thlork Kambot Village, Siem Reap Province. All of their children are young and cannot generate any income.

Because she desires to increase their income, Lor S. is seeking a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase piglets to raise. The loan will help expand her business and increase the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Kiyomiddin

texts.en:
Kiyomiddin S. is 35 years old. He is married with four children, all being of school age.

Kiyomiddin sells cattle. As a rule he purchases calves in the central market, raises them, and then resells them at higher prices at the local market. Being in this business for 11 years now, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to raise them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning at five o’clock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate a stable and considerable income for his large family.

Today, knowing that the prices for the animals are not so high now, but will increase for sure, Kiyomiddin is planning to enlarge his stock and to purchase cows and calves. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 3400 Somoni (US$ 1000) for the term of 10 months. Kiyomiddin thanks all for trusting and supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: Purchasing cows and calves to expand the business

loans.name: Pin

texts.en:
Mrs. Pin V. E., 52, is an oxen merchant, working together with her husband. They travel around and purchase oxen, then resell the cattle for profit. Their combined income is approximately $8.80 per day. The couple has four children, two of whom are married. They live in Oreang Village, Kampong Thom Province.

They are requesting a loan of $1,000 to increase their working capital for their oxen business. The loan will allow them to have increased flexibility in the quantity of oxen which they purchase. They hope that the loan will allow them to expand their business and thereby increase their household income.

loans.use: To increase the working capital for their business buying and selling oxen

loans.name: Zarafo

texts.en: Zarafo T.  is 28 years old and she runs a beauty salon. At the salon she provides  various services such as hair styling, haircutting, manicure, and the services of a cosmetologist. At the same time, the salon provides wedding dresses and accessories for decorating the wedding car for hire. Zarafo's salon is quite successful and generates a stable income for the family. Now Zarafo is planning to purchase new wedding dresses and accessories for decorating the wedding car to rent out. With this purpose in mind,  she is requesting a loan in the amount of 3400 Somoni (US$ 1000) for the term of 12 months. Zarafo thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: Purchasing wedding dresses and accessories for decorating the wedding car

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas C., 27, is a Cambodian noodle maker, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband works with her to make the noodles. They sell their noodles to other retailers in her area.

C. is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a noodle-making machine. She will use the remainder of the loan is to purchase piglets to raise and then sell for profit at local markets. The loan will allow her to increase her noodle production and hopefully expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a noodle-making machine

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun A. has a business selling a variety of groceries in the village since 2004. She has one of the biggest stalls which is why she has many customers. She can make $5 of profit per day. Her husband Ket Thul works collecting resin (rubber tree) and sell it to the rubber plant near his house. On average, he earns around $5/day. This couple has two children, one who is a student and another is too young to attend school.

To meet her customer’s demands and to add more inventory to sell in large amounts she would like a loan from Kiva to purchase groceries in bulk. Bulk purchases will save her some money. Any remaining monies will be used to purchase wood to repair her house, especially the leaking roof which is very difficult in the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk and repair the house.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas C. Lim and her husband raise ducks to produce eggs. Together they earn approximately $6 per day from the sale of these duck eggs. She raises the ducks behind her house in Toul Damnak Village, Kampong Thom Province.

C. is requesting a loan in the amount of $500 to purchase duck food to feed the ducks she raises.

loans.use: To purchase duck food for her ducks

loans.name: Uch

texts.en:
Mrs. Uch N., 62, sells pieces of wood that she scavenges from the nearby forest. Her husband and two sons work with her in this business. Their combined income is approximately $3 per day. They live together in Tropeangtrom Village, Kampong Thom Province.

Because of desiring to expand her business, Uch N. is requesting a loan of $1,100 to purchase a trailer to transport the wood they collect. This trailer will allow her and her family to collect more wood and more easily transport that wood to their sales destinations. They hope that this improvement to their business will allow them to expand and thereby increase their family income.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to transport the wood they collect

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mr. Touch T., 55, is a motorcycle taxi driver, earning approximately $5.80 per day. His wife, Mrs. Mao Rat, is a farmer. They have six children, two of whom are married. The family lives in Toul Sangke village, Kampong Thom Province.

T. is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase a bull to provide stud services to other cattle businesses. The loan will allow him to start a new business to supplement his family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a bull to provide stud services to other cattle businesses

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Ty S. T., a 58-year-old woman, has seven children and works as a farmer. She started planting rice in 2004 but her farming is just to feed the family. Her husband is a horse-cart driver in the village and, on average, he earns $4/day.
The family is in a financial crisis due to inflation. Their income used to be able to support the family's daily expenses but inflation in recent months make all the basics like groceries, gas, rice and everything more expensive. To earn an extra profit, this couple would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a small tractor to plow the farmland and to rent  the tractor to the other farmers who have no cow or small tractor to plow the land.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor for farming and renting to others.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin C., age 45, is a mother of seven children and lives with her husband in the town of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Mrs. Rin and her husband own a plot of land growing rice to feed the family. When they produce more output they can sell some rice to earn some money. There is no irrigation so the farmers are completely dependent on the rains.If there is not enough rain the rice crops will be damaged. Two of their children are married and live away from home; two others are garment workers and earn $50 each a month.

To earn an income that is not so dependent on the rains, Mrs. Rin and her husband would like a loan from Kiva to raise ducks for sale.

loans.use: To raise ducks for sale.

loans.name: Eam

texts.en:
Eam E., age 33, has been farming rice to feed her family since 1992. She never has enough output for resale in the market. Her husband works collecting palm juice to refine into sugar palm. Palm juice and sugar palm are popular among Cambodian people especially since it is affordable. This couple has three children and all of them are too young to attend school.

The family is in a financial crisis due to inflation, so they request a loan from Kiva in order to purchase a motor taxi to operate for extra income.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng C., age 20, works collecting rubber for resale to the factory. Normally she makes $5 each day. Her husband works as a blacksmith and earns $2.70 a day. They have two young children and an older mother and father live with them.

Mrs. Heng would like to apply for a loan from Kiva to purchase more rubber for resale and any remaining money will be used to complete the construction of their home. (Heng's husband is pictured behind the incomplete construction)

loans.use: To purchase more rubber for resale and any remaining money will be used to complete the construction of their home.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Son

texts.en:
Mrs. Son H., 27, sells fish in the market, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband, Mr. Toeung Tearum, is a 33-year-old fisherman and earns approximately $6 per day. They have four children, all of whom are young and live at home with the family in Porpy Village, Kampong Thom Province.

H. is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle and trailer to use for their businesses and for family transportation. This purchase will enable the couple to expand their business as well as improve their quality of life. (The picture is H.'s husband.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and trailer to use for their businesses and for family transportation

loans.name: Peng

texts.en:
Peng H., 36, is married with three children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has been a rice dealer since 2004. She goes from house to house to collect rice until she has a large stock of rice to resell at the market. She earns approximately $4 each day. Her husband is a construction worker that builds houses.  He sometimes has to go out of the village to find construction work. On average, he makes $5. One child is a construction worker like his father.

Peng’s husband would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to commute to work and also run a motor-taxi business whenever he has time off from construction.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo N., 34, sells fish in her local market, earning around $5 per day. Her husband, Mr. Tal Ton, 38, purchases fish from around the village to sell in the market. They have four children, all of whom are living in the family home in Porpy Village, Kampong Thom Province.

N. is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase a boat to use for her husband’s business. She will use the remainder of the loan to purchase additional fish for re-sale. The loan will allow them to expand their businesses and thereby increase their family income.

loans.use: To purchase a boat to use for her husband’s business

loans.name: Dum

texts.en:
Dum S., 58, is a married mother who works as farmer. She makes around $1.00 each day. Her husband farms vegetables and everyday he earns approximately  $1.50 by selling those vegetables in the market. They have four children and all of them have their own businesses that help support the family.

Her husband always brings vegetable to sell in the market by motor-taxi so that he can save time. He would like to apply for a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike with a trailer to transfer vegetables to the market. Any remaining money will be used to purchase more farmland to grow more vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike with a trailer and additional land to grow crops.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Mrs. Pen S. A., 47, raises ducks and pigs from her house. Her husband, Mr. Prum Thou, works with his wife in this business. They live with three daughters in Prasat Village, Kampong Thom Province. Their daughters are garment workers and use their income help to support the family’s expenses. 

S. A. requests a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional ducklings and piglets. She will use the remainder of the loan for duck and pig food. This loan will expand her pig and duck business and increase her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase additional ducklings and piglets and duck and pig food

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Mrs. Yean V., 28, is a weaver, earning $10 per day. Mr. Kheng Veasna helps his wife with her weaving. They have two children and live in Chaktubat Village, Kampong Thom Province. 

V. requests a loan of $500 to purchase a loom for her weaving business. The loom will allow her to increase her production and thereby expand her business. (The picture is V.'s husband.)

loans.use: To purchase a loom for a weaving business

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Ith L., age 58, is a mother of four children, three of who are married and live away from home; and one child who is not married lives at home and farms to support the family. Mrs. Ith, and her husband, have been  tailors since 2003. They make silk dresses that are very expensive. People wear silk dresses during the Khmer traditional ceremony, wedding and other main ceremonies. These dresses normally cost around $50 to $80 and it takes the couple 10 days to make each one. 

Now she would like a loan from Kiva to purchase a hem machine and more silk to make more dresses.

loans.use: To purchase a hem machine and more silk to make more dresses.

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey K., age 54, has four children and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband work growing rice on a plot of land and their average profit is about $2.50 each day. Last year she had less output because of the drought. This year there is less rice stock in the market because most of farmers sold their output to neighboring countries like Vietnam. 

Now they would like a loan from Kiva to purchase another plot of land to grow more rice to support the family and for resale.

loans.use: To purchase another plot of land to grow more rice.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Esther M.

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 54 year-old Esther M..  She is a widow and has three children ages 19,24 and 30. She also has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans.  In 2006, Esther  has established a grocery business. She opens her business seven days a week from  nine to twelve hours a day. She is assisted by her  children. Esther  requires a loan in order to buy more soft drinks. She thanks you for your support.  

It is said that Coca Cola® is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa, there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guiness (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Since 2000,  Prum T. has had a business selling a variety of vegetables in a busy market. She brings vegetables from the farm and resells them at the market. She typically makes around $3.50 each day. Her husband is a construction worker building houses and he is also a farmer. On average he makes $1.50 each day. This couple has five children, two who are students and one is employed as a garment worker.

The family would like a loan to purchase wood to repair their leaking roof. This will provide them a stable house. (husband is pictured at the farmland)

loans.use: They hope to use this loan to repair their leaking roof.

loans.name: Katherine N.

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 33 year-old Katherine M..  She is married and has three children ages 7,4 and 2. In 2002, Katherine has established a fruits business. She opens her business two days a week for  five to eight hours a day. She is assisted by her husband. Katherine requires a loan in order to buy more stock of bananas. She thanks you for your support.  

When you walk down the streets of Mbeya, you are greeted at almost every corner by a stall or wheelbarrow full of mangoes, pineapples, bananas or sugarcane. Katherine is one such seller of this luscious fruit and thanks you for the support she needs to continue and expand.

loans.use: To buy more stock of bananas.

loans.name: Nang

texts.en: Mrs. Nang T., a 30 year old widow with three children, lives in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. One of her children is a taxi driver, another attends school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study. Mrs. Nang T. is currently in the fish sales business. Despite multiple incomes from family members, her family does not have sufficient income to invest in a rice field. As the value of rice fields is rising, she would like to invest in order to re-sell in the future at a better price. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a portion of rice field.

loans.use: To buy a rice field in order to re-sell it later for a better price.

loans.name: Lydia B.

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 28 year-old Lydia K..  She is not married but she has  one child, aged 12. In 2006, Lydia established her crops business. Working six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $40 every month from this business. She is assisted by her brother. Lydia requires a loan in order to buy additional stock of maize in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement

loans.use: To buy additional stock of maize in bulk.
