loans.name: Keang

texts.en:
Mrs. Keang P., 42 year old mother of six, lives in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. One of her children is a taxi driver, while four others are studying in state school. She currently sells vegetables, while her husband, Mr. Nhim Keo, is a subsistence farmer. Mr. Nhim Keo’s plantation can earn a small revenue because he owns a small rice field. At present, her economical situation is dire because her husband has appendicitis and he will need an operation costing $375.

Mrs. Keang P. is asking for a loan to buy more land in order to increase her husband's rice plantation revenue. Previously, Mrs. Keang P. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a calf for breeding.

loans.use: To buy more land in order to increase her husband rice plantation revenue.

loans.name: Nelusigwe A.

texts.en:
Hello  from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Nelusigwe M..  She is married, and has five children between ages 2 and 14. She also has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans.  In 1992, Nelusigwe established her fruits business. Nelusigwe requires a loan in order to buy more fruits & a cow for milk. She thanks you for your support.  

When you walk down the streets of Mbeya, you are greeted at almost every corner by a stall or wheelbarrow full of mangoes, pineapples, bananas or sugarcane. Nelusigwe is one such seller of this luscious fruit and thanks you for the support she needs to continue and expand.

loans.use: To buy more fruits & a cow for milk.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun Y., age 51, is married with six children and resides with her husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To support the family, she has worked selling groceries in the village since 1998 and earns around $2.50/day. Her husband is a cow dealer. He normally makes $5 per day. Four children are married and live away from home; one daughter is employed as a garment worker in Phnom Penh City.

Bun would like a loan from Kiva to purchase more groceries in order to meet her customer demands. This will allow her make more money to help raise the family. The rest of the money will b used to help  purchase another cow for resale. (Bun and her husband are pictured together)

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and a cow for resale

loans.name: Vich

texts.en: Mrs. Vich L. is a vegetable farmer in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a 32 year old mother of three: two of whom are attending school, while another is too young to work or study. Lately, her vegetables have been continually destroyed by roaming poultry and cattle; thus, Mrs. Vich L. has decided to ask for a loan to build a fence to protect her crop from poultry and cattle. Her husband, Mr. Mao Bun is a construction worker who earns a small income.  Previously, Mrs. Vich L. obtained a loan from AMK to buy pigs for breeding.

loans.use: To build a fence to protect crop from poultry and cattle.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: Mrs. Khon C., 30 years old, lives in Kngoak Pong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a mother of seven: two are employed in a garment factory; three are attending school; and two remain at home because they are too young to work or study. She is a subsistence farmer, while her husband, Mr. Hom Hoeurng, sells firewood door to door. Unfortunately, Mr. Hom Hoeurng now has malaria and Mrs. Khon C. does not have enough money to cover health care for her husband. Thus, Mrs. Khon C. has decided to ask for a loan to acess the necessary medical attention required to help her husband regain his health and continue his business activity.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to cure her husband disease.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban C., age 35, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province. To help support the family, she has been selling coffee from a small shop since 2000, earning around $3 per day. Her husband is a veterinarian in the village. They have five children and all of them are students.
This couple requests a loan to be used for raising pigs and to purchase more veterinary drugs.  (husband is pictured alone)

loans.use: To raise pigs and purchase veterinary drugs.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Mrs. Heang I. is a subsistence farmer in Kngoak Pong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. At 40 years old, she is a mother of six: one who is employed in a garmet factory; three are enrolled in school; and two remain too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeurn Chhorn, is a taxi driver whose car requires repair work. Mrs. Heang I. would like to ask for a loan in order to fix her husband's car and maintain his business.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to fix the car in order to run her husband business.

loans.name: Anne T.

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 43 year-old Anne M..  She is married, and has five children between ages  7 and 22. In 1998, Anne established her fire wood business. Working six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $260 every month from this business. She is assisted by her casual workers. Anne has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy a large amount of firewood. In the future, Anne plans to open another new business. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy a large amount of firewood.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en: Mrs. Samnang S. lives in Kngoak Pong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. At 27 years old, she is a mother of four: two attend a local school, while the younger two stay at home. Mrs. Samnang S. works as both a subsistence farmer and a firewood seller.  She works together with her husband, Mr. Thoeurn Than, who collects firewood which she then sells. Mrs. Samnang S. plans to build a new house, however she does not have enough money to buy timber. She would like to ask for a loan to purchase timber in order to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy timbers in order to build a new house.

loans.name: Dorn

texts.en:
Dorn P., age 26, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer and typically earns about $2.30 each day. Her husband, Keo Rath, 22, raises ducks for eggs and sells them to the market to earn around $10 each day. This couple has a young child.
Raising ducks is the main income for the family, so Keo would like a loan to raise many more ducks. (Dorn is pictured at the duck farm)

loans.use: To raise more ducks.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov E. lives in Kngoak Pong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is currently in rice plantation business. She is 44 and a widow with five childrE., two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another one is enrolled in school. The others are too young to work or study. One of her childrE. now has hepatitis and Mrs. Pov E. does not have enough money to get cured. Thus, she asked for a loan to cure her child.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to cure her child  disease.

loans.name: Sista S.

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Sista W..  She is married and has four children between the ages of  1 and 10. In 2007, Sista established her crops business. Sista requires a loan in order to buy more stock of rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Lor

texts.en:
Mrs. Lor L., 33, earns money by raising pigs and by cooking and selling Cambodian cake. She can earn about $5 per day from these activities. Her husband earns around $5.80 per day growing crops. L. has two children and lives in Pong Ror Village, Siem Reap Province. 

She requests a loan of $1,000 to expand her pig-raising business by buying additional piglets to raise. This will increase her income.

loans.use: To expand pig-raising business

loans.name: Vin

texts.en: Mrs. Vin P. is a subsistence farmer in Kngoak Pong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  She is a 25 year old mother of two children, both of whom are too young to work or attend school. Her husband, Mr. Ry Sao, is currently a farmer and firewood seller. Mrs. Vin P. does not have draft animals to plow her rice plantation since her cows are too small. For this reason, Mrs. Vin P. has decided to ask for a loan to exchange her small cows with big ones to be used as draft animals. Previously, Mrs. Vin P. obtained a loan from AMK to buy a cow cart to transport fertilizers in order to improve the yield of her field.

loans.use: To exchange her small cows with big ones to be used as draft animals

loans.name: Nikutusya K.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Nikutusya M.. She is married and has four children aged between 2 and 10. In 2005, Nikutusya established her rice-selling business. Working four days a week, and one to four hours a day, she earns about US $40 every month from this business. Nikutusya requires a loan in order to buy additional stock of rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Thouk L. grows crops behind her house, earning approximately $2 per day. Her son, Mr. Phon Phal, is a 27-year-old motorcycle taxi driverwho earns approximately $5 per day. He lives with his mother in Thlork Kambot Village, Siem Reap Province. 

L. requests a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorcycle for her son to drive for his taxi service. A new motorcycle will enable her son to attract more customers and lower his costs over the long term..

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle for her son to drive for his taxi service

loans.name: Magreth N.

texts.en:
hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 39 year-old Magreth M..  She is widow who has two children aged 16 and 19. She has one other dependent, who lives with her because he is orphan. In 2005, Magreth established her hair salon business. Magreth has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more  cosmetics and different hair fashions. She thanks you for your support.  


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more stock cosmetics and different hair fasion.

loans.name: Tetwas P.

texts.en:
hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30 year-old Tetwas M..  She is married, and has four children between ages 3 and 10. In 2004, Tetwas established her grocery business. Working seven days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $130 every month from this business. Tetwas requires a loan in order to buy additional  stocks of beer. She thanks you for your support.  

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy additional  stocks of beer.

loans.name: Elizabeth C.

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 32 year-old Elizabeth M..  She is a widow who has two children aged 4 and 10. She has one other dependent who lives with her because he is orphan. In 2006, Elizabeth established her used clothing business. Elizabeth requires a loan in order to buy more used clothing. She thanks you for your support.  

Second-hand clothes journey across the oceans from America and Europe, and are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets of Dar es Salaam and the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything western or modern. Many people argue that the popularity of the West’s cast-offs is damaging the local cloth and garment industry. There are many people who still appreciate the beauty of traditional Tanzanian dress, however the growing market in used clothing and its importance to many micro-entrepreneurs cannot be denied.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr:
Mrs. Elisabeth K. is 45 years old and is originally from the town Ganvie, one of the best known in Benin. She is married and the mother of six, the oldest of which, Jean, is 17 years old and is in high school. A true survivor, Mrs. K. works in the field of sales since a very young age when her mother initiated her in the business. However, she has only recently begun her sales of motor oil 3 years ago. She has also become very well known in her district. She also sells fish. She is requesting her first loan with Alide to expand her economic activities. Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.


Agée de 45 ans, Dame K. Elisabeth est originaire du village lacustre le plus connu du Bénin, Ganvié. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants dont le premier, Jean, 17 ans, est en classe de 4ème. Vraiment une battante, Dame K., est dans le domaine de la revente depuis sa tendre enfance où elle a été initiée par sa mère. Mais, elle s’est engagée dans l’achat et la revente d’huile à moteur depuis 3 ans ; elle en est devenue une grossiste reconnue dans son quartier. Elle vend également du poisson. Elle vient solliciter son premier prêt à ALIDé pour étendre ses activités.

loans.use: To purchase six 50 liter drums of motor oil.

loans.name: Joyce S.

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 33 year-old Joyce F..  She is married, and has two children ages 8 and 14. She has two other dependents, who live with her because they are orphans.  In 2005, Joyce  established her genge business. Working six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $40 every month from this business. She is assisted by her husband. Joyce  requires a loan in order to buy oil,tomatoes,salt,fish,soaps,sugar and rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.  

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy oil,tomatoes,salt,fish,soaps,sugar and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Joisi M.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Joisi Z..  She is married, and has four children between ages  12 and 22. In 2005, Joisi established her genge business. She opens her business six days a week, nine to twelve hours a day. She is assisted by her husband. Joisi requires a loan in order to buy oil,tomatoes,salt,soaps,sugar and rice in bulk.. She thanks you for your support.  

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chili, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy oil,tomatoes,salt,soaps,sugar and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Justine B. is 41 years old, she is married and the mother of 4, the oldest of which is 17 and is named Bamidele. She has developed her distribution and sales of diverse products for a decade now. In the beginning she had problems financing her little business. To find a way out of this situation and to improve her display as well as better satisfy customer demand, she is asking for her third loan.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Agée de 41 ans, Dame B. Justine est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont l’aîné a 17ans et s’appelle Bamidélé. Il y a maintenant une décennie qu’elle évolue dans le domaine de la distribution et de la vente de divers articles de grande consommation. Au départ, elle a connu des difficultés notamment sur le plan financier. Afin de trouver une porte de sortie à cette situation et de renforcer son étalage et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle elle vient solliciter son troisième prêt.

loans.use: To purchase 4 cartons of soap, 2 cartons of cosmetic products and one carton of canned foods.

loans.name: Aida A.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Aida K.. She is married and has three children aged 7,10, and 12. In 2007, Aida established her crops business. Aida requires a loan in order to buy more crops in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more crops in bulk.

loans.name: Joicy D.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Joicy M.. She is married and has five children aged between 2 and 14. She has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans. In 2005, Joicy established her genge business (a type of outdoor stall). She opens her business seven days a week and nine to twelve hours a day. She is assisted by her husband. Joicy requires a loan in order to buy oil, tomatoes, salt, soaps, sugar, and rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy oil, tomatoes, salt, soaps, sugar, and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Orzigul

texts.ru:
Orzigul S. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 39 years old, widowed and has one child. She finished high school. For the past seven years Orzigul has worked as a vendor at the local market in Tursun-zoda. She buys sweets wholesale and sells them retail. This work is the only source of income for her family. Now she would like to purchase goods but she does not have the money. Having discussed her situation with her family and friends, she decided to request a loan that she would repay in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Сафарова Орзигуль - жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 39 лет, вдова, имеет 1 ребенка. Образование среднее. Орзугуль вот уже 7 лет как торгует на местном рынке города Турсунзаде. Она закупает у оптовых поставщиков сладости и реализует в розницу. Этот вид деятельности является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. В данный момент она хочет закуть партию товара, но своих денег у нее нет. Посоветовавшись с близкими, она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of goods for sale

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Mrs. Long H., 42, makes and sells Cambodian noodles from her home. She earns approximately $1.43 per day from this activity. Her husband, Mr. Khe Kha, is 45-years-old. He drives a motorcycle-taxi, earning approximately $1.66 per day. They have four children, all of whom are young. One of their children helps Mrs. Long H. to make noodles during the day, and the other three attend school. Mrs. H. requests a loan of $150 to purchase rice, an ingredient used to make her noodles. She plans to use the remainder of her loan to purchase pigs, which she can raise and sell for profit at local markets. This loan will allow her to expand her business and help to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase rice, an ingredient used to make noodles

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru:
Muborak Rakhmonova lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is 40 years old, married and has 4 children. Muborak owns a small bakery and has over ten years of experience in baking bread. Her bakery is located in the center of the market, which gives people an opportunity to buy fresh bread at any time of the day. The development of this business would help Muborak to sustain her family. With the price of flour increasing, she decided to buy flour wholesale. This would allow her keeping the same prices. She plans to repay the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Рахмонова Муборак жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 40 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муборак имеет небольшой цех по выпечкe хлебобулочных изделий. Имеет опыт в этой деятельности более 10 лет. Ее цех находится в центре рынка, поэтому население имеет возможность покупать свежий хлеб в любое время суток. Наладив свой небольшой бизнес клиентка может содержать свою семью. В данное время растет цена на муку, поэтому клиентка решила закупить муку у оптовых поставщиков. Это позволит ей не поднимать цены на свою продукцию. Планирует погасить кредит в течениe 12 месяцев.

loans.use: purchase of flour

loans.name: Tan

texts.en: Tan B., is a 30-year-old ox merchant earning approximately $5.33 per day. His wife, Mrs. Khcheay Yea, is also 30. She produces rice wine and raises pigs, earning approximately $3.10 per day. They have three children, all are whom are young and in school. The family lives in Takork Kandal Village, Siem Reap Province. Mr. B. requests a loan of $1,000 to support his oxen business. He will use the remainder of the loan to start a new rice business. This loan will help him increase his family's income.

loans.use: To support his oxen business

loans.name: Umedahon

texts.ru:
Umedahon K. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 26 years old, is single and has a high school education. Umedahon lives with her elderly parents and this is why she needs to support her family. Umedahon has a sales location at a local market in Tursun-zoda. She sells children’s clothing and has been in this business for 8 years. Umedahon would like to increase her product assortment and needs money to do this. She has decided to take out a loan for a 15 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Кодирова Умедахон жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 26 лет , незамужем .Образование среднее. Умедахон живет с престарелыми родителями.Поэтому содержать свою семью приходится ей самой. Клиентка имеет торговую точку на местном рынке города Турсунзаде.Она торгует детской одеждой. Занимается этим бизнесом более 8 лет. Сейчас Умедахон хочет пополнить ассортимент своей торговой точки.Для чего ей необходимы деньги .Клиентка решила взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase clothing for sale

loans.name: Doung

texts.en: Mrs. Doung S., 33, sells groceries from her house and also grows crops. She earns approximately $3 per day from these activities. Her husband, Mr. Sun Seat, is 33 years old. He makes wine and raises pigs, earning approximately $4 per day. They have three children, all of whom are young and in school. The family lives in Kork Morn Village, Siem Reap Province. They request a loan of $600 to buy more grocery inventory and additional pigs to raise for sale in the market.

loans.use: To buy more grocery inventory and additional pigs to raise for sale in the market

loans.name: Choun

texts.en: Mr. Choun H., 51, farms and transports pieces of wood to sell around his village. He earns $5 per day. His wife, Mrs. Men Ravy, makes replacement roofing out of palm leaves, earning $1.20 per day. They have five children, one of whom is a wedding cook, one helps Mr. H. with his business, another is a garment worker, and last two attend school. They live in Salakorkoh Village, Siem Reap Province. Mr. H. requests a loan of $1,000 to buy farmland. This farmland will allow him to increase his income by growing more crops to sell them at the local market. (The picture is H.'s wife.)

loans.use: To buy farmland

loans.name: Morn

texts.en: Mr. Morn N. is 49 years-old. He makes and sells Cambodian noodles from his house, earning approximately $2.93 per day. His wife, Mrs. Dy Yan is 50 years-old. She farms and raises pigs, earning $1.33 per day. The couple has four children. Two of their children are married and the other two attend school. They request a loan of $300 to buy a motorcycle. This motorcycle will support their businesses by making transportation faster and more convenient. The motorcycle will also be helpful for family use. (The picture is N.'s wife)

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.ru:
Mukadas D. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 40 years old, is married and has 3 children. Mukadas sells chicken eggs at a local market in Tursun-zoda. She has been doing this for 18 years. Her business allows her to support her large family as her husband is currently in Russia. Right now, Mukadas would like to increase her working capital which is why she has applied for a loan. She has decided to take out a loan for 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Джумаева Мукадас жительница города Турсунзаде.Возраст 40 лет,замужем , имеет 3 детей. Мукадас торгует куринными яйцами на местном рынке города Турсунзаде.Занимается этой деятельностью более 18 лет. Бизнес позволяет ей содержать свою большую семью.Так как муж клиентки находится в России. В данное время Мукадас хочет увеличть денежный оборот.Для чего ей нужны деньги.Поэтому оан решила взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Narng

texts.en: Mrs. Narng P. is 42 years-old. She farms and grows vegetables behind her house on the farmland that she owns. She earns approximately $1.05 per day. Her husband, Phorn Nget, is 44 years-old. He repairs motorcycles in front of their house, earning approximately $1.67 per day. The couple has four children. One of their children is married and the other three help with the family work. They request a loan of $250 to buy raw materials for Mr. Nget’s motorcycle-repair business. This will help them increase their household income. (The picture is P.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for a motorcycle-repair business

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru:
Mavjuda K. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 26 years old and has a high school education. Mavjuda owns a small food store where she sells food at below market prices. She is the only member of her large family who is currently working. Mavjuda would like to take out a loan for 12 months. She will use the loan to replenish the product assortment at her store.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Каюмова Мавжуда Убайдуллаевна жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 26 лет, образование среднее.Мавжуда имеет небольшой продуктовый магазин.Где торгует продуктами питания,по ценам ниже рыночных. В ее большой семье в данное время работает только она. В данноей время клиентка хочет взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.На кредит она хочет пополнить ассортимент своего магазина.

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
In her fifties, Mrs. Marie A. has sold condiments for 15 years or more in Agongbomey along side the paved road that runs opposite the middle school CPDM (Complexe Polytechnique Dally Maccagnon). She usually makes her purchases in the market Dantokpa, the largest market in the economic capital of Benin. She shops for stock that will satisfy customer demand most of whom live within her neighborhood. Originally from Oueme, she is married and the mother of four, two of which are still dependent on her. This is the fifth loan she has requested. This loan will help her to strengthen her capital.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La cinquantaine, dame A. Marie vendait depuis une quinzaine d'années des condiments à Agongbomey au bord de la voie pavée opposée au collège CPDM (Complexe Polytechnique Dally Maccagnon). Généralement, elle fait ses achats au marché DANTOKPA, le plus grand marché de la capitale économique du BENIN afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui est essentiellement constituée des habitants de son quartier. Originaire du département de l’OUEME, elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont deux sont encore à sa charge. Elle est à sa cinquième demande de prêt. Ce prêt l’aidera à renforcer son capital.

loans.use: To purchase one 25 liter drum of vegetable oil and 2 baskets of tomatoes and 3 baskets of onions.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is divorced and raises a 9-year-old son herself. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol where she sells men’s clothing in one of the local markets. Svetlana has been in this business for about 3 years. Financial assistance of Nadiya Ukraine have helped her increase assorted merchandise and expand considerably. Currently, Svetlana has about 4000 UAH in inventory. Her income is about 800 UAH a month.

Svetlana has a reasonable pricing policy which attracts customers to her vending facility. This summer season she is planning to increase seasonal inventory which is why she is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas. Svetlana is a single mom and works hard to sustain her family. She is hoping to generate additional income and invest part of the profit in reconstruction of her old house which needs to be repaired.

loans.use: To increase summer assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru:
Nargiza K. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 21 years old, is single and has a high school education. Nargiza has been working in her business for 3 years. She purchases male underwear at wholesale markets and resells it at her store. This business allows Nargiza to help her parents with the household. Right now, Nargiza would like to increase the product assortment at her store. This requires money and she has applied for a 15 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Кодирова Наргиза жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 21 года,незамужем,образование среднее. Наргиза уже 3 года занимается бизнесом.Она закупает на оптовых рынках мужское нижнее белье и реализует в розницу в своем магазине. Этот вид деятельности позволяет клиентки помогать родителям вести хозяйство. Сейчас Наргиза хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки.Для чего ей нужны деньги.Поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 15 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: G Léocadie

texts.fr:
Born on March 3, 1978 in Cotonou, Mrs. Leocadie G K. is married to Mr. Simon Loko and is the mother of two. She lives in Ahouassa in a neighborhood of Cotonou. She specializes in the sale of cereals and she purchases her stock primarily in Parakou, the third largest city in Benin. She travels to make her purchases at least once a month which she orders by commission from the venders. Her customers find her upon her return to pick up their orders they have made with her previously. She is well known in her neighborhood because of her good marketing sense and above all by word of mouth between her customers. Mrs. K. became a member of Alide in September 2007 and this is her third loan request. This loan will allow her to expand her customer base and to satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née le 03 Mars 1978 à Cotonou, dame K. G Léocadie est mariée à monsieur LOKO Simon et est mère de deux enfants. Elle habite Ahouassa un quartier de Cotonou où elle est locataire . Spécialisée dans la vente des produits céréaliers, elle fait généralement sa provision à Parakou, la troisième grande ville du Bénin où elle se rend une fois au moins le mois. Elle fait ses achats sur commande. Ses clients viennent dès son retour chercher leur commande. Elle est très connue dans son quartier à cause de son sens de marketing et surtout l’écoute de ses clients. Dame K. G Léocadie est devenue cliente de ALIDé depuis le 09 Septembre 2007 et à ce jour elle est à sa troisième demande de prêt. Ceci lui permettra de toucher plus de clients et surtout de satisfaire leurs demandes.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bags of corn, 10 bags of ice and 5 bags of beans.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Oumar is a master of the Koran who switched to raising poultry. He maintains a cassava field at home. With an initial loan of 150,000 francs CFA, he started raising broiler chickens. The income earned from his business enables him to cope with family expenses.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Oumar est un maitre coranique qui s'est convertidans l'aviculture .Dans sa maison, il entretien un champ de manioc .Avec un prmier pret de 150000F CFA il a demarré l'élevage des poulets de chaires. les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent de faire face aux dépenses de sa famille.

loans.use: capital funds

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Mr. Ty S. lives in the rural Pon Nhea loe district outside of Phnom Penh with his wife and two young sons. While his wife grows rice on the family’s farm, Mr. Ty sells “nompang dak sach,” or French sandwiches in his village. These are baguettes filled with meat and vegetables and are a popular Khmer dish, eaten for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. 

The nompang dak sach are generally sold from a cart that the owner peddles around town. Currently, Mr. Ty’s cart is damaged and he seeks a $200 loan to cover the costs of repairing it so he can resume his business as usual.

loans.use: To repair a cart used for selling sandwiches.

loans.name: Shirin

texts.ru:
Shirin T. lives in Tursun-zoda. She is 48 years old, is married and has 4 children. Shirin has a high school education. She purchases and resells footwear and has a sales location at the market. Shirin has 15 years of experience in this business and her business allows her to support her family. Shirin’s husband is a construction worker and his job is seasonal and temporary.

Shirin will use this loan to purchase footwear from wholesale suppliers. She has applied for a 12 month loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Тагирова Ширин жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 48 лет, замужем , имеет 4 детей. Образование среднее. Ширин занимается куплей продажей обуви. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке.Имеет опыт в бизнесе 15 лет.Торговля позволяет ей содержать свою семью.Муж клиентки работает строителем,работа сезонная непостоянная. Сейчас Ширин хочет закупить летнюю обувь у оптовых поставщиков.Для чего ей нужны деньги ,поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal footwear

loans.name: Khoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Khoeun Y., 48, is single and lives with her widowed sister, brother, and four nephews, two of whom are garment factory workers. The family lives along National Road Number Five, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Khoeun and her brother and sister have been farming since they were young. She has also started selling grocery items in front of her house. Her house is on lower ground than her neighbor’s, and so it floods during the rainy season. Mrs. Khoeun is requesting a loan of US$800 to fill up the ground around her house.

loans.use: Household improvements

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr:
Born around 1951 in Adjohoun in the district of Oueme, Mrs. Madeleine T. is a widow. To support herself, she sells bread but she as found her own niche in the market selling a specialty dish made of corn based dough which is then boiled to cook. The dish is called Akassa here in Benin. This local dough is especially appreciated by single people who don't lose any time in their schedules by having to take time to cook. This dough is very popular and so her original plan of selling primarily bread items has taken a back seat to this new endeavor. Madeleine has been a client of Alide since February 6, 2006 and she is a member of a solidarity group and this is her fifth request for a loan through this program. She is very much appreciated in her neighborhood because of her dedication to her profession despite her advanced years.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née vers 1951 à Adjohoun dans le département de l’Ouémé, dame T. Madeleine est veuve. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, elle vendait au départ du pain mais actuellement elle s'est trouvée une spécialité dans la vente de pâte de maïs bouillie appelée chez nous au Bénin AKASSA. Cette pâte locale est très apprécier et surtout par les célibataires qui ne perdent plus leur temps à faire la cuisine. La pâte étant très sollicitée, sa première activité de vente de pain est donc passée au second plan. Cliente de ALIDé depuis le 06 Février 2006 elle évolue au sein d'un groupe de caution solidaire et est à sa cinquième demande de prêt. Elle est appréciée dans son quartier à cause de son dévouement au travail malgré son âge avancé.

loans.use: To purchase two bags of corn and to stock her bread supply.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophan K., 38, and her husband, Mr. Buntha Em, live on an Island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have five children, three sons and two daughters. Four of the children attend a local school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Sophan and her husband have been silk weavers since 1990, a skill they learned from their parents and a neighbor. They sell their finished product to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Sophan is requesting a loan of US$300 to purchase silk thread to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk thread for weaving.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Mrs. Horn C., 50, and her husband, Mr. Yorn Nhem, who live about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1981 and have six children, two sons and four daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home. Two sons are drivers and one daughter is a tailor.

Mrs. Horn and her husband have been selling fruits at Kor Ky market since 1980. They earn for living about $7.50 to $10 per day. Horn would like to repair her house but lacks money. So, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $1000 to repair her house.

loans.use: Horn would like to repair her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla S., 54, and her husband, Mr. Un Sim, 57, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1981 and have six children, one son and five daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home. Of the others, one is a garment factory worker, two weave silk at home, and two attend a local school.

Mrs. Phalla and Mr. Un have been selling silk products and mosquito nets for 24 years. She buys some from her villagers and some from market in Phnom Penh for resale in nearby provinces. Mrs. Phalla is requesting a loan of US$500 to purchase silk products and mosquito nets for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk products and mosquito nets for resale.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun M., 49, and her husband, Mr. Tha Choub, 53, live along National Road Number Six, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have seven children, two sons and five daughters. Three of their children are married and live outside the family home and the others help in the family business.

Mrs. Yun has been selling grilled meat and pickle for more than 10 years. She buys the foods from a wholesaler for resale at Preak Anchanh Market. Her husband has been a mason for five years. Mrs. Yun is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to build walls and a concrete floor for her house.

loans.use: Home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business selling costume jewelry and underwear.

loans.name: Leab

texts.en:
Mrs. Leab T., 32, and her husband, Mr. Seng Ket, 32, were married in 1999 and have three sons, one of whom attends a local school. The family lives along National Road Number Two, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Leab has been growing rice for nine years. Her husband is a construction worker. Three months ago, she has started another business selling vegetables at market in Phnom Penh and it is going well. Mrs. Leab is requesting a loan of US$400 to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa D. est commerçant qui vend des piéces détachées pour véhicules en réparation. ses clients sont constitués essentiellement de mécaniciens de la gare routiere de Mbour. il avait  bénéficié d'un  premier pret   avec  l'IMCEC qui  lui a permis de renforcer ses activités en achettant des quantités assez importantes de  piéces détachées  pour accroitre ses revenus. 

Il sollicite un nouveau crédit pour  renforcer le niveau de son stock  et faire face ainsi aux sollicitation de ses clients.

loans.use: FONDS DE ROULEMENT

loans.name: Lem

texts.en:
Mrs. Lem K., 47, and her husband, Mr. Yoeun Pen, 48, were married in 1981 and have five children-- three sons and two daughters. Two of her children are married and live outside the family home. One of the children works in a garment factory and another is a construction worker. The youngest raises cows. The family lives along National Road Number Two, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Lem and her husband have been growing rice they were married. In addition, Mr. Yoeun is a Khmer traditional musician. Mrs. Lem’s daughter is currently in the process of building her own house near her parent’s home but lacks enough money to finish it. Mrs. Lem is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to finish her daughter’s house.

loans.use: House construction.

loans.name: Nozigul

texts.ru:
Nozigul K. lives in Vahdat. She is 38 years old, is a widow and has 3 children. Nozigul has a high school education. She owns a food store in Vahdat. Her husband died 5 years ago and she needs to support her family. Nozigul’s children are in school and during summer vacation her oldest son helps her in her business.

Nozigul would like to increase the assortment of products at her store. She has decided to take out a loan for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонова Нозигуль Исматовна жительница города Вахдат.Возраст 38 лет, вдова , имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Нозигуль имеет продуктовый магазин в городе Вахдат. Муж клиентки умер 5 лет назад.Поэтому свою семью содержит Нозигуль.Ее дети учатся в средней школе.Во время летних каникул старший сын помогает ей вести бизнес.Клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент магазина.Для чего ей нужны деньги,поэтому она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru:
Olimjon U. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 47 years old, married, and has 5 children. He has a secondary vocational education. Olimjon owns a grocery store, where he works as a salesperson. The business is the only source of income for his large family. His oldest sons are still in college, and the younger children are in middle school. His wife is a housewife. As he expects an increase in food costs, Olimjon wants to stock up on food supplies from wholesalers. To do that, he decided to take out a loan, to be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Юсупов Олимджон житель города Вахдат.Возраст 47 лет , женат ,имеет 5 детей. Образование средне-специальное. Олимджон имеет продуктовый магазин ,где сам же работает продавцом. Бизнес является единственным источником дохода его большой семьи. Старший сыновья клиента еще студенты.Младшие ходят в среднюю школу.Жена клиент домохозяйка. Так как ожидается рост цен на продукты питания ,Олимджон хочет закупить у оптовых поставщиков продукты питания для реализации. Поэтому он решил взять кредит сроком 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Expanding range of goods in store

loans.name: Mahkambek

texts.ru:
Mahkamber Z. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 59 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a higher education. He is now retired, so he raises animals. He buys young bull calves at the local market, and raises them for 45 days. Then he sells them on the market for a more profitable price. Animal husbandry allows him to support his large family. His oldest sons help him. At this time he would like to buy 2 calves to raise, so he decided to take out a loan. He will pay back the loan over a period of 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Зубайдуллоев Махкамбек житель города Вахдат. Возраст 59 лет , женат , имеет 6 детей. Образование высшее. В данное время Махкамбек находится на пенсии. Поэтому занимается животноводством. Он скупает на местном рынке молодых бычков, откармливает их в течении 45 дней.Затем реализует их на рынке по более выгодной ему цене.Животноводство позволяет ему содержать свою большую семью.Помогают ему его старшие сыновья. В данное время клиент хочет купить 2 бычков для откормки.Поэтому он решил взять кредит.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of two bull calves

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr:
Born on April 17, 1988 Ms. Fatima H. is single. She never attended school, but she chose her profession at an early age because her mother was also a merchant. Originally from Sakete, in the district of Plateau, she helps her mother in the village before she goes to Cotonou where she has her own trade. She currently lives with an Aunt. She sells shoes, scarfs, purses and costume jewelery. She often goes to Lome, in Togo, to make her purchases that she then resells in the market Dantokpa in Cotonou. This is the third loan she has asked for through this program and is a member of a solidarity group to ensure that she will be able to make payments regularly.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née le 17 Avril 1988, Dame H. Fatima est célibataire. N’ayant jamais été scolarisée, Fatima a choisi très tôt le commerce parce que sa maman l'exerçait déjà comme profession. Originaire de Sakété dans le département du plateau, elle aidait sa mère au village avant de venir à Cotonou où elle mène son activité pour son propre compte. Elle habite actuellement avec une tante. Elle vend des chaussures, des foulards, des sacs et des pacotilles. Elle se rend à Lomé en république Togolaise pour ses achats et les revend dans le grand marché de DANTOKPA. Elle est à sa troisième demande de prêt et évolue dans un groupe de caution solidaire qui lui sert de garantie pour le prêt.

loans.use: To purchase 20 pairs of shoes of diverse quality and 20 purses and 3 dozen scarfs.

loans.name: Asse Malick

texts.fr:
Asse Malick lives in the suburb of Mbour. His main business is rearing sheep. An initial loan of CFA 300,000 enabled him to get started in sheep rearing. He has now had three successive loans of CFA 300,000. With the income from the business, he has built a bedroom in his house.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Asse Malick habitte la banlieu de mbour .son activité principale est l'élevage des moutons.Un premier pret de 300000f cfa lui a permis de demarrer l'embouche des moutons .Il a déjà bénéficié de trois (3) prets successifs de 300000f cfa .Avec les revenus de l'activité, il a construit une chambre dans sa maison.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Eya D. is 37 years old, married, and the mother of four. She has been a retail seller of 'pagnes' cloth (colorful print fabrics) for over seven years in Avetonou, a small village located about 100 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. She wishes to use this loan to buy three bolts of pagnes to resell in order to meet customer demands and to use the gains, which will come from her business, to help meet household needs.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Eya D. est âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle revendeuse de pagnes de puis plus de 7 ans à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite avec ce crédit, acheter 3 balles de pages pour la revente afin de satisfaire la demande de la clientèle et d’utiliser les gains qui seront issus de son activité pour la participation de la prise en charge des besoins du foyer.

loans.use: To buy 3 bolts of 'pagnes' for retail sale

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is 26 years old. He lives in a small village near Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Hussein lives with his parents, who are financially dependent on him. He owns a small blacksmith shop. Hussein had to leave school at a young age to support his family, and learned blacksmithing in order to provide for his parents. Hussein is very ambitious and would like to expand his business. He needs a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a new iron-bending machine, which is essential to his work. Hussein has requested a loan before, and repaid it in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To purchase necessary machinery for his business

loans.name: Youssou

texts.fr:
Youssou is a young tailor living in a neighborhood of Mbour. His primary customers are young women. The clothes he makes are sold to girls. To increase his stock of machines, he has obtained a loan of CFA 400,000.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Youssou est un jeune tailleur installé dans un quartier de MBour.Sa principale clientelle est les jeunes filles .Les vétéments confectionnés sont vendus aux filles.Pour accroitre son son parc de machine,il a bénéficié d'un pret de de 400.000f cfa.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is 27 years old. She lives with parents in a small village near Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Amal is striving to improve the life of her family, which is heavily dependent upon her. Amal has to leave school at an early age and start selling various fruits and produce. Amal now owns her own produce shop. However, the rapidly rising costs of produce has become a serious problem for small entrepreneurs such as Amal, who do not have the means necessary to cope with rapidly inflating prices. Amal would like a loan of $700 to help continue her business and also repair her store.

loans.use: USD 700 to purchase enough vegetables and fruits and to do some maintenance for her shop that has a leaking ceiling

loans.name: Mireille

texts.fr:
Mrs. Mireille C. sells fabrics, bags, shoes and cosmetic products among other items. She has opted to allow some of her customers to buy on credit and she makes nightly rounds to their homes to collect the money. Being very experienced in her particular field, she is in contact with many customers and often asks them what their needs are so that she can try to satisfy customer demand. She makes her purchases primarily in Togo or in Ghana. Born on July 22, 1967 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. She is married and is the mother of three children, only one of which is in school. She lives with her husband and they are currently asking for third loan through this program. She is responsible and is well loved in her neighborhood.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Dame C. Mireille est spécialisée dans la vente des tissus basin, sacs, chaussures, produits cosmétiques et autres. Elle a opté pour la vente à crédit et passe tous les soirs chez ses clients pour collecter les fonds. Très expérimentée dans cette activité, elle a le contact facile avec les clients et se renseigne très souvent sur leurs besoins afin de pouvoir les satisfaire au mieux. Elle se rend généralement au TOGO ou au GHANA pour faire ses achats. Née le 22 Juillet 1967 à Porto-Novo la capitale politique du BENIN, elle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants dont un seul est scolarisé. Elle vit avec son mari et est à sa troisième demande de prêt. Elle a un bon comportement et est très aimée dans son quartier.

loans.use: To purchase 20 rolls of fabrics of various quality.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 25 years old. He lives in a small village close to the city of Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Ali owns a small barbershop. Ali is also engaged, and will be married soon. He would like a loan of $1000 in order to renovate and repair his house, which was damaged in the July War of 2006. Ali has requested a loan before and paid it back on time, and takes the matter of repayment very seriously.

loans.use: To renovate and repair his house, which was damaged in the war.

loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is 45 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children, all of whom attend school. Her husband works as a farmer and she is a tailor. Souad works from her home, located in a small village near the city of Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Souad would like to request a loan of $500 to maintain her home and business, which was damaged during the war in July of 2006.

loans.use: USD 500 to make some maintenance for her home, which was damaged during the July War 2006.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 34 years old, and married. He is the father of three little children, and lives with his family in a small village near Tyre, in Southern Lebanon. Ahmad operates a business where he produces charcoal from wood. The best season for his work spans from the early summer to early fall.

Ahmad has already requested and repaid a loan on time last year. He would like to request another loan, this time $1200, to purchase the necessary wood to produce charcoal to sell and support his family.

loans.use: USD 1,200 to buy the wood needed to be transformed to charcoal, so that he can sell it early Fall.

loans.name: Cristo Vive Group

texts.en:
Benita Pierre B. is a member of five person micro-bank, “Cristo Vive” which means “Christ Lives”. Only twenty years old, this young women has raised her three-year-old boy with the profits from her small business selling chocolates and other “peanut sweets” in the street. While this meager business has carried her thus far, she came to Esperanza International in search of something more. This will be each member of the group’s first loan. Benita intends to use the capital to begin selling shoes, shirts, dresses, and pants in the street, while continuing to make sweets on the side. It is her dream to earn enough money someday to own her own house to improve the living conditions for her entire family.

Other members of Cristo Vivo have similar occupations selling clothing, jewelry, blankets, and bread in the streets of Agrua, Dominican Republic. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.

On behalf of Benita, the Cristo Vive group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To milk, sugar, cocoa, and peanuts to continue making sweets, as well as clothing to sell on the side.

loans.name: Abla

texts.en: Abla is 24 years old. She is married, and has two little girls. She lives with her family in Tyre, located in Southern Lebanon. Abla operates a small perfume and make-up shop. Abla has requested a loan before, and last year she used her funds to remodel and improve her store. This time, Able would like a loan of $800 to purchase and restock her supplies of perfumes and cosmetics, allowing her to improve her business and client base.

loans.use: USD 800 to purchase enough merchandise for her business.

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.en:
Tita C. Josefa, a Haitian immigrant to the Dominican Republic, is a motivated woman who has dug within herself to whatever skills she possesses to provide for her children. A mother of four daughters and one boy (ages 15, 13, 11, 8, and 6), she has dedicated her life to providing for them and saving her business earnings so that they may one day attend a private school. Previously, Tita sold meat from her home in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic, but she has decided to use this loan to change directions. She will use the money from this loan to buy shoes, pants, shirts, and skirts to sell in her nearby neighborhood, items that are not as perishable as the meat she had been trying to sell.

Tita Josefa is just one member of the 5 person micro-bank, La Union Hace La Fuerza, which means “The Unity Makes Force”, a common slogan in Haiti, these women’s country of origin. Each of these unique entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together. The other four women have similar businesses to Tita’s, selling meet and clothing in the streets. In the photo, the five women pose with their loan assessor Paul.

On behalf of Tita, the Union group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, pants, shirts, and dresses to sell in the street.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Esperanza International, a partner of HOPE International - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: Dame D. Pascaline est née le 28 Avril 1973 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral. Mariée et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés dont l’aînée qui a 15 ans est en classe de cinquième année du cours secondaire (Seconde) et le cadet à l’âge de 10 ans fait la première année du cours secondaire (Sixième). Maîtresse coiffeuse de profession, elle exerce sa profession à Cotonou la capitale économique du Bénin plus précisément dans le quartier Sègbèya. En plus de cette activité, elle commercialise non seulement des mèches et des produits cosmétiques mais aussi des vêtements et tissus pour dame. Disposant d'un réfrigérateur, elle vend également de la glace et des sucettes. Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle, elle désire contracter un prêt de 400000 F CFA qui lui permettra d’acheter 10 balles de mèches, 24 boîtes de produits de beauté et divers produits rentrant dans la fabrication des sucettes. Ces différents achats lui permettront d’accroître son chiffre d’affaire.

loans.use: To purchase 10 bags of hair extensions, 24 boxes of beauty products and diverse items needed to make lollipops.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is 29 years old, married, and has 2 children. He lives in the town of Nabatieh in Southern Leabnon.  He works hard in order to ensure healthy living conditions for his family. Abbas owns a small shop where he sells records, accessories, scarves, and pearl chaplets. Abbas would like a loan of $1200 in order to purchase the necessary items to increase his inventory and client base. Abbas would use this income to further improve his business and support his family.

loans.use: USD 1,200 to purchase more merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Milton José

texts.es:
Milton Hernandez is from the county of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. He has one young son and his dream is to see him get professional success. For this to happen, and as any responsible father would, he has started to rebuild their house and thereby improve the family's living conditions as the house was in a bad state.

It is important to add that since he started this reconstruction he has been faced with many economic problems, but he has managed to overcome them due to the credit that Ceprodel had given him for building materials. He once again needs the support of this credit and hopes that this need will be met, as this is how he will continue to rebuild their house.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Milton Hernandez es un caballero del municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es padre de un hijo pequeño cuyos sueños son que llegue a convertirse en un gran profesional de éxito. Para esto, como todo padre responsable ha iniciado a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su pequeños e inició a reconstruir su vivienda por haberse encontrado en mal estado.

Es importante destacar que desde que inició con la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación ha atravesado problemáticas económicas pero las ha logrado superar gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha permitido obtener los créditos para la compra de los materiales de reconstrucción. Una vez más solicita el apoyo crediticio esperando que su petición será contestada y así continuará con la labor de reconstrucción de su casa de habitación.

loans.use: To buy construction materials/Compra de materiales de construccion

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona C. has been running her grocery business for more than nine years in Somotillo, Chinandega. She started her business with little economic resources and little stock. However, thanks to her hard work she has been able to invest in the purchase of stock which she can then sell.

She is a mother to a young child, for whom she has to provide for, and at the moment she is unable to buy stock to sell. This is why she has come to Ceprodel for financial support, in order to continue earning an honest living, running her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Petrona C. se dedica desde hace más de nueve años a su negocio de pulpería el cual atiende muy amablemente en su municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Inició su negocio con pocos recursos económicos y con poca mercadería sin embargo a medida que sus esfuerzos se han venido intensificando ha logrado mejorar invirtiendo en la compra de los productos para ofertarlos.

La necesidad que esta dama atraviesa es que por ser madre de un pequeño hijo, debe llevarle el sustento y hoy en día no cuenta con el recurso económico para comprar su mercadería. Por esta razón es que busca el refugio en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y de esta manera continuar con el mantenimiento de su humilde hogar de habitación.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 24 years old, married, and lives in a small village near Nabatieh in Southern Lebanon. Ali owns a car-washing service. He would like to be able to expand and service larger vehicles. His business is located on the main road, where many trucks pass on a daily basis between Tyre and Nabatieh. Ali would like a loan of $1200 to purchase the necessary equipment to utilize this opportunity. With this loan, Ali will be able to expand and increase his business and clientele.

loans.use: USD 1,200 for purchasing special trucks washing equipments

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo Juárez is a taxi driver, working every day in the city of Chinandega. Despite the difficult circumstances he faces, such as the high cost of parts and fuel, he has been able to succeed and support his household.

Today Rodolfo faces another problem. His taxi cab is in disrepair and so he needs to be parts to fix it. This is why he is turning to Ceprodel for a loan which he can use to purchase these parts and continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Rodolfo Juárez se dedica a la labor de transporte teniendo su propio taxi el cual lo trabaja todos los días en su municipio en la ciudad de Chinandega. A pesar de las difíciles circunstancias que atraviesa como lo es el alto costo de los repuestos y del combustible, ha logrado salir adelante y llevar el alimento a su humilde hogar de habitación.

El problema que el señor Rodolfo hoy en día atraviesa es que el vehiculo taxi está dañado y por ende necesita de la compra de los repuestos por lo que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo con el cual comprar los repuestos y así continuar con su negocio en su municipio.

loans.use: To purchase parts for his taxi

loans.name: Zita Berenice

texts.es:
Zita is married, and her husband is a painter. They have 3 children: a 10-year-old boy, a 4-year-old boy, and a 9-year-old girl. They are in elementary school. She started her business to help her husband with their children's expenses, primarily their education costs. She started her business 6 years ago by selling linens and cosmetics. Now she sells shoes because she earns more profits this way.

Now she needs a loan of $400, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase new editions of catalogs and to supply pending orders. With your help, Zita will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Zita es casada y su esposo es pintor tiene 3 hijos, un niño de 10 años, otro de 4 años y una niña de 9 años estudian la escuela primaria. Inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos, principalmente los escolares. Comenzó su negocio hace 6 años inicio vendiendo blancos y productos cosmeticos, actualmente vende zapatos lo que le ha dejado mejores ganancias

Ahora necesita un prestamo por US $400 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar nuevas ediciones de catalogos y surtir pedidos pendientes. Con tu ayuda Zita saldra adelante.

loans.use: To purchase new catalogs and merchandise

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es:
Sandra H. works in a grocery store in Somotllo in the city of Chinandega, where she comes from. Seven years ago she decided to invest in some stock to sell. As they started to sell bit by bit, she decided to buy more which led to her setting up her grocery store from home.

Her two children are very proud of her as she is now able to give them everything they need to study and to survive.

She has turned to Ceprodel for financial support in order to purchase more stock. She hopes to receive support as soon as possible to invest in her business and continue with her successful venture.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Sandra H. es una dama cuya labor es el negocio de pulpería atendido en el municipio de Somotllo de la ciudad de Chinandega de donde es originaria. Hace siete años decidió invertir en la compra de productos para comercializarlos y al ver que los vendía poco a poco fue incrementando sus productos hasta llegar a establecer su pulpería y ubicarla en su casa de habitación.

Sus dos hijos se sienten muy orgullosos de ella porque ha logrado proporcionarles todo lo necesario para sus estudios y además les ha proporcionado el alimento para su desarrollo.

Ha acudido a Ceprodel con el objetivo de ser beneficiada con un crédito el cual le sea proporcionado para la adquisición de su mercadería. Por este motivo ella espera recibir su crédito para invertir lo mas pronto posible en el negocio y así continuar con el mantenimiento de los suyos.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is 35 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in a small village close to the town of Nabatieh in Southern Lebanon. Samer distributes TV Satellites and cable to his clientele. His child, who is four years old, will enter school next year and Samer needs $1200 to pay for the registration fees.

Samer has requested a loan before, and has an excellent record of on-time repayment. He is a responsible entrepreneur who works hard to secure his family’s safety and the education of his child.

loans.use: To pay for the education of his child

loans.name: Olaïtan

texts.fr:
Mrs. Olaitan A. was born on September 27, 1978 in Sakete in the district of Plateau in the South of Benin, not far from the fertile valley Oueme. She is marred to Essoun Adeweloye, a public transportation driver.  She is also the mother of one, her 15 year old son named Akim. His father is the primary care-taker. She is a merchant of food products such as pastas, canned foods, other provisions and some medicines. Her store is located in Cotonou. She currently faces some problems stocking her store. She is asking for a loan in order to better satisfy customer demand. Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Dame A. Olaïtan est née le 27 septembre 1978 à Sakété dans le département du Plateau au Sud du Bénin, non loin de la riche vallée de l’Ouémé. Mariée à monsieur ADEWELOYE Essoun, conducteur de véhicule de transport commun, dame A. Olaïtan est mère d’un enfant âgé de 15 ans nommé Akim. Ce dernier est à la charge de son père. Elle est revendeuse de produits alimentaires  de première nécessité à savoir les pâtes alimentaires, les boîtes de conserve, quelques produits vivriers et des médicaments. Sa boutique se situe à Cotonou en face du CEG Sègbèya. Actuellement elle a quelques difficultés d’approvisionnement. Elle sollicite donc ce prêt pour mieux faire face à la demande de ses clients.

loans.use: To purchase 2 carton of pasta and 3 boxes of canned food and one bag of corn.

loans.name: Susana Rafaela

texts.es:
Susana Rafaela M. runs a food business, making and selling her products from home in Somotillo in Chinandega. She creates delicious meals which are sold to her loyal clients who visit her on a daily basis.

She is the mother of two children, both of school age, and is looking for a way to provide them with the things they need in life. Therefore she has turned to Ceprodel for a loan in order to buy ingredients for her dishes, which she can then sell from home. Ultimately she will then be able to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Susana Rafaela M. se dedica al negocio de elaboración y venta de comida en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Somotillo en Chinandega. Se ha caracterizado por elaborar exquisitos platillos los cuales los vende a sus clientes fieles el cual la visitan a diario en su hogar.

Ella es madre de dos hijos en edades escolares y busca la manera de proporcionarles las cosas necesarias para que estos se desarrollen. Por esta razón es que ella ha llegado a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los platillos y venderlos en su casa de habitación y además para la ampliación del negocio.

loans.use: To invest in ingredients for her business and for expansion

loans.name: Gertrudis Alexandra

texts.es:
Gertrudis is 44 years old, she lives in the 3-80 neighborhood, is married, has two children ages 6 and 16. Her husband works in a company as an operator and contributes to the home expenses.

The business of Gertrudis is the sale of clothing and cosmetics, she has 16 years of experience and started with her own efforts. With the loan requested she will buy construction materials to build a room for her children to be more comfortable.

She hopes in the future to start a general store from her house and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Gertrudis tiene 44 años de edad, habita en el barrio 3-80, es casada, con dos niños de 6 y 16 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose como aoperario y aporta con los gastos del hogar.

El negocio de doña Gertrudis es la venta de ropa y cosméticos, tiene 16 años de experiencia, ella inició con esfuerzos propios. Con el préstamo solcitado comprará materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto de habitación para así darle más comodidad a sus hijos.

Espera en un futuro poner una pulpería en su casa para así mejorar el nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish building a room.

loans.name: Sheyla Dinora

texts.es:
Sheyla lives in the Lomas del Memorial neighborhood, in the city of Managua, she is 30 years old, married and has two children ages 7 and 8 months. Her husband works for the government in the military and contributes with the family expenses.

She is a hair dresser, sells cosmetics and clothes. She has seven years of experience and started with her own efforts. With the loan she is requesting, she plans to use it to build a room and be more comfortable.

In the future, she would like to continue offering different products to her clients, increase her client base, finish building her house and help provide for the education of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Sheyla habita en el barrio Lomas del Memorial de la ciudad de Managua, tienen 30 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos niños uno de 7 años y uno de 8 meses, su esposo trabaja en el ministerio de gobernación como militar y aporta a los gastos de la familia.

Ella es Estilista y vende cosmético y ropa lleva siete años de experiencia e inició con esfuerzos propios. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para infraestructura en la construcción de un cuarto para estar más cómoda.

A futuro es seguir ofreciendo variedades de productos a sus clientes, captar más clientes y terminar de construir su vivienda así como educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a house

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is married and has 5 children; 3 women and 2 man who are married, her husband is retired. She started her business to help her husband support their children and pay for their studies. She started the business 7 years ago selling different items and has been selling catalog cosmetics for approximately 3 years.

Following her friend's advice, she started offering them among her friends and acquaintances, who then recommended her products to other people and that's how she started building a client base.

She needs a loan of $550 USD that she will pay back in 6 months to buy merchandise and give better service to her clients by having the products ready in the moment they are needed. With your support Yolanda will make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda esta casada, es casada y si tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 3 son mujeres y 2 hombres ya casados, su esposo es jubilado. Inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo en la manutencion de sus hijos y pagar sus estudios. Comenzó el negocio hace 7 años vendiendo diferentes articulos y lleva aproximadamente 3 años vendiendo cosmeticos por catalogo.

Por consejo de una amiga, empezo a ofrecerlos entre sus amistades y conocidos, quienes la empezaron a recomendar a otras personas y asi fue creando su cartera de clientes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $550 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y darle mejor servicio a sus clientes, contando con los productos en el momento que se lo soliciten. Con tu apoyo Yolanda hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
