Maria is 43 years old, she is married and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, she has three children and her husband is a merchant who sells vegetables and contributes to the family expenses.

The business of Maria is the sale of fruits and vegetables, in which she has 14 years of experience. She started selling fire wood, currently she sells out of her house and she also goes out to sell in a cart with her children. The loan is to buy construction materials and expand the roof in her house to avoid water from getting in her home.

In the future, she would like to expand her business, improve her house and provide education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino tiene tres hijos y su esposo es comerciante, él vende verduras y aporta a los gastos de la familia.

El negocio de doña Maria es la venta de frutas y verduras, y tiene catorce años de experiencia ella inició con esfuerzos propios y comenzó vendiendo leña, actualmente vende en su casa y también sale a vender a las calles en un carretón con sus hijos.

El préstamo es para comprar materiales de construcción para construir un bajarete para evitar que el agua entre a su casa.

A futuro es agrandar el negocio, mejorar su vivienda y educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to expand the roof in her house

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is 31 years old, married, and the father of two children. He lives in the small village of Caza, near Nabatieh in Southern Lebanon. Hassan operates a small furniture painting shop. He paints and restores new and second-hand furniture. Hassan would like a loan of $1000 to purchase more raw and painting materials for his shop, and continue to support his family.

loans.use: USD 1,000 to buy wood and raw material for his shop.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Doña Maria is 42-years-old. She lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood; is married; and has 2 children, who are 18 and 20. Her husband is a police official and helps with the home's expenses.

Señora Maria has a grocery store and has 10 years of experience. She started by selling clothing with her own funds. She needs this loan to construct a room in the back of her house to have more comfort. Her future plans are to sell a larger variety of products to have a share in other market segments.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Doña Maria tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 18 y 20 años de edad, su esposo es oficial de la policía y aporta a los gastos del hogar.

La Sra. Maria tiene una pulpería con diez años de experiencia e inició vendiendo ropa con fondos propios. El préstamo lo necesita para la construcción de un cuarto en la parte de atrás de su casa para tener más comodidad. Sus planes futuros son vender productos variado y obtener otros segmento de mercado.

loans.use: Construction of a room in the back of her house

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is 26 years old. He owns a barber shop in a small barber shop, near Nabatieh in Southern Lebanon. Hassan’s car was destroyed in the war in July, 2006. He cannot afford to purchase a new car, and nobody is able to compensate for his loss. Hassan would like a loan of $1,200 in order to purchase a second-hand car.

loans.use: To purchase a new car.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: NawA. A. J. is 45 years old. She lives in a village close to the town of Nabatieh in Southern Lebanon. NawA. takes care of her family, as her brother was killed in the war in July, 2006. NawA. owns a small jewelry and lingerie shop, and uses the income to support her family. She would like a loan of $300 to purchase additionA. items to expand her inventory and number of customers.

loans.use: To purchase jewelry for retail.

loans.name: Zakaa

texts.en: Zakaa is 47 years old. She lives in a small village close to the town of Nabatieh in Southern Lebanon. Zakaa owns a small clothing shop and helps support her parents through the income earned from sales. Zakaa would like a loan of $300 to purchase a new inventory of swimsuits. The summer season has just started, and Zakaa would like to provide her clientele with a new range of swimwear.

loans.use: To purchase an inventory of swimsuits

loans.name: Zahia

texts.en: Zahia is 37 years old. She lives in a small village close to Nabatieh, in Southern Lebanon. Zahia arranges flowers for special events. Zahia would like a loan of $300 to purchase raw materials and artificial flowers to prepare floral arrangements. The wedding season is a very busy time of year for her, and she would like to use this opportunity to expand her business and clientele.

loans.use: To purchase flowers for floral arrangements

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Martha Isabel C. works very hard running a tailor's shop from her home in the county of La Paz Centro in the city of Leon. She has been doing this for 20 long years and throughout this time she has managed to gather a lot of experience in her field.

She is a single mother with a young son that she must support. Her multiple efforts are all so that she can feed him and pay for his education. Now she is asking for a loan so that she can buy equipment for her work such as needles, thread, material and more. This is why she is looking for financing from Ceprodel; so that she can get the necessary credit and therefore continue with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

En el municipio de La Paz Centro de la ciudad de León, la señora Martha Isabel C. se dedica a trabajar en el negocio de sastrería el cual atiende muy esforzadamente en su casa de habitación. SE dedica a este negocio desde hace 20 largos años y a través de este tiempo ha logrado alcanzar una basta experiencia en su ramo.

Es madre soltera y con un pequeño hijo con el deber de mantener. Sus múltiples esfuerzos los realiza para brindarle el alimento a su pequeño y así poder continuar con sus estudios. Hoy en día solicita un crédito para la compra de sus materiales de trabajo como lo es hilos, agujas, telas y mas. Por esto busca el financiamiento en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario y de esta manera continuar en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy materials to work with/Compra de materiales para trabajo

loans.name: Prima Isabel

texts.es:
Prima U. is a woman from the county of Nagarote in the city of Leon in which she has been trying to improve her living conditions for some years as it has always been very insecure. She started the rebuilding of her house and now needs to invest in some doors and hire some labourers.

This is why she looked for support from Ceprodel; so that she could get credit to buy building materials and to pay the workmen. She is a faithful client of theirs and she has always paid off her loans in the correct manner established by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Prima U. es una dama del municipio de Nagarote en la ciudad de León el cual desde hace varios años se ha venido esforzando para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que siempre ha tenido problemas de inseguridad. Inició con la reconstrucción de la casa y hoy en día necesita invertir en la compra de puertas y también en la mano de obra.

Por esta razón, ella busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y pago de la mano de obra. Actualmente ella es un fiel cliente habiendo cancelado todos sus créditos en forma de acuerdo a lo establecido por la institución.

loans.use: To buy construction materials/Compra de los materiales de construcción

loans.name: Kifayatou

texts.fr:
Born December 15, 1977 Kitayatou A. is married to Raimou Abogourin. She is the mother of two, the oldest attends elementary school and is 8 years old while the other is still a baby, only one year old. She sells health products for newborns and babies such as cotton swabs, baby powder, ointments and diverse toothpastes. Mrs. Kitayatou A. often purchases her stock in Nigeria as well as in Togo and for the moment is in Benin. She will sell her items in the international market Dantokpa in Benin.

Translated from French into English by Kiva Volunteer translator, Kristin Connor.

Née le 15 Décembre 1977 à A. Kifayatou est mariée à monsieur ABOGOURIN Raïmou. Elle est mère de deux enfants dont l’aîné qui est au CE1 à 8 ans et le second, encore bébé, a un 1 an d'âge. Elle vend des produits de soins corporelles pour les nouveaux nés tels que les dessous (couches) pour bébé, les cotons tige, de la poudre de beauté, des pommades et diverses sortes de pâtes dentifrices. Dame A. Kifayatou s’approvisionne souvent au Nigeria et au Togo puis par moment au Bénin. Elle expose ses articles au marché international DANTOKPA de Cotonou au Bénin.

loans.use: To purchase four cartons of baby clothes, 10 boxes of baby powder, 20 ointments and different toothpastes.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.fr:
Mrs. Rosaline D. was born in Cotonou around 1970. She is married and the mother of two children, of whom one is enrolled in school and the other in an apprenticeship. She sells take-out food prepared of rice and dried beans, locally known as "Atassi," out of her home in the Adogléta neighborhood of Cotonou. She is open for business from 8 to 11 AM. She would like to upgrade her venue and make it more attractive. She would also like to increase her sales volume by not purchasing her rice and beans by the kilogram. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 475 so that she can better meet the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame D. Rosaline est née vers 1970 à Cotonou. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont l’un est scolarisé et l’autre à l’apprentissage. Elle vend du repas prêt à manger fait à base du riz et du haricot communément appelé « Atassi » en son domicile à Cotonou au quartier Adogléta. Elle vend dans la matinée de 08 heures à 11 heures. Elle désire améliorer son cadre de vente et le rendre plus atrayant. Aussi, voudrait elle augmenter le volume de son activité en rompant avec l'achat du riz et du haricot au kilogramme. Pour cela, elle sollicite un prêt de 200000 F CFA pour mieux répondre aux attentes de la clientèle.

loans.use:
bolster her inventory by buying a 50kg sack of rice, 25 liters of cooking oil, 1 sack of dried beans, 1 case of macaroni/spaghetti, 1 small sack of onions, and various condiments

renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant 1 sac de riz de 50kg, 25 litres d’huiles, 1 sac de haricot, 1 carton de macaroni spaghetti, 1 petit sac d’oignons et divers condiments

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham is 42 years old. She lives with her parents in a small village close to the town of Nabatieh, in Southern Lebanon. Ilham needed to find a source of income in order to help sustain her aging parents, and decided to offer a new type of service to her village. Ilham cleans meats for different traditional dishes that need lengthy preparation. She then freezes the meet after she prepares it and sells it to her clients. Ilham is well known in the village for her high standards of hygiene and cleanliness in her products, and has a loyal base of clients. She would like to request a loan of $300 to purchase a new freezer to sustain her business.

loans.use: To purchase a new freezer.

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira is 46 years old. She lives with her parents in a small village close to the town of Nabatieh, in Southern Lebanon. Amira is the owner of a small tailoring atelier and she supports her parents through the income earned from her enterprise.

This is the first loan that Amira has ever requested. She would like to borrow $300 to purchase fabrics and raw materials to expand her business.

loans.use: USD 300 to purchase some fabrics and raw material

loans.name: Eulalie

texts.fr:
Born on February 12, 1958 in Porto-novo, the political capital of Benin, Mrs. Eulalie H. is married to Mr. Machould Boco, a master-welder by trade, and is the mother of 5 children, all of whom are enrolled in school. She sells firewood and various kinds of fruit. Her sales point is located in the Midombo neighborhood. She purchases her inventory in the Pahou market and has it transported by pickup truck. She ardently desires to use a truck as transportation so as to minimize her transport costs. Thus, she is requesting this loan so that she can make her dream come true and satisfy her clientele at the same time.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née à Porto-novo, la capitale politique du BENIN le 12 Février 1958, dame H. Eulalie est mariée à monsieur BOCO Machould, maître soudeur, et est mère de cinq enfants tous scolarisés. Elle commercialise le bois de chauffage et divers fruits. Son lieu d’activité se trouve au quartier Midombo. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de Pahou et le transport est assuré par des véhicules 405 bâchés. Son désir ardent est de faire assuere le transport par un camion pour minimiser les charges de transport. Elle sollicite donc ce crédit pour réaliser son désir et pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle en temps réel.

loans.use:
purchase of a truckload of firewood

Achat d'un camion de bois de chauffage.

loans.name: Mamadou Samba

texts.fr:
Mr. Mamadou Samba D. is a retailer who lives in the Mbabara neighborhood of Thies. He is married and has three children. He has 23 years’ experience in the business, which provides his main income. With this loan he plans to increase his stock in order to make more profit.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

mr mamadou samba D. est un détaillant qui habite au quartier MBABARA à THIES .IL est marié et père de trois enfants .il dispose d'une expérience de vingt trois ans dans le commerce et y tire ses principaux revenus.avec ce pret il compte accroitre son stock afin de réaliser davantage de bénéfice.

loans.use: Purchase and Retail

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha is 35 years old and she finished school in 6th grade. She has 3 young sons and 3 young daughters and her husband works alongside her every day.

Now she sells women's and men's clothes in the 15 de agosto market, post number B68 in the town of Yunguyo. In the last 6 months she has noticed a vast improvement in her business as she received a loan through the Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima bank of the district and province of Yunguyo.

With the loan of $1500 which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy 3 dozen overalls, 3 dozen sweaters, 3 dozen pairs of pants among other things. With this she hopes to increase her earnings little by little.

Her dream is to expand her current business and open a restaurant in the Plaza de Armas in Yunguyo. This is how she will pay for her kids education.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La Señora Bertha tiene 35 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto de primaria, es madre de 3 hijos y 3 hijas menores de edad, su esposo trabaja junto con ella en las actividades que están desarrollando diariamente. Actualmente, se dedica al negocio de venta de ropas especializado en damas y varones en el mercado 15 de agosto puesto Nº B 68 en la localidad de Yunguyo, sus negocios en los últimos 6 años ha mejorado notablemente con el préstamo que adquirió del banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 3 docenas de buzos, 3 docenas de chompas, 3 docenas de pantalones y otros, con ellos poco a poco sigue incrementando su mercadería para generar más ganancias. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio que tiene actualmente y tener un restaurante en Plaza de Armas de Yunguyo, y con ella sacar adelante a sus hijos dando una educación adecuada.

loans.use: To bulk buy food/Compra de ropa al por mayor.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mr S. is a carpenter who has been practicing the trade for over 20 years. He is married but does not yet have any children. He usually takes out loans to buy wood to make furniture which he then sells to his customers. With this loan he wants to increase his wood supplies before the rainy season sets in.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

mr S. est un menuisier qui exerce cette profession depuis une vingtaine d'année .il est marié mais n'a pas encore d'enfant.il a l'habitude de prendre des crédits pour acheter du bois dans le but de fabriquer des meubles et les revendre à ses clients .avec ce pret il veut renforcer son stock de bois avant l'installation de l'hivernage.

loans.use: To buy wood to make furniture

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mamadou B. is a young storekeeper who lives in the Cité Lamy neighborood of Thies. He is married and lives with his family. His main business is buying seasonal produce at the weekly markets to retail at the market in Thies. With the sum he is requesting, he would like to buy some onions at a good price so that he can resell them and have a good profit margin.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

mamadou B. est un jeune commerçant qui habite au quartier cité lamy de THIES .il est marié et vit avec sa famille .son activité principale est l'achat de produits saisonniers au niveau des marchés hebdomadaire pour les revendre sur le marché thiessois au détail.actuellement avec la somme qu'il demande il veut acheter de l'oignin à bon prix pour le revendre afin de réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire.

loans.use: To buy and sell foodstuffs

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Ms. Rosa is 30 and studied up to the sixth grade. She has three children and has been separated from her husband for four years. She lives on Jiron Huascar St. in the city of Yunguyo.

Starting at age eight, Rosa helped her mother sell kerosene and was able to learn the secrets of the business. She now she sells kerosene herself, in addition to potatoes, oca [root vegetable found in the Andes], beans and slippers, mainly at the Tacna and Juliaca markets.

Thanks to a suggestion from her neighbor, she decided to join the Santa Rosa de Lima Communal Bank in order to request a loan of S/. 300.00 nuevo soles [local currency]. She used that initial loan to purchase six large cans of kerosene and this increased her business and encouraged her to keep going with it.

Rosa is now seeking a S/. 800.00 loan, which will be repaid in four months. She will use the money to increase her daily sales and generate additional income. She received her last loan on 04/12/08 and will finish repaying it on 08/12/08.

Her oldest daughter, 10, helps her with the business and always makes the trip to Tacna and Juliaca with her. Rosa is very happy with her business, especially because it allows her to cover the expenses of feeding and educating her children. Her biggest dream is to have a house in Yunguyo and that her children have good jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Rosa tiene 30 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto de primaria es madre de 3 hijos, es separada con su esposo hace 4 años, vive en Jirón Huascar S/N en la ciudad de Yunguyo.

Desde los 8 años de edad ayudo a su mamá ha vender kerosene, desde entonces aprendió los secretos del negocio y actualmente se dedica a la venta de kerosene, así mismo negocia papa, oca, habas y zapatillas hacia los mercados de Tacna y Juliaca principalmente.

Por iniciativa de su vecina decidió pertenecer al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima para acceder al préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, con ella adquirió 6 bidones de kerosene con lo que incremento su negocio, por ello decidió seguir

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual será cancelado en 4 meses incrementará su venta todos los días, mejorando así sus ingresos económicos. El ultimo crédito recibió el día 12/04/08 y terminará de pagar el día 12/08/08

En la venta de kerosene le ayuda su hija mayor de 10 años, cada vez que viaja a Tacna y Juliaca. Ella esta muy contenta con sus actividades de negocio y así cubre los gastos de alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Su sueño principal es tener casa en la ciudad de Yunguyo y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of kerosene.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Ms. Martina is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima Communal bank in the Puno department of the Yunguyo district and province. She decided to become a member in order to improve her grocery store and sell products wholesale. Her store is located at 961 Jr. Huascar St.

With the first loans she received, Ms. Martina bought a store counter and a tricycle for her store.

She is now seeking a loan of S/. 1,000.00, which she will repay in four months. She will use the loan to buy ten sacks of soy, sold as livestock feed, since this brings in the most money. That's why she also plans to use future loans to purchase other products to fatten up livestock, such as cottonseed meal, cornmeal, fishmeal and chicken feed, etc., to generate more income.

She has gotten to where she is today thanks to the support of her son and as a result of the loan she received from Manuela Ramos.

Ms. Martina is 49 and has been separated from her husband for 12 years. She has a son and two daughters and studied through second grade. Her biggest dream is to educate her children so they can become professionals and to carry additional merchandise in her store, such as feed for large and small animals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Martina pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno decidió pertenecer a dicho banco con el objetivo de mejorar su tienda de abarrotes y realizar ventas por mayor, la misma que esta ubicada en Jr. Huascar Nº 961.

Con el primeros préstamos adquirió un mostrador y un triciclo para su tienda de abarrotes

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 10 sacos de soya para engorde de ganado, ya que de esto se obtiene mayor ganancia, por ello con los próximos créditos tiene previsto invertir en los productos de engorde como pasta de algodón, harina de maíz, harina de pescado, gallinazo y otros para generar más ingresos.

Todo esto ha logrado gracias al apoyo de su hijo y del préstamo de Manuela Ramos.

Tiene 49 años de edad, separada hace 12 años de su esposo, madre de 2 hijas y 01 hijo y logró estudiar hasta segundo de primaria. Su sueño más grande es tener sus hijas profesionales y ampliar mercaderías de engorde de ganados mayores y menores.

loans.use: Purchase of soy flour for young animals.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
Ms. Balbina is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima Communal Bank, in the Yunguyo district and province. She decided to join the bank because she needed extra money to maintain her business making mana (a Peruvian dessert), and therefore she needs a loan of S/. 300.00 nuevo soles (local currency) to buy ten packages of noodles and 1 quintal (aprox. 46 kilograms) of sugar.

Ms. Balbina says that she has more capital than before and has a permanent stand to sell her products in the Chucuito-Juli province. Her stand is is located in the De la Madre Park, where she sells her desserts on Wednesdays and Sundays. This allows her to sell her products without losing money.

With the loan she's requesting, S/. 500.00, to be repaid in four months, Ms. Balbina will purchase ten quintals of corn and one of sugar, which will help her increase production and her income.

Ms. Balbina is 45 and has six children. She has studied up to third grade and lives with her husband, who helps her make the mana, helping their family stay united.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Balbina pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, decidió ser socia por falta del capital para mantener su negocio de producción de maná, por ello con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles adquirió 10 bolsas de fideo y 1 quintal de azúcar

Sostiene que tiene más capital que antes y tiene un puesto fijo en la provincia de Chucuito-Juli, ubicado en el parque de la madre en donde vende los días miércoles y domingos, de esa manera tiene garantía de comercializar sus productos sin pérdida.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de 10 quintales de maíz y 1 quintal azúcar, los mismos que están destinados ha incrementar su producción e ingresos económicos.

Tiene 45 años de edad, madre de 6 hijos, sus estudios alcanzados el tercero de primaria, vive con su esposo quien le apoya en la producción de maná, para sobresalir juntos y unidos en la familia.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of corn and sugar.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena is married, her husband is a contractor. They have 3 children, 2 sons and a daughter who are gown and married. She started her business because she needed an extra income and also out of a desire to better herself and to have a productive activity to keep her occupied.

She got started approximately 2 years ago, after a friend's suggestion. She started selling to her family and friends and little by little she has been able to accumulate a more ample clientele.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 that she will pay in 3 months. She will use it to purchase shoes for the new graduation season as well as the start of the school year. She will also buy huarache (traditional style of sandals) and sandals for the next vacation season. With your help, Elena can get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Elena esta casada, si esposo es contratista. Tienen 3 hijos, 2 hijos y una hija ya casados Ella inició el negocio porque tenia la necesidad de un ingreso extra asi como tambien por su superacion personal al tener una catividad en la que mantenerse ocupada. Comenzó hace aproximadamente 2 años , por sugerencia de una amiga, empezo vendiendo a sus familiares y amigos, poco a poco ha logrado crear una cartera de clientes mas amplia.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $600 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir zapatos para la temporada de graduaciones e inicio de clases. asi como huarache y sandalia para las proximas vacaciones. Con tu ayuda Elena saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Toribia

texts.es:
Ms. Toribia P. is 48 and has 6 children (4 sons and 2 daughters). She has completed her primary education, speaks Aymara and Spanish and is the head of the household as she does not live with her husband. She lives on Avenida Sol, in the Yunguyo district and province.

She sells food at the 15 de Agosto market in Yunguyo, her stand is No. G31. Also, from July to November she sells soft drinks, a business she started as a result of the trouble she had with her husband. Her husband used to tell her that their money disappeared too quickly and that she looked only to her husband. When he left, he took everything with him. At that time, Toribia was the coordinator of the Juli Prelature and at one of their meetings a promoter for Credimujer Manuela Ramos (a microfinance program) gave a presentation on loans and the requirements to receive one. She immediately joined the Santa Rosa de Lima Communal Bank in the city of Yunguyo. The loan that she received was for S/. 500.00 on 4/12/08 and she will finish repaying it on 08/12/08.

Toribia is very happy because she was able to increase her income and pay for the costs of running her home, as well has her children's studies. Her biggest dream is to set up and improve the guesthouse that she has, and to send her children to school so that they can be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Toribia P. tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos (4 varones y 2 mujeres), su nivel de estudio alcanzado es primaria completa, habla aymara y castellano, es jefe del hogar no vive con su esposo, esta domiciliado en Avenida Sol S/N en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo.

Se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado de 15 de Agosto en la ciudad de Yunguyo Kiosco Nº G31 y también en los meses de Julio hasta Noviembre vende refresco, este negocio ha emprendido a partir de los problemas que tuvo con su esposo, quién le decía: que se gastaba rápido el dinero, que le miraba solo al marido, y cuando se fue de la casa si había llevado todos los bienes; justo en ese entonces ella era coordinadora de Prelatura de Juli y en una de sus reuniones una promotora de CrediMujer Manuela Ramos presentó y expuso sobre el crédito y sus requisitos para acceder. Inmediatamente constituyo el Banco Comunal denominado Santa Rosa de Lima en la ciudad de Yunguyo. El préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 500.00 el día 12/04/08 y terminará de pagar el día 12/08/08.

Ella esta muy feliz porque mejoró sus ingresos para solventar los gastos en su hogar, estudio de sus hijos es padre y madre. Su sueño más grande es implementar y mejorar su pensión que tiene y hacer estudiar a sus hijos e hijas hasta que sean profesionales.

loans.use: Capital, purchase of supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.es:
Joaquina is married and her husband works as a waiter in a restaurant. They have a 4 year old daughter. She started her business by helping a friend who could no longer tend to it. The friend sold the merchandise to Joaquina at a very low price so that she could start her own business. Joaquina's principal motivation was to help her husband with the household expenses since his salary was not enough to cover all their needs. She launched her stationary store a year ago and so far she has been doing really well because her store is always well stocked.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $250, to be paid in 3 months. She will use it to purchase merchandise and in this manner, offer more variety of products to her clients. With your help Joaquina can grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Joaquina es casada su esposo trabaja como mesero en un restaurante. Ellos tienen una niña de 4 años. Inició el negocio para apoyar a una amiga ya que ella no podia seguir atendiendolo, por lo cual le vendio la mercancia a un costo muy bajo para poder iniciar su propio negocio, lo inicio principalmente ante la necesidad economica que tenia ya que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba para los gastos del hogar. Comenzó su papeleria hace un año y hasta ahora le ha ido muy bien debido a que tiene muy surtido el negocio.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir mas mercancía para ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Joaquina consolidara su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr:
Born around 1973 in Sakété, in Plateau County in the southeast of Bénin, Mrs. Henriette L. is married and the mother of 3 children. Ronel (16) is in tenth grade, Christiane (14) is in eighth grade, and Marcelline (9) is in third grade. Having a great deal of experience in selling fruit, Mrs. L. travels to various villages to buy her inventory. Unable to satisfy all her customers because of financial constraints, she is requesting her first loan so that she can be responsive to the needs of her numerous customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1973 à Sakété dans le département du Plateau au Sud-Est du Bénin, Dame L. Henriette est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont Ronel âgé de 16 ans est en classe de troisième,Christiane âgée de 14 ans est en classe de cinquième et Marcelline âgée de 9 ans est en classe de CM2. D'une grande expérience dans la vente des fruits, elle parcourt les villages pour l'approvisionnement de ses fruits. Incapable de donner satisfaction entière à tous ses clients pour des raisons financières, elle demande son premier prêt pour répondre aux attentes de ses nombreux clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of 7 baskets of avocados, 5 baskets of mangos, and 2 cases of apples

Achat de 7 paniers d'avocat, de 5 paniers de mangue, de 2 cartons de pomme.

loans.name: Gloria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Gloria is married and her husband is a bus driver. They have a 4 year old daughter. She started her business because she has always liked working and having her own business. She also wanted to help her husband financially, especially now that they are paying for their house, while still tending to her home and taking care of her daughter. She used to work at a store where she gained a lot of experience. Then over a year ago she started buying merchandise, effectively launching her grocery store.

Gloria is requesting a loan in the amount of $250, that she will pay in 3 months, to purchase merchandise. With your help she can make her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria es casada y su esposo es chofer de autobus. Tienen una pequeña de 4 años. Ella inició el negocio porque siempre le ha gustado trabajar y tener su propio negocio y atender su hogar, ademas de ayudarle economicamente a su esposo sin descuidar a su hija , sobre todo por que actualemnte estan pagando su casa. Ella trabajaba como empleada en una tienda, trabajo del cual adquirio experiencia hasta hace mas de un año compro mercancia iniciando su negocio de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia. Con tu ayuda Gloria podra hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Ms. Sabina lives in the community of Chambi Chocaque in the Yunguyo province and district. She is a member of the Nueva Vida (New Life) Communal Bank and is 48. She studied up to the sixth grade and has four children. She also cares for a niece who was orphaned. Her husband is disabled due to injuries he received in a traffic accident many years ago.

Currently, she works making women's clothing, such as various kinds of skirts and wool undergarments. She sells her products from a stand in the 15 de Agosto Market in Yunguyo. She decided to start this business because of her oldest son, who was studying at the Altiplano-Puno National University and couldn't afford what he needed for school, such as materials, etc. In light of this, one of his school friends suggested that he learn to sew shawls by machine. He told he mother about the idea and she immediately decided to buy a second-hand sewing machine. Next, they both learned to make the shawls.

At the time, Ms. Sabina only had two thirds of the money she needed to buy the sewing machine, so she went to Ms. Toribia Pilco to ask about getting a loan from the microfinance institute Manuela [Ramos]. She quickly decided to join her community's Communal Bank. That's how she was granted her first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevo soles [local currency], in order to pay for the sewing machine. She is now seeking a loan of S/. 500.00 in order to purchase different colored wools. She will repay the loan in four months.

Ms. Sabina is very happy at present, as all of her children have learned to sew. This joint family effort has helped the family increase its income. In the future, Ms. Sabina would like to buy more sewing machines and increase her business, becoming a successful businesswoman in the Yunguyo province.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Sabina vive en la comunidad de Chambi Chocaque del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo y pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Vida, tiene 48 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto de primaria y es madre de 4 hijos y es responsable de una sobrina huerfanita. Su esposo es inválido por el accidente de tránsito que sufrió hace mucho tiempo.

Ella actualmente se dedica en la confección de prendas de vestir exclusivo para damas como: enaguas, centros, combinaciones de lana en su mayoría. La venta lo realiza en el puesto que tiene en el mercado 15 de agosto de Yunguyo. Esta actividad fue motivada por su hijo mayor quién estudiaba, en ese entonces, en la Universidad Nacional del Altiplano-Puno, en donde no tenía dinero para sus separatas, cuotas en su salón, frente a ello uno de sus compañeros lo animó a tejer chalinas a máquina. Luego todo ello le contó a su madre y ella inmediatamente decidió comprar una máquina de tejer (de segunda), y también lograron aprender a tejer las prendas.

En ese entonces, para el pago de la máquina le faltaba una tercera parte del capital, por ello ha recurrido ante la señora Toribia Pilco para que explique sobre cómo acceder al crédito de Manuela, inmediatamente decidió constituir el Banco Comunal en su comunidad. Así accedió al primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para cancelar la máquina de tejer. Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 comprará lanas de diferentes colores. Este crédito lo pagará en 4 meses.

Ahora ella se encuentra contenta porque todos sus hijos aprendieron a confeccionar y mejoró sus ingresos, gracias al esfuerzo conjunto de su familia. Su perspectiva a futuro es implementar con más maquinas de tejer y ser empresaria exitosa en la provincia de Yunguyo.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of wool.

loans.name: Cinthia Manoella

texts.es:
Cinthia is married and has a 7 year old son. She started her business in order to help her husband with the household expenses; they were not able to cover all their needs with just his income. She started 3 years ago selling soft drinks and chips. Later on she started buying different kinds of candy and then with a bonus her husband received, she bought groceries and a refrigerator. In this manner she established her general store.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $250, to be paid in 3 months, to purchase merchandise and be able to offer more variety to her clients. With your help, Cinthia will be able to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Cinthia es casada y tiene un hijo de 7 años. Inició el negocio para tener una actividad y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la familia ya que no completaba con el ingreso de su esposo para los solventar los gastos. Comenzó hace 3 años vendiendo refrescos y papas, despues empezo a comprar dulces de distintos tipos y con un aguinaldo de su esposo compro abarrotes y un refrigerador, asi es como logro establecer su tienda de abarrotes.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $ 250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancia que hace falta, y ofrecer mas diversidad a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Cinthia hara crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase mechandise

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr:
Mrs. Josephine O., a widow, was born around 1937 in Cotonou in Littoral County in the south of Benin. Having proved her excellence in the realm of arts and crafts since around 1971, she was chosen to be honored by the Ministry of Handicrafts and Tourism. She purchases the shells she uses to make her works of art in Togo, the country situated to the west of Benin. Mrs. O. has discovered a new market: the sale of her art works in hotels. Thus, she is experiencing some financial difficulty in acquiring the raw materials for her creations, and this is the reason why she is presently requesting her second loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame O. Josephine est une veuve née vers 1937 à COTONOU dans le département du Littoral au sud du BENIN. Ayant fait ses preuves dans le domaine de l'artisanat depuis les années 1971, elle a bénéficié d'un tableau d'honneur qui lui a été décerné par le Ministère de l' Artisanat et du Tourisme. Elle achète du TOGO, pays situé à l'ouest du BENIN, des coquilles dont elle se sert pour la conception des tableaux d'art. Dame O. Josephine a découvert un nouveau marché: la vente de ses œuvres dans les hôtels. Ainsi, pour ses réalisations, elle éprouve quelques difficultés financières pour s'approvisionner, raison pour laquelle elle vient solliciter son deuxième crédit à ALIDé.

loans.use:
purchase of 50 piles of shells, 3 tins of varnish, and 10 meters of poplin

Achat de 50 tas de coquilles, de 3 boîtes de vernis et de 10 mètres de popeline.

loans.name: Olga Felicia

texts.es:
Mrs. Olga is a a 40-year-old widow whose secondary education was incomplete. She is the mother of five children, three of whom study at the high school level. She lives in Yunguyo. She dedicates herself to selling wholesale clothing for men, women, and children in the "15th of August" market in Yunguyo. She currently belongs to the San Juan Communal Bank in the community of San Juan of Totora. She decided to join the communal bank to increase her merchandise, and with her first loan of S/. 300 nuevos soles she purchased 6 dozen pairs of tights. With this loan for $125, which she will repay in four months, she will buy 6 dozen pairs of tights, 3 dozen overalls, and several men's jackets.

She is grateful that she has been able to expand her business and improve her economic situation. She has also learned to be responsible, punctual, and to share her experiences with her partners at their meetings. Because of this, she feels happy and content to be part of the communal bank. Her vision is to increase her cash on hand, expand her business, and become a designer/maker of clothing for retail sale as well as wholesale.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Olga es viuda, tiene 40 años de edad, su nivel de educación alcanzado es secundaria incompleta, es madre de 5 hijos y 3 de sus hijos estudian en el colegio. Vive en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo. Se dedica al negocio de venta de prendas de vestir para damas, niños y varones en el mercado 15 de Agosto en el puesto Nº 7 de la ciudad de Yunguyo Ella pertenece actualmente al Banco Comunal San Juan de la comunidad San Juan de Totora, decidió pertenecer al Banco Comunal para incrementar su mercadería, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró 6 docenas de medias. Con este préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 6 docenas de medias, 3 docenas de buzos y unas cuantas casacas para varones. Ella esta agradecida ya que ha logrado ampliar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, además ha aprendido a ser responsable, puntual y compartir experiencias con las compañeras en las reuniones que tienen. Así se siente feliz y contenta de ser parte del Banco Comunal. Su visión es capitalizarse, ampliar su negocio y convertirse en confeccionista de ropas para vender por mayor y menor.

loans.use: Purchase wholesale clothing to sell

loans.name: Bonin Colette

texts.fr:
Mrs. Bonin Colette O. D. sells ice, cold water, ice pops, and refrigerated beverages at her home. She is married and is the mother of 3 children. Bola (13) is no longer enrolled in school, Hamidath (10) is in fourth grade, and Mouba (7) is in second grade. Since she lacks the financial means to expand her drinks sales, Mrs. O. D. is requesting her third loan to acquire a refrigerator which will permit her to increase her production and better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Dame O. D. Bonin Colette est vendeuse de glâce, d'eau fraîche,des sucettes et de la boisson fraîche à la maison. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont Bola âgée de 13 ans a cessé de fréquenter, Hamidath âgée de 10 ans est élève en classe de CM2, Mouba âgé de 7 ans est en classe de CP2. Faute de moyens financier pour renforcer la ventede la boissons, elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour acquérir un réfrigérateur qui lui permettra d'augmenter sa production et de satisfaire au mieux ses clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of a freezer

Achat d'un congélateur

loans.name: Nadège Diane

texts.fr:
Born around 1975 in Cotonou in the south of Benin, Mrs. Diane Nadège O. is the mother of 3 children, all of whom are enrolled in school and for whom she is solely responsible, as she is divorced from her husband. She is involved not only in selling fruit which she provides wholesale to women who retail it, but also in the sale of various items and of liquors. She is requesting her third loan to bolster her capital for liquors.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1975 à Cotonou au sud du BENIN, dame O. Nadège Diane est mère de 3 enfants tous scolarisés et dont la charge lui revient entièrement car ayant divorcée d'avec son mari. Elle intervient non seulement dans le commerce des fruits qu'elle livre en gros aux femmes qui les revendent en détail, mais aussi dans la commercialisation de divers articles et des liqueurs. Elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour renforcer son capital de liqueurs.

loans.use:
Purchase of 20 cases of liquor

Achat de 20 cartons de liqueur.

loans.name: Mouïnatou Morayo

texts.fr:
Born on December 5, 1971 in Sakété in the southeast of Benin, Mrs. Mouïnatou Morayo S. is married to Chakirou Sadikou, who is a truck driver. She is the mother of four children; Raïmi (18) is in eleventh grade, Manfous (15) is in ninth grade, Adjara (12) is in sixth grade, and Toybath (8) is in second grade. She has a hardware store where she also sells shoes and plastic ware. Presently, she is having financial difficulty stocking her shop. She is requesting this loan so that she can achieve her noble ambition.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 5 Décembre 1971 à Sakété au Sud-Est du Bénin,dame S. Mouïnatou Morayo est mariée à SADIKOU Chakirou, Chauffeur transporteur de profession. Elle est mère de 4 enfants dont Raïmi âgé de 18ans est en classe de Seconde, Manfous âgé de 15 ans est en classe de Quatième, Adjara âgée de 12 ans est en classe de Sixième et Toybath 8 ans est en classe de CM1. Elle dispose d'une boutique de quincaillerie où elle vend en plus des chaussures et des plastiques. Actuellement, elle est a des difficultés financières pour approvisionner sa boutique. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour réaliser sa noble ambition.

loans.use:
Purchase of 15 dozen door locks, 2 cases of padlocks, 50 bags of galvanized nails, and 5 boxes of pots of glue

Achat de 15 douzaines de serrures de portes, de 02 cartons de cadenas, de 50 sachets de pointes galvanisées et de 5 boîtes de pot de colle.

loans.name: Diane

texts.fr:
Born around 1979 in Adjohoun in Ouémé County in the southeast of Benin, Mrs. Diane S. is married to Alain Dego, a moto-taxi driver. She is the mother of two children: Ghislain (7) who is enrolled in school and Cécile who is three years old. Mrs. Diane S. sells plastic bags and bread. Presently, she is having difficulty stocking her products. She is thus requesting this loan to respond to the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1979 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé au Sud-Est du BENIN, Dame S. Diane est mariée à DEGO Alain, conducteur de taxi moto. Elle est mère de deux enfants dont Ghislain âgé de 7 ans est en classe de CI et Cécile âgée de 3 ans. Dame S. Diane vend des sachets plastiques et du pain. Actuellement, elle éprouve des difficultés dans l'approvisionnement de ses produits.Elle vient donc solliciter ce prêt pour répondre aux attentes de la clientèle.

loans.use:
Add to her stock of baskets, bread, and plastic bags

Augmenter de paniers, de pains et d'un bal de sachets.

loans.name: Bernadette Gbedande

texts.fr: Born on November 26, 1961 in Cotonou in Littoral County, Mrs. Bernadette Gbedande S. comes from Porto-Novo. She is married and the mother of 3 school-age children: Kalice (18) in eleventh grade, Irène (15) in eighth grade, and Roger (11) who is in fourth grade. She retails bread and also makes cakes that she distributes to other retailers. She is asking for this loan so as to increase her production capacity and to satisfy her customers. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteerNée le 26/11/1961 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral, dame S. Bernadette Gbedande est originaire de Porto-Novo. Mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont Kalice âgé de 18 ans est en classe de Seconde, Irène âgée de 15 ans est en classe de Quatrième et Roger âgé de 11 ans est en classe de CM2. Elle est revendeuse de pain et fabrique en plus des gâteau qu'elle distribue à d'autres revendeuses. Elle demande ce crédit pour augmenter sa capacité de production et pour satisfaire ses clients.

loans.use: Improve the quality of her bread and buy 25 kg of wheat flourAugmenter la quantité de pain et acheter 25 kg de farine de blé.

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Ms. Luz Elena T. Q. is a member of the "Mujeres Luchadoras" (Fighting Women) Communal Bank, and lives in the Tarapoto District of the San Martin province in the region of San Martin. She works selling food, mainly regional dishes such as juanes and humitas (both are similar to tamales), and small tamales. She sells her food from stand No. 3 at the market located in the Huayco neighborhood of her city.

She will use the S/. 1500.00 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, for the daily purchase of the supplies she needs to prepare her dishes, such as bunches of plantains, chicken, sacks of rice, bottles of oil, eggs, bijao leaves (used to wrap the juanes), corn on the cob, dried corn and peanuts, salt, herbs and spices and other necessary ingredients.

Luz is 43 and lives with her 2 children and husband. She feels very encouraged by the support from her family and is grateful for the support she receives from the Communal Bank as well. They give her strength to forge ahead and she knows that her business is a great opportunity to grow and to be able to reach all of her goals. In the future she would like to have a business buying and selling grain because she knows that it is a very profitable business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luz Elena T. Q. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de comida, principalmente de platos de la región como juanes, humitas y tamalitos, su puesto de ventas se ubica en el mercado de abastos N° 3 del barrio Huayco de la ciudad .

Con el crédito recibido de S/. 1500.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara diariamente los insumos necesarios para la preparación de sus diferentes platos de comida como: plátanos en racimos, carne de pollo, arroz en sacos, aceite en botellas, huevos en javas, hojas de bijao, (planta para envolver los juanes) maíz choclo, maíz y maní seco, sal, condimentos y otros ingredientes necesarios.

Tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a sus 2 hijos, y su esposo ella se siente alentada por el apoyo de su familia y agradecida del apoyo del Banco Comunal que le dan fuerzas para seguir adelante, está segura que su negocio es una gran oportunidad para crecer y poder cumplir con todas sus metas. En el futuro quiere tener un negocio de compra y venta de granos porque asegura que es un negocio rentable.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina is a member of the "Fighting Women" communal bank and lives in Tarapoto in the San Martín region of Peru. She established her business on one of the city's main streets where people daily go for their meals, and her main customers are drivers passing through. She married at a young age and had to help her husband with the family income in order to raise their two children. Counting on the support of her mother-in-law, she decided to work at her current location, where she works from the early hours of the morning until noon, selling traditional dishes, cooked eggs and stuffed potatoes made with good seasoning and served with refreshing beverages made from regional fruits. Her clientele grows daily because of the quality of her products. With the loan, which she plans to repay within six months, she will purchase ingredients needed to make her dishes, like rice, chicken, eggs, potatoes and other items that will allow her to make her rich meals and better serve her customers. She also plans to buy larger pans.

Adelina is 28 years old with two small children, and sadly her husband passed away four months ago. That is reason enough for her to want to condition her home so she can put in a restaurant, which will allow her to give her children a better future and be closer to them in the process.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Adelina P. S. es socia del Banco.Comunal. “Mujeres Luchadoras” , vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto , desarrolla su negocio en una de las calles principales de la ciudad donde diariamente acuden su comensales, que son moradores de la propia localidad o transeúntes, siendo sus mas frecuentes clientes los motocarristas. El casarse a temprana edad y tener que ayudar a su esposo en los ingresos económicos para criar a sus 2 hijos y contando con el apoyo de su suegra decidió instalarse en un lugar fijo donde actualmente trabaja a partir de las primeras horas de la mañana hasta el medio día, vendiendo juanes, huevos cocinados y papas rellenas preparados con muy buena sazón y refrescos de frutas de la región, que hace que cada día su clientela aumente por lo que se siente muy satisfecha. Con el crédito de S/ 2500.00 que devolverá en un plazo de pago de 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como, arroz en sacos, pollo en kilos, huevos en javas, papas en sacos y otros insumos que le permitirá preparar sus ricos potajes, para una mejor atención a sus clientes e implementara su negocio con ollas grandes. Adelina es una mujer joven de 28 años, con 2 hijos pequeños, pues su esposo falleció hace 4 meses, razón mas que suficiente por lo que ahora anhela acondicionar en su casa un ambiente donde instalar su restaurante, darles un futuro mejor y estar mas cerca de ellos.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients / Compra de insumos.

loans.name: Lili

texts.es:
Lili belongs to the "Fighting Women" communal bank and lives in Tarapoto in the San Martín region of Peru. She sells gutted hens and chickens are her post at the local city market. She separated from her husband 20 years ago, and out of her own initiative decided to dedicate herself to her trade so she would be able to provide for her five small children and afford their education. With the loan, which she plans to repay with six months, she will purchase caged chickens and hens to sell daily by piece and weight to the housewives who go to the market to stock up on meat to feed their families. Lili is 57 years old, and all her children whom she worked so hard for are now out on their own. Today, she works with the same spirit and with the security of having a comfortable life surrounded by her family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Lili F. C. , pertenece del Banco comunal “ Mujeres Luchadoras” , vive en el distrito de Tarapoto provincia de San Martín , y departamento de San Martín, se dedica a la venta de pollos y gallinas desviscerados en su puesto de ventas del mercado Nº 2 en el Jr Tahuantinsuyo Cuadra 3 de esta ciudad. Hace 20 años al separarse de su esposo, por propia iniciativa, decidió dedicarse ala venta de pollos desviscerados, para así poder solventar los gastos de alimentación y escolares de sus 5 menores hijos. Con este crédito de S/. 1,800.00, que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará pollos y gallinas vivas en javas de 10 unidades para venderlos diariamente en pedazos y en kilos a las amas de casa que acuden diariamente al mercado a abastecerse de carne para el preparado de sus alimentos. La señora Lili F. Carvajal tiene 57 años, todos sus hijos ya son independientes para quienes trabajo día a día para sacarlos adelante, hoy ella continua con los mismos ánimos y con la seguridad de tener una vejez tranquila rodeada de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase caged hens and chickens / Compra de animales menores.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Diana Luz

texts.es:
Diana belongs to the "Women headed toward success" communal bank and lives in Morales in the San Martín region of Peru. She is dedicated to selling gutted chickens at her post in the local market in the city of Tarapoto. It was her husband who motivated her to take on the job, since he is a chicken distributor. Thanks to her perseverance and skill she has been able to increase her sales and has a very good clientele. She also likes the personal interaction with customers, and her work allows her generate her own income so she has better self-esteem from the growth as a person and a woman. With the $700 loan, which she plans to repay within six months, she wants to purchase caged hens and chicks to sell by pieces and kilograms. She also plans to purchase an electric scale that will allow her to show her customers the exact weight of what she is selling. Diana is quite young, at only 21 years of age with two children. Along with her husband she works hard to provide for them. Her goal is to have her own wholesale post selling live chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Diana Luz P. T. , pertenece del Banco comunal “ Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo” , vive en el distrito de Morales provincia de San Martín , y departamento de San Martín, se dedica a la venta de pollos desviscerados en su puesto de ventas del mercado Nº 2 ubicado en el Jr Nicolás de Pierola Cuadra 4, de la ciudad de Tarapoto . Fue su esposo quien la motivo a poner su puesto de venta de pollos, ya que él es distribuidor de estas aves, gracias a su perseverancia y buen trato sus ventas aumentaron y tiene muy buena clientela además le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, y esto le permite generar sus propios ingresos lo cual aumenta su autoestima, crecer como persona y mujer. Con este crédito de S/. 2000.00, que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará pollos y gallinas vivas en javas de 10 unidades para venderlos diariamente en pedazos y en kilos, además con el préstamo comprará una balanza eléctrica que le permite atender a su público con peso exacto de su producto. La señora Diana Luz es bastante joven, pues tiene solo 21 años y dos hijos, junto a su esposo trabaja con perseverancia para así poderlos atender en todas sus necesidades, anhela tener su propio puesto de venta de pollos vivos al por mayor.

loans.use: Purchase hens and chickens wholesale as well as an electric scale / Compra de animales menores al por mayor.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen is a young married woman who does not as yet have any kids. She owns her own business selling plants, fertilizers, plant pots and other garden items. Her business is located in one of the neighbourhoods which houses a lot of garden nurseries of the Cabañas de Caacupé company.

Carmen adds that apart from just selling plants, she also sells jewellery like chains, bracelets and rings. With previous loans that Fundacion Paraguaya have got for her she has been able to bulk buy plants, fertilizers, seeds and accessories like hoses, bags and pots. She was also able to buy silver jewellery and other things; all this helped her to obtain an increase in her earnings and clientele.

Her main clients are businesses that resell her plants, i.e. they buy them in bulk and then sell them on to other businesses in the city. She inherited this business from her parents and she is very happy that she has this responsibility to continue with this small business that her parents left her in charge of.

She would like to expand her store and incorporate cabinets to showcase her silver jewellery so that potential clients will be more comfortable. This is why she would like a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen, es una señora joven casada que no tiene hijos aún, ella es propietaria de un negocio que se dedica a la venta de plantas, abono, macetas, entre otros productos para el jardín, su negocio esta ubicado en uno de los barrios dónde es la cuna de los viveros (negocios que se dedican a la venta de plantas e insumos para jardín) en la compañía Cabañas de Caacupé.

Carmen comenta, que aparte de la venta de plantas también vende productos de platería como cadenillas, pulseras y anillos. Con los préstamos anteriores que le otorgo la Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar gran cantidad de plantas abonos, semillas y accesorios como mangueras, bolsas, maceta, y una parte lo invirtió en la compra de joyas de platas entre otros artículos; todo esto ayudó a que ella obtenga un gran aumento de ingresos y clientes en su negocio.

Sus principales cliente son los comerciantes que vuelve a revender las plantas, es decir, compran en gran cantidad y posteriormente lo vuelven a vender en negocios de otras ciudades. El negocio lo heredó de sus padres y afirma que se siente muy satisfecha por el hecho de que tiene la responsabilidad de continuar la microempresa que sus padres le dejo a cargo.

Tiene pensado ampliar su salón e incorporar muebles para exponer sus joyas de platas y así ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes potenciales es por ello que está solicitando un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To expand the business and to buy display cabinets/ampliación del negocio y compra de muebles como exhibidores.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is a member of The Violets communal bank and lives in the San Martín region of Peru. She has her own store where she is dedicated to selling groceries and school supplies. With the support of her husband and daughter and her own faith and dedication, Gloria has been able to see her business grow considerably. When she started she only had one nearly empty display case and now she offers a variety of products. With the loan, which she plans to repay within six months, she wants to purchase rice, sugar, milk, oil, detergents, soaps and personal hygiene products, soft drinks and different kinds of snacks so she can stock her store and meet her customers' demands. Gloria is 46 years old and lives with her husband and daughter, who encourage her to work hard every day and achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Gloria M. D. es socia del Banco.Comunal. “Las Violetas“ , vive en la región de San Martín, provincia de Rioja, distrito de Nueva Cajamarca, su negocio esta ubicado en el Jr. Bolognesi Nro 300, y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y útiles escolares. Con el apoyo de su esposo y su hija, la constancia y dedicación propia ha logrado que el negocio se incremente considerablemente, ya que cuando se inició solo tenía una vitrina casi vacía, ahora oferta variedad de productos. Con el crédito de S/.1000.00 y devolverá en un plazo de pago de 6 meses, comprará arroz, azúcar en bolsas , leche, aceite en cajas, detergentes, jabones y útiles de limpieza en general, gaseosas y golosinas diversas para surtir su negocio y cubrir las expectativas de sus clientes. La señora Gloria tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y su hija, quienes le impulsan a esforzarse cada día más y lograr cumplir con sus metas trazadas.

loans.use: Purchase a wide range of groceries / Compra de productos diversos (abarrotes).

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Manuela Ramos / CrediMUJER - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Santos Esther

texts.es:
Mrs. Santos Esther is requesting this loan to invest in improving her home by adding a bedroom. She has worked as a teacher in the "Rafaela Herrera" school for the last eight years. She has two children. The older is 17, and is in his third year of secondary education. Her younger child is 8, and he is in his second year of primary education at the Fonseca camp in Nueva Guinea. She is a very sociable and responsible person. Santos has to travel three hours on horseback to a region of the country so she can impart the bread of education to the country children in her area. Her dream is to have a stable job and a beautiful home.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Santos Esther está solicitando su crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, construcción de una habitación, labora como docente de la Escuela Rafaela Herrera desde hace 8 años, tiene dos hijos, la mayor de 17 años de edad estudia su tercer años de educación secundaria y su hijo menor de 8 años de edad estudia su segundo grado de educación primaria en colonia la Fonseca en Nueva Guinea, es una persona muy responsable y sociable, Santos tiene que viajar a tres horas montada a caballo a una comarca a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de esa comarca, su sueño es tener estabilidad laboral y una vivienda bonita.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build an additional room

loans.name: Aracelly Petronila

texts.es:
Mrs. Aracelly is 33 years old and lives in the Concepción neighborhood of San Juan. She is married, and has two children, ages 6 and 11, in school. Her husband works in the Ministry of Health, and contributes towards the expenses of the family.

Aracelly's business is raising pineapple. She has nine years of experience in cultivation and began the business through her own labors. She needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Aracelly tiene 33 años de edad, habita en el barrio la Concepción -San Juan, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 6 y 11 años de edad que están estudiando, su esposo trabaja en el minsa y aporta al gastos de la familia. El negocio de doña Aracelly es la producción de piña y lleva nueve años en el cultivo e inició con esfuerzos propios. El préstamo lo requiere para comprar insumos agrícolas para mejorar la producción.

loans.use: Adquisición de abonos para aplicárselos a su cosecha de piña

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Mrs. Raquel is 30 years old and lives in the "Hacienda La Enramada" (Arbor Estates) neighborhood of Ticuantepe. She is married and has two children, ages 1 and 9. Her husband works and covers the household expenses. Raquel has eleven years of experience selling meats, a business she began with her own money. The loan she is requesting is for household improvements and the expansion of one of the bedrooms. In the future she hopes to improve the living conditions for her little daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Raquel tiene 30 años de edad, habita en el barrio casa hacienda la enramada en Ticuantepe, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 1 y 9 años de edad, su esposo trabaja y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Doña Raquel vende carne, tiene once años de experiencia e inició con fondos propios. El préstamo que esta solicitando es para mejoras de vivienda en la ampliación de un cuarto de habitación. A futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida para su pequeña hija.

loans.use: Expansion of a bedroom

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes is a member of the Working Women communal bank and lives in Tarapoto in the San Martín region of Peru. Her business is located in her own home, where she is dedicated to selling all kinds of groceries and snacks. She has been doing this for the past two years, and thanks to her hard work and dedication she has maD. her business grow. With the loan, which she plans to repay within four months, she wants to purchase packaged snacks of different varieties and flavors, rice, sugar, flour, personal hygiene and home products as well as stock up on soft drinks and mineral water, among other beverages. Mercedes is 46 years old and has six children, four boys and two girls. She is a very responsible woman with hopes of getting ahead. She dreams of have a bigger business and ensuring her family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Mercedes N. T. D. Garcia, socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajando” vive en la Región San Martín, Provincia D. San Martín y distrito D. Tarapoto, su negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. Federico Sánchez Nº 139, se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en general y golosinas. Ella se dedica a este negocio hace 2 años, ya que gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado que su negocio se amplié. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará golosinas en paquetes D. distintas variedades y sabores, arroz, azúcar y harina en sacos, útiles D. aseo personal y para el hogar, además D. surtir con bebidas gasificadas, agua mineral, entre otros. La Señora Mercedes tiene 46 años y 06 hijos, 04 varones y 02 mujeres, ella es una mujer muy responsable y con deseos D. salir adelante, sueña con tener un negocio más granD. y asegurar el bienestar D. su familia.

loans.use: Purchase snacks and other products wholesale / Compra de golosinas al por mayor.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Miguelina is a member of The Orchids communal bank and lives in Tarapoto in the San Martín region of Peru. She's dedicated to the sale of beauty products and runs her business out of her own home. For the past two years Miguelina has been selling perfumery and cosmetics of different brands like Esika, Avon and Unique via orders and catalogue. Her main customers are her neighbors, friends and relatives. With the $275 loan, which she plans to repay within six months, she wants to purchase diverse items such as creams, shampoos, soaps, make-up, deodorant and other brand-name products so she can add a wider variety of products and meet her customers’ demands. Miguelina is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children, who are her motivation to keep moving ahead and reach her goals, the reason she works day after day with such persistence. She yearns to grow her business even more and have her own store site.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Miguelina B. M. D. Pezo , es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Orquideas”, vive en el Departamento D. San Martín, provincia D. San Martin, Distrito D. Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza, su negocio se ubica en su propia casa en el Jr. Sachapuquio Nº 270. Se dedica hace 2 años a la venta D. artículos D. perfumería y cosméticos D. diferentes marcas como Esika, Avon, Unique, que lo venD. a través D. pedidos y por catalogo, siendo sus principales clientes sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. Con el crédito D. S/. 800.00 que será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará diversos artículos como, cremas, champús, jabones, maquillajes, desodorante y otros productos más, D. estas marcas, para así variar sus productos y satisfacer las preferencias D. sus clientes Tiene 47 años vive con su esposo y sus 02 pequeños , los que le motivan a salir adelante y alcanzar sus metas, razón por el que día a día trabaja con mucha perseverancia, anhelando mas adelante ampliar su negocio y tener un local propio.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products, cosmetics, etc. / Compra de productos de belleza, cosméticos, etc.

loans.name: Maladoh Group

texts.en: Issa K. is the group leader of Maladoh group. He sells clothes and shoes in the market of Magburaka in Sierra Leone. He started his business more than five years ago but on a very small scale. With previous loans from SMT, he increased his stock, and he is happy that his family's income also increased. Issa would like to continue expanding his business. Within the group, Bai K. sells shoes, and Isatu M. and Abdul B. own grocery stalls. The group members are requesting a loan of $1,125 to expand their businesses and to earn more income for their families.

loans.use: To purchase shoes, clothes, and groceries to expand their businesses

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
Camila is a member of the "Las Golondrinas" ("The Swallows") group-lending organization. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She earns a living making and selling food, from a remodeled room in her house where her guests come each day to eat. They're mostly local people or passers-by from nearby neighborhoods. Thanks to a recommendation from a friend and without any other requirement, she received a loan from Manuela Ramos when she most needed it. That's how she was able to contribute to her family's household expenses and especially to the school fees of her 2 children. It was that requirement that drove her to start the business making and selling dishes typical to this area. Thanks to her perseverance and drive to get ahead, she's managed to create a business.

With the S/.1000 (1000 Peruvian soles) loan, to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy bulk supplies of rice, sugar, pasta, (bunches of) bananas and cooking oil, all of which are becoming increasing expensive, so that she has large inventories of basic products, just like she had her own store. All will be used to make the food that she provides to her customers.

Camila, 52, is a happy and enthusiastic woman who, together with her husband, wants in her humble way to contribute to the progress of the community that has given her the chance to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Camila Ramírez Ramírez, es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Las Golondrinas”, vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de San Martín y distrito de Tarapoto se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, en un ambiente acondicionado especialmente en su propia casa, ubicada en el jr Ramón castilla Nro 1388 donde diariamente acuden su comensales, que son moradores de la propia localidad o transeúntes de lugares cercanos. Gracias a la invitación de una amiga ella obtuvo un préstamo sin mayores requisitos en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, en el momento que mas necesitaba, y de esta manera poder aportar económicamente en los gastos de la casa, sobretodo en la educación superior de sus 2 hijos. Esta necesidad la impulsó a iniciarse en el negocio de la preparación de comida tipo menú en el mercado “La paradita”, gracias a su perseverancia y ganas de salir adelante ha obtenido lo que ahora tiene.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 a ser pagados en 4 meses implementará su negocio comprando arroz, azúcar por sacos, fideos en paquetes, plátano en racimos y aceite a granel ya que sus costos cada vez son mas elevados y a ella le conviene tener en cantidad como su propio almacén, para la preparación de la comida que ha diario ofrece a su clientela.

La señora Camila tiene 52 años, es una muy mujer entusiasta y alegre que junto a su esposo y con la humildad que demuestra quiere contribuir al progreso de la comunidad que le dio la oportunidad de salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of products for food business.

loans.name: Tawopaneh Ll Group

texts.en: Kadiatu F., the leader of Tawopaneh ll group, is 45 years of age and is married with three children. She has been selling fish for five years and only expanded her business after her previous loan from Kiva. She is very grateful to Kiva that the loan enabled her to build her own capital and to purchase the fish using cash. With the profit, she also paid her first child's school fees. All the group members are engaged in fish selling in Magburaka town in Sierra Leone, and they would like to continue expanding their businesses and building their capital. The group is therefore requesting a loan of $1,125 for that purpose.

loans.use: To increase their stock of dried fish to expand their businesses

loans.name: Dorina

texts.es:
Dorina is a member of the "Mujeres Luchadoras" ("Battling Women") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin where she earns a living selling various bulk food items. She has a stall in the Numero 3 ("Number 3") market in Tarapoto. She started her business 8 years ago, with help from her niece. Because of her dedication and perseverance, the business has grown. When she started, she only had certain types of maize, but now she sells a variety of products including beans of various kinds, lentils, peas, ground coffee, etc.

With the S/.900 (900 Peruvian soles), to be repaid in 6 months, Dorina will buy wholesale supplies of maize, beans, lentils and peas that she will then sell in smaller lots. She will also buy unprocessed coffee beans that she'll then toast and grind for sale to her regular customers.

Dorina, 67, is thoroughly committed to her business, despite her age, because she enjoys operating it and being with her customers. She says that she's always described herself as strong, determined, serene and up for a fight. She wants to have a business at home so that she can enjoy a quiet retirement.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Dorina T. G. es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Luchadoras”, vive en el Departamento y Provincia de San Martín y Distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de granos de todas las variedades, en su puesto de venta ubicado en el mercado nº 3 Barrio- Huayco Tarapoto. Se inició en el negocio desde hace 8 años, contó con el apoyo de su sobrina. Con dedicación y perseverancia ha logrado que el negocio se incremente, ya que cuando se inició solo tenia maíz en grano y maíz chancado, ahora oferta variedad de productos como fríjol, de distintas variedades, lentejas, alverjas, maíz canchita, café molido.

Con el préstamo de S/. 900.00, que será devuelto en 6 meses comprará maíz en sacos, fríjol de distintas variedades en sacos, lentejas y alverjas en grandes cantidades, para ser vendidos estos productos por kilos al por menor, además ella compró café en granos que después de ser tostados y molidos oferta a sus clientes que diariamente la visitan.

Tiene 67 años, que a pesar de su edad, ella se dedica a este negocio porque le gusta y así se distrae con su clientela. Siempre se caracterizó por ser fuerte, perseverante, tranquila y luchadora. Ella anhela tener un negocio en su propia casa para así tener una vejez tranquila.

loans.use: Buy bulk supplies of food items for resale.

loans.name: Grace Association Group

texts.en: Fatu S. is the group leader of the Grace Association group. The group members have been working together for more than two years as a savings and rotating club. With their previous loans from SMT, the group increased their stock and helped each other purchase fish in turns. Fatu S. is 49 years old and has two children who are in college. Her business is the main source of income for the family, as her husband's salary is insufficient to meet the family's expenses. The group is requesting a loan of $850 to expand their businesses and clientele into the neighboring villages.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to expand their businesses

loans.name: Erika Yuridiana

texts.es:
Erica is a member of the Las F. de Maria ("Flowers of Mary") group-lending organization. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin and earns a living making and selling food. She operates her business at home, serving her customers, many of whom are students at the nearby Universidad Nacional. Her experience making various dishes, her skill with flavors and her need for an income of her own all led her to start a restaurant business, something that will allow her to help her husband with the family's expenses.

With the S/.800 (800 Peruvian soles) loan, to be repaid in 4 months, Erica will set up her business by buying bulk supplies of products such as rice, sugar, pasta, (bunches of) bananas, cooking oil and condiments. She knows that prices for those commodities aren't stable and she wants an inventory on hand so that she doesn't run out when she most needs them. She also wants to stock soft drinks because she's seen that they sell well, especially in this particular area.

Erica, 24, is a loving and determined women with two children. She lives with her partner and dreams of having a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Erica Yuridiana F.
