Ríos, es socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto ”Las F. de Maria” vive en el departamento y provincia de San Martín se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, y espera a sus clientes en su propia casa ubicada en jr Sucre Nro 56 Barrio San Martín, una gran cantidad de sus clientes son los alumnos de la Universidad Nacional ya que su local se ubica cerca de esta institución educativa. Su experiencia en la preparación de diversos platos de comida, su buena sazón y la necesidad de tener un ingreso propio, la impulsaron a iniciarse en este negocio, para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su familia.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 que será pagado en 4 meses, ella implementará su negocio, pues comprará insumos como: arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, plátano en racimos y aceite a granel y condimentos, en vista de que no hay estabilidad en los precios de los productos y no le falte sus insumos al momento de preparar los alimentos a vender, además esta implementando su negocio con la venta de gaseosas, por que vio que si tiene buena salida este producto, sobretodo por la ubicación de su local.

La señora Erica Yuridiana tiene 24 años es una mujer muy amorosa y decidida, tiene dos hijos vive con su actual pareja y sueña con tener un Restaurante.

loans.use: Buy supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Tawopaneh Multipurpose Group

texts.en: Haja K. is the group leader of Tawopaneh Multipurpose group. She sells local products such as rice and palm oil in the market of Magburaka town in Sierra Leone. At the age of 49, Haja has nine children, and she has to work hard to meet their needs. Her husband is a teacher whose salary is insufficient to meet all the family expenses, so Haja's business income supplements their expenses. Adama and Hassanatu also sell local products in the same market, and Sallamatu owns a small grocery stall. The goup would like to increase their stock and is therefore requesting a loan of $850.

loans.use: To increase their stock of rice, palm oil, peanuts, and other items to sell in the market

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica is a member of the "Sembrando Futuro" ("Sowing The Future") community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin and operates her business from a stall in the Numero 2 ("Number 2") market in Tarapoto. She sells coconuts that grow naturally in the surrounding forests. The idea for Jessica's business came from her mother who knew that Jessica wanted to help her husband increase the family income and better provide for their children.

With the S/.800 (800 Peruvian soles) loan, to be repaid in 6 months, Jessica will buy bulk supplies of coconuts to sell in smaller lots to quench the thirst of her customers in the stifling heat here in the Peruvian rain forest.

Jessica, 23, lives with her husband and two young children. She's a very responsible woman, a requirement for a business like this that calls for a lot of sacrifice since she often has to go quite far to find the products that the customers who buy from her each day demand. It was her desire to provide a better life for her children that drove her to make herself over as a budding entrepeneur. She considers herself a fighter, a woman who perseveres and serves as a good example for her kids because of her dedication to her business and her unconditional support for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Jessica T. S., es socia del Banco Comunal “Sembramdo Futuro.” vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de Tarapoto distrito de Tarapoto, tiene ubicado su negocio el mercado Nro 2 y se dedica a la venta da cocos que producen en nuestra región de la selva. La idea del negocio surgió por la iniciativa de su mamá y la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo para mejorar sus ingresos y así sacar a delante a sus hijos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 el cual será cancelado en 6 meses comprará cocos en grandes cantidades para venderlos por unidades y cientos y así saciar la sed de sus clientes, ante el sofocante calor de esta parte de la selva del país.

Ella tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a sus 2 hijos menores y su esposo, es una mujer muy responsable, porque este negocio requiere de mucho sacrificio ya que mucha veces tiene que ir a lugares muy lejanos en busca de este producto, y tener satisfechos a sus clientes que diariamente la visitan, sus deseos de sacar adelante a sus hijos le impulsó a desarrollarse como pequeña empresaria. Se considera luchadora, perseverante y siente que es un gran ejemplo para sus hijos por su dedicación a su negocio y apoyo incondicional a su familia.

loans.use: Buy bulk supplies of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Santos' Group

texts.en:
Santos is married and has a child. She has been selling lingerie for 20 years and her business gradually grew.

L. is married and has 3 school-age children. She sells clothes in a shopping arcade. Before that, she sold clothes from a trolley. Now she would like to pursue another business in the shopping arcade so as to supplement her income.

Luz is married and has 3 children. She has been selling shoes for women for a year now, and before that, she sold clothes. Her major issue is the lack of capital to purchase merchandise. Later she would like to have her own store.

Santos, L., and Luz are soliciting loans of 1600 soles (about US$ 560), 400 soles (US$ 140), and 1000 soles (about $ 350) respectively to purchase merchandise for supplying their businesses.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for supplying their businesses

loans.name: Verónica's Group

texts.en:
Veronica and July belong to the Los Jazmines Village Bank in San Juan de Lurigancho in the east of Lima.

Veronica is married and has a 14-year-old child who will finish secondary school next year. She has been selling Omnilife products by mail order for 4 years. She sells those products from house to house, but she also has some permanent clients. She also opened a bookstore with her husband 3 months ago.

July lives with her common-law husband and has a 4-year-old son who is still in nursery school. With her common-law husband, she has been selling wholesale lingerie for 3 years and makes home deliveries.

Veronica and July are soliciting loans of 1200 soles (about US$ 425) and 1000 soles (about US$ 350) respectively. Veronica wants to invest in her bookstore and July wants to buy more merchandise.

Veronica and July have a lot of plans, such as growing their businesses and helping their children who are still school age.

loans.use: invest in their respective businesses

loans.name: Paddy Paddy Ll Group

texts.en: Rugiatu K. is the group leader of the Paddy Paddy II group. She sells dried fish in the market of Magburaka town in Sierra Leone. Rugiatu is 40 years old and married with three children, and she has been running her business for eight years. With her previous small loans from SMT she increased her stock and income, and thus built some capital. She is happy that she can take care of her family with the income from her business. Ibrahim S. and Rosaline K. also sell dried fish. The group is requesting a loan of $600 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To increase their stock of fish and generate more income

loans.name: Anita's Group

texts.en:
Anita and Caridad belong to the Los Jazmines Village Bank in San Juan D. Lurigancho in the east of Lima.

Anita lives with her common-law husband and has 6 children. 4 are over 18 and 2 are school age. She has had a family business making polo shirts for 10 years and sends her clothes to the country for sale.

Caridad is married and has 3 children over 18. She likes weaving bedspreads and blankets and has been weaving for 3 years. Before that, she used to work at home.

Anita and Caridad are soliciting loans of 1600 soles (about US$ 550) and 400 soles (about US$ 150) respectively so as to purchase merchandise so that they can grow their micro-enterprises.

They both want to carry on their businesses to help their families and have an additional income. Anita also would like to finish building her house.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise so that they can grow their micro-enterprises

loans.name: Xejuyu Concepcion Group

texts.en:
The women of the Xejuyu Concepción Group come from very humble backgrounds. They live in the rural areas of the Concepción municipality in the department of Sololá. Of the fifteen women in the group, all but one have children. All of their children of school age are currently in school, as these women have made their children’s education a top priority. None of the women are able to read and write, nor do they speak Spanish, as their day-to-day interactions are all in their native Kaqchikel language. As they gathered to fill out paperwork for requesting the loan, many appeared timid, a little nervous, but definitely excited about the prospect of getting loans, expanding their businesses, and improving their lives. Only two of the fifteen women were able to sign for themselves, while all the others leave their fingerprint in place of a signature.

The Xejuyu Concepción Group is new to Friendship Bridge and, for at least half of these women, this is their first time to have access to credit. They work in a variety of trades: three work in weaving traditional clothing, eleven work in agriculture, and one sells fruits and vegetables. As such, those working in weaving are requesting loans to purchase more thread and fabric, while those working in agriculture and fruit and vegetable sales will use their credit to buy seeds and fertilizer. They already have great plans for the money they are requesting, and hope to get it very soon. Right now is planting season, so the sooner they get the loans the faster they can get their crops going.

In addition to directly helping their businesses, the women hope that the loan will also enable them to save some money. They all want to be able to set aside more money, specifically to ensure that they can pay for their children’s studies and school supplies. Overall, these women dream of improving their lives and those of their families. More than anything they want to see their children complete school and be successful.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer and to buy thread

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.en:
Julia, José, and Araceli belong to the Los Jazmines Village Bank in San Juan de Lurigancho in Lima.

Julia is married and has 5 children. One of them is completely independent and the 4 others are dependent children finishing college. She works with her husband who is a refrigeration technician. She helps him to contact and coordinate with his clients. They have been working together for 20 years. Her major issue is their economic situation because she is responsible for her children's education.

José and Araceli are a couple; they live together and have a 2-year-old child. José has a moto and uses it as a moto-taxi. He works from Mondays through Saturdays. Araceli has been selling shoes to her neighbours and friends for 2 years now. Her major issue is that her clients sometimes delay paying but she carries on with her job and that’s why she has decided to rent a locale in a shopping arcade where she can sell her shoes.

Julia, José and Araceli are requesting loans of 1200 soles (about US$ 420), 600 soles (about $ 205), and 1000 soles (about $ 350) respectively. Julia wants to help her husband to purchase motors and copper tubes for refrigeration systems for his business. José wants to help Araceli to open her shoe store and Araceli will invest in shoes for re-sale.

loans.use: invest in their micro-entreprises

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma is 35 years old, married and lives in the Jocote Dulce area, in the city of Managua. She has four children ages 1, 2, 5 and 15. Her husband is a merchant and contributes with the home expenses. Vilma's business is a general store and also a diner. She has six years of experience and started selling sodas, coffee and pastries. The loan she is requesting is to buy different products and offer them to her clients and improve the service at the diner. In the future she would like to expand her business, increase capital and offer education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Vilma tiene 35 años de edad, es casada y habita en la comarca Jocote Dulce de la ciudad de Managua, tiene cuatro hijos de 1, 2, 5 y 15 años de edad, su esposo es comerciante y aporta a los gastos del hogar. El negocio de doña Vilma es una pulpería y también tiene un comedor. Tiene seis años de experiencia e inició vendiendo refrescos, café y respotería. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar productos diversos para ofrecer a sus clientes y mejorar el servicio del comedor. A futuro es ampliar el negocio y aumentar el capital, brindar educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase products for sale.

loans.name: Fabiola Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fabiola lives in the Esperanza neighborhood, she is married and has 35 years of age. She has 4 children ages 9, 12, 13 and 16. Her husband works for the government ministry as an officer and contributes to the family expenses.

Fabiola sells clothing and cosmetics, she has 5 years of experience and started selling clothing with her own money. The loan she is requesting is to be invested in purchasing more products and get more clients. In the future she would like to invest more in the business, improve her standard of living and provide education to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Fabiola habita en el barrio la Esperanza, es casada y tiene 35 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos de 9, 12,13 y 16 años de edad, su esposo labora en el ministerio de gobernación desempeñándose como oficial y aporta a los gastos de la familia.

Doña Fabiola vende ropa y cosméticos, tiene cinco años de experiencia e inició vendiendo ropa con fondos propios. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para invertir en capital en la compra de más productos para captar más clientes. A futuro es invertir más en el negocio, mejorar el nivel de vida y brindar educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Four years ago Nélida was selling clothing in a store owned by an acquaintance, but the business failed so she had to look for another job. She to started selling cakes 2 years ago when a neighbor told her about this business. She buys the cakes from a third person and sells them in the market near her house; she sells 50 per week. Nélida also works in the mornings for a gentleman selling chicken. In the afternoon she sells the cakes. She also sells buys and sells products that her acquaintances order from her. The loans she has request have served to buy a variety of products that her clients have ordered from her. Nélida would like to buy a motorcycle taxi so that her husband could work with it.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 4 años, Nélida se dedicaba a vender ropa en la tienda de un conocido, pero el negocio fracasó, por lo que tuvo que buscar otro trabajo. Fue así que desde hace 2 años, Nélida empezó a repartir tortas a raíz que una vecina le informó sobre este negocio. Ella compra las tortas a una tercera persona y las reparte en el mercado cerca de su casa. A la semana entrega 50 tortas. Asimismo, por las mañanas Nélida trabaja ayudando a un señor vendiendo pollo. Por la tarde se dedica a entregar las tortas. No obstante, Nélida también compra y vende productos por pedidos que le hacen sus conocidos. Precisamente, los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar diversos productos que sus clientes le han pedido. A Nélida le gustaría comprarse una mototaxi para que su esposo pueda trabajar en ella.

loans.use: To buy a varity of products that her customers have ordered from her

loans.name: Diana

texts.es:
For 9 years Diana has acted in small roles in national television shows. However, after her daughter was born, she had to work less time in that activity. She decided to put a small grocery store in her house. Her new business has been open for one month. The loans she has requested have served to stock her store. She would like for her store to grow and she would also like to continue acting.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 9 años, Diana se dedica a la actuación con papeles pequeños en series nacionales. Sin embargo, luego que nació su hija, tuvo que apartarse parcialmente de esta actividad, por lo que decidió poner una bodega en su casa. Su negocio recién tiene un mes, es así que los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para montar su bodega. A ella le gustaría que su bodega crezca más y seguir dedicándose a la actuación.

loans.use: To buy products that she needs for her small grocery store

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María has been selling beer and sodas for the past 5 years. Her husband has a workshop where he makes decorations from polyester fabric. She also works helping her husband in this business. The loans that she has requested have served to buy the materials that she needs for making the decorations.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

María se dedica a la venta de cerveza y gaseosas desde hace 5 años. Asimismo, su esposo tiene desde hace 3 años un taller donde hacen acabados de adornos a base de poliéster. Ella también trabaja ayudando a su esposo en este negocio. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para la compra de los materiales que necesita en la producción de los adornos.

loans.use: To buy materials that she needs to make decorations

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina studied cosmetology and began practicing her profession in a friend’s beauty salon. Her friend asked her to stay on and work at the salon, and Karina accepted. Before that she sold pantyhose and socks in anther person’s store. Now she works in the salon as a business partner with her friend, so long as she invests in the business. She has been working under this agreement for 6 months. The loans that she has requested have served to buy the supplies that she needs in the salon. Karina would like to put her own beauty salon in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Karina estudió cosmetología y empezó a hacer sus prácticas profesionales en el salón de belleza de una amiga. Ella le pidió que se quedara en el salón trabajando y Karina aceptó. Antes ella se vendía medias en la tienda de otra persona. Ahora, Karina trabaja en el salón como socia de su amiga, puesto que invierte económicamente en el negocio. Ya tiene 6 meses trabajando de esta manera. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para comprar los materiales que necesita en la peluquería. A Karina le gustaría poner su propio salón de belleza en su casa.

loans.use: To buy the supplies she needs in the beauty salon where she works.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina studied sewing, and she has been making baby accessories for the past three years. She sells her products in the center of Lima. Each week she sells 8 dozen of these accessories. She also has had a phone booth in her house for the last 6 months; her niece moved it there for her. The loans that she has received have served to help her buy the fabric and the materials that she needs to make her accessories. Marina has exported the products that she makes to Ecuador and she would like to continue exporting to other countries.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Marina estudió costura, es por eso que se dedica a la confección de accesorios para bebés desde hace tres años. Ella reparte sus productos en el centro de Lima. A la semana vende 8 docenas de estos accesorios. Asimismo, tiene un locutorio en su casa desde hace 6 meses. Su sobrina se lo traspasó. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar la tela y los materiales que necesita en la confección de sus accesorios. Marina ha exportado los productos que confecciona a Ecuador, por lo que le gustaría seguir exportando a demás países.

loans.use: To buy fabric and materials for sewing baby accessories.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia has two liquor stores where her family members work. One store is three-years-old, while the other just turned one. She has worked in a factory on the early shift for one month. She used to work in her stores. The loans that she has received have let her purchase the liquors that she offers in her business. She would like to improve her store and to have a larger working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Virginia tiene dos licorerías en las que trabajan sus familiares. Una tienda tiene 3 años, mientras que la otra recién 1. Ella trabaja en una fábrica en turno de amanecida desde hace 1 mes. Antes se dedicaba a las tiendas. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprar los licores que ofrece en su negocio. A ella le gustaría implementar más su licorería y hacerse de un capital de dinero más grande.

loans.use: To purchase the liquors that she offers in her business

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana opened a small grocery store in her house six years ago, but she had problems and closed it. She soon saw that she needed money, so she decided to re-open a business, but of a different type. She decided to open a book store. However, she eventually had direct competition which caused the business to fail. So, she opened a small grocery store again, which has been open for 1 year. Liliana also works as a receptionist in the mornings. She only tends to her store in the afternoons. The loans she has requested have served to stock her store with products. Liliana would like to expand her business to a bazaar (a small store that sells products such as clothing, jewelry, and gift items, in addition to some grocery items).

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Liliana puso una bodega en su casa hace 6 años, pero tuvo problemas y la cerró. Luego, vio que necesitaba dinero, por lo que decidió reabrir un negocio, pero bajo otro rubro, fue así que puso una librería. Sin embargo, tiempo después, tuvo competencia directa, por lo que el negocio fracasó. Fue así que volvió a poner la bodega, que viene funcionando desde hace 1 año. Asimismo, Liliana trabaja como recepcionista por las mañanas. Solo atiende en su tienda por las tardes. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para surtir con productos la bodega. Liliana quisiera ampliar su bodega a una tienda bazar.

loans.use: To stock her small grocery store

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
For the last two months, Carmen has sold nutritional weight-loss “Herbalife” brand products. Previously she worked as a secretary. However, she got to know Herbalife and as a result decided to leave her job and enter into business. Now she is a wholesaler of these products and invites her acquaintances to join her in business.

Carmen is constantly familiarizing herself with respect to Herbalife’s nutritional products, as this way she can secure sales.

The loans which she has asked for have served to allow advance payment for these products. Carmen wants to continue expanding as a saleswoman inside Herbalife’s Company.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 2 meses, Carmen vende productos nutricionales para bajar de peso de la marca Herbalife. Antes se desempeñaba como secretaria. Sin embargo, conoció Herbalife por lo que decidió abandonar su trabajo e incursionar en esta empresa. Ahora ella es vendedora mayorista de estos productos e invita a sus conocidos a participar de este negocio.

Ella constantemente se actualiza con respecto a los productos nutricionales Herbalife, para así hacer que sus ventas sean seguras.

Los préstamos que ha pedido han servido para pagar por adelantado estos productos. Carmen quiere seguir creciendo como vendedora dentro de la empresa Herbalife.

loans.use: To allow advance payment for the Herbalife products she sells

loans.name: Yulit

texts.es:
For the last two years, Yulit has sold artesenal products from Piura: a friend gave her the idea of starting-up this activity. It’s as a result of this that her family, in Piura, send her the products and she sells them to her acquaintances who have made specific orders.

Yulit has also sold make-up products from the Avon catalogue for the last five months.

The loans she has asked for have allowed her to buy more artesenal products. She wants to continue importing merchandise and stocking her business with novelties.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 2 años, Yulit vende artesanías piuranas a raíz que una amiga le dio la idea de dedicarse a esta actividad. Es así que su familia, en Piura, le manda los productos y ella los vende a sus conocidos que le hacen pedidos específicos. Igualmente, Yulit ofrece productos de maquillaje por catálogo de la marca Avon desde hace 5 meses.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar más artesanías. Ella quiere seguir trayendo más mercadería y surtir su negocio con novedades.

loans.use: To bring more artesenal products from Piura and sell them in Lima

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy has sold snacks inside a nightclub for the last three years. She works every weekend from nine in the evening until six in the morning. Nancy made friends with the manager of the nightclub, which was how she came to be offered a place where she could sell her snacks. Additionally, Nancy helps with the cleaning of the nightclub.

Furthermore, Nancy works every morning in whatever seasonal work presents itself.

The loans which she has received have allowed to buy her snacks. Nancy would like to have a market stall and sell clothes or snacks.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Nancy se dedica a la venta de golosinas dentro de una discoteca desde hace 3 años. Ella trabaja todos los fines de semana desde las 9 de la noche hasta las 6 de la mañana. Nancy se hizo amiga del dueño de la discoteca, por lo que éste le ofreció el lugar para que pudiera vender sus golosinas. A cambio, Nancy le ayuda en la limpieza de la discoteca.

Asimismo, por las mañanas Nancy labora en cualquier trabajo temporal que se le presente.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprar las golosinas. A Nancy le gustaría tener un puesto en el mercado y vender ropa o golosinas.

loans.use: To purchase the snacks that she sells in a nightclub.

loans.name: Lida

texts.es:
For the last six years, Lida has sold native products from the highlands in the market close to her house. Previously she used to live in the provinces, where she also used to work as a saleswoman. However, she later decided to move to Lima and to establish a business selling highland products such as broad beans, maize, corn, etc.

Lida travels fortnightly to the highlands to buy her products. The loans she has asked for have allowed her to cover the expenses of the trips she makes. She would like to be able to accumulate more capital to allow her to have a stall and her own house.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 6 años, Lida vende productos oriundos de la sierra en el mercado cerca de su casa. Antes ella vivía en provincia, donde también trabajaba vendiendo. Sin embargo, luego decidió mudarse a Lima y poner un negocio de productos de la sierra, como habas, maíz, mote, etc.

Lida viaja quincenal a la sierra a comprar sus productos. Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para cubrir el gasto de los viajes que realiza. A ella le gustaría poder tener más capital para así tener un puesto y una casa propia.

loans.use: To travel into the provices to buy the products she sells.

loans.name: Herfelinda

texts.es:
Herfelinda used to work in a factory, but it went bankrupt and as a result she was left without work. It was because of this that six years ago she decided to open a clothes stall in the market. She works from 8 in the morning until 5 in the evening in this business: later she sells socks in the streets.

However, Herfelina has a daughter who is studying dressmaking, and as a result both have established a workshop and have begun to manufacture kitchen-dryers. The loans which she has received have allowed her to buy the cloth needed to manufacture the dryers.

Herfelina would like to expand her small workshop and begin to manufacture more products. She would also like to acquire a automatic sewing machine.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Herfelinda trabajaba en una fábrica, pero ésta quebró por lo que se quedó sin trabajo. Fue así que hace 6 años decidió poner un puesto de ropa en el mercado. Ella trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde en este negocio, luego vende medias de manera ambulatoria.

Sin embargo, Herfelinda tiene una hija que está estudiando Alta Costura, por lo que ambas han montado un taller y han empezado a fabricar secadores de cocina. Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para comprar la tela que necesita en la fabricación de los secadores.

A ella le gustaría ampliar su pequeño taller y empezar a fabricar más productos. También quisiera adquirir una máquina remalladora de ropa.

loans.use: To buy the fabric needed in the manufacture of kitchen-dryers

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Olimpia is a retired teacher: for this reason she decided to set-up a business. She had the idea of hiring a stall in the market and selling clothes to children. She’s now spent six years working on her stall, where she also sells clothes.

The loans which she has received have allowed her to travel to Trujillo and buy shoes, which has resulted in a better profit margin. She would like to convert her small stall into a children’s boutique.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Olimpia es profesora jubilada, por este motivo, decidió poner un negocio. Fue así que tuvo L. idea D. alquilar un puesto en el mercado y vender zapatos para niños. Ya tiene 6 años trabajando en su puesto, donD. también ofrece juguetes.

Los préstamos que ha recibido le han servido para viajar a Trujillo y comprar los zapatos, ya que resulta más rentable. A elL. le gustaría convertir su pequeño puesto en un bazar dirigido para niños.

loans.use: To travel to the provinces and buy the shoes she sells, as this will be more profitable.

loans.name: Chérifatou

texts.fr:
Born around 1970 in Nigeria, a neighboring country to Benin, Mrs. Chérifatou A. comes from the north of Benin. She is married and the mother of five children; Karim (20) is no longer in school, Roukyath (17) is in eighth grade, Kazim (12) is in seventh grade, Soulé (10) is in third grade, and Rokiath (8) in first grade. Mrs. Chérifatou A. travels to North-Benin to purchase cocoyams which she distributes to her customers, selling what is left over by the pile at her shop. She is requesting this loan so that she can satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva voluneer

Née vers 1970 au Nigéria dans un pays voisin du BENIN, dame A. Chérifatou est originaire du Nord BENIN. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont Karim âgé de 20 ans ne fréquente plus, Roukyath âgée de 17 ans est en classe de Quatrième, Kazim âgé de 12 ans est en classe de Cinquième, Soulé âgé de 10 ans est en classe de CM1 et Rokiath âgée de 8 ans est en classe de CP. Dame A. Chérifatou voyage au Nord-Bénin pour l'approvisionnement de tubercules d'igname qu'elle vient distribuer à ses clients et expose ensuite le reste devant sa boutique pour vendre en tas. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour donner satisfaction à sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 25 sacks of cocoyams

Achat de 25 sacs de tubercules d'igname.

loans.name: Bolanlé

texts.fr:
Born around 1970 in Cotonou in Littoral County in the south of Benin, Mrs. Bolanlé A. comes from Nigeria, a country that borders Benin. Married to Jonas Odounfa, a transporter, she is the mother of four children; Ismaël (16) is in eighth grade, Constantine (13) is in sixth grade, Igor (9) is in third grade, and Josiane (6) in first grade. She retails cosmetics, soaps, and other beauty products. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business and satisfy the demands of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1970 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au Sud du BENIN, dame A. Bolanlé est originaire du NIGERIA, un pays frontalier au BENIN. Mariée à ODOUNFA Jonas, transporteur,elle est mère de 04 enfants que sont Ismaël âgé de 16 ans,est élève en classe de Quatrième, Constantine âgée de 13ans est élève en classe de Sixième, Igor âgé de 09 ans est élève en classe de CM1 et Josiane 06 ans est en classe CP2. Elle est revendeuse de produits cosmétiques, de savons et autres produits de beauté. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer et satisfaire la démande de sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 4 cases of ointments and 2 cases of Fanico-brand soap

Achat de 04 cartons de pommades et de 02 cartons de savon FANICO.

loans.name: Latifatou

texts.fr:
Born around 1974 in Cotonou in Littoral County in the south of Benin, Mrs. Latifatou A. comes from Sakété in Ouémé County. Married to Laïla Djibril, she is the mother of two children: Andillath (11) in sixth grade and Akim (8) in third grade. She has a shop where she sells a variety of products, among them cosmetics. Presently faced with financial difficulties, she is requesting her second loan so that she can cater for the needs of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1974 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au sud du Bénin, dame A. Latifatou est originaire de Sakété dans le département de l'Ouémé. Elle est mariée à DJIBRIL Laïla et est mère de deux enfants dont Andillath âgée de 11 ans est en classe de Sixième et Akim âgé de 8 ans est classe de CE1. Elle dispose d'une boutique de vente de divers produits et des produits cosmétiques. Confrontée actuellement à des difficultés financières, elle sollicite son deuxième crédit pour répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 cases of liquor, 5 cases of ointment, and 8 cases of hair-straightening products

Achat de 10 cartons de liqueur,de 5 cartons de pommade et de 8 cartons de produits de défrisage des cheveux.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alidé - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Abiba

texts.fr: Coming from the northern region of Benin, Mrs. Abiba A. was born around 1971 in Bassila in Donga County. She is the mother of two daughters who live in Bassila with their polygamous father. Mrs. Abiba A. lives in a slum in Cotonou where she sells groceries which allows her to support herself. She previously received a loan of US$ 300 and is now requesting a third loan in the amount of $ 375 to bolster her businesss.Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteerOriginaire de la région nord du BENIN, dame A. Abiba est née vers 1971 à Bassila, dans le département de la DONGA. Elle est mère de deux filles qui vivent à Bassila avec leur père polygame. Dame A. Abiba vit dans un bidonville de Cotonou où elle vend des produits vivriers qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge. Elle avait bénéficié d'un crédit de 130000F CFA et vient solliciter un troisième prêt de 150000F CFA pour renforcer son activité.

loans.use: Purchase of 3 sacks of corn, 2 sacks of rice, and 10 liters of vegetable oilAchat de 3 sacs de maïs, de 2 sacs de riz et de 10 litres d'huile végétale.

loans.name: Sidonie Tabiyi

texts.fr:
Born around 1966 in Pobè in Plateau County in the southeast of Benin, Mrs. Sidonie Tabiyi A. is a trained hairdresser. She is married and the mother of 5 children, two of whom are already independent. Along with her work as a hairdresser, Mrs. Sidonie Tabiyi A. sells cold drinks. She is requesting her third loan to deal with the financial difficulties she encounters in running her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1966 à Pobè dans le département du Plateau au Sud-Est du Bénin, dame A. Sidonie Tabiyi est coiffeuse de profession. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont deux ne sont plus à sa charge. Dame A. Sidonie Tabiyi a associé à son métier de coiffure la vente de boissons fraiches. Elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour faire face aux difficultés financières qu'elle rencontre dans l'exercice de ses activités.

loans.use:
Purchase of 15 cases of drinks and 4 dozen hair extensions

Achat de 15 casiers de boissons et de 4 douzaines de mèches.

loans.name: Judith Olga

texts.fr:
Born on February 17, 1981 in Cotonou in Littoral County, Mrs. Judith Olga D. is married to Adolph Donvide, tax collector in Cotonou. The mother of a one-year-old, Mrs. Judith Olga D. owns a hardware store whose inventory she would like to expand in order to bolster her business and fully satisfy the needs of her customers. She is requesting this first loan with Alidé so as to achieve this goal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 17 Février 1981 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral, dame D. Judith Olga est mariée à DONVIDE Adolph, Agent collecteur à la mairie de Cotonou. Mère d'un enfant âgé d'un an, dame D. Judith Olga dispose d'une boutique de quincaillerie qu'elle désire équiper davantage afin de renforcer son activité pour donner pleine satisfaction à sa clientèle. Elle sollicite son premier crédit à ALIDé pour répondre à cet objectif.

loans.use:
purchase of tools for masons, shoemakers, and carpenters

Achat d'outils de Maçonnerie, de cordonnerie et de menuiserie.

loans.name: Clémence Sourou

texts.fr:
Ms. Clémence Sourou D. was born on March 20, 1975 in Ekpè, located in the village of Sèmè-Podji, which is in the region of l'Ouémé, southeast of Benin. She is married and a mother of two - Rosaline, aged 9 and in 4th grade and Roger, aged 3. She married Romain HOUSSOU, a tire mechanic. Clémence Sourou has customers to whom she distributes corn and uses the rest of her supply to prepare corn paste that she sells in the evenings in front of her home. The costs of corn is rather expensive nowadays due to the world economic recession and rising food costs. Her finances can no longer permit her to buy three sacks of corn, which is the reason she seeks this loan.

Translated from French from Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 20/03/1975 à Ekpè dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji dans le département de l'Ouémé au sud-Est du BENIN, dame D. Clémence Sourou est mariée et mère de deux enfants que sont Rosaline âgée de 9 ans en classe de CE2 et Roger âgé de 3ans. Elle a épousé HOUSSOU Romain vulcanisateur de profession. Dame D. Clémence Sourou a des clientes à qui elle distribue des basines de maïs et utilise ensuite le reste pour la préparation de bouillie qu'elle vend les soirs devant sa maison. Le maïs coûte assez cher ces derniers temps à cause de la crise alimentaire mondiale. Ses seuls moyens financiers ne pourront plus lui permettre de s'acheter trois sacs de maïs, raison pour laquelle elle a sollicité ce crédit.

loans.use: Achat de 03 sacs de maïs et 1/2 sac de sucre en poudre.  Buy 3 sacks of corn and 1/2 sack of powdered sugar

loans.name: Raïmathou Masunmonla

texts.fr:
Ms. Raïmathou Masunmonla F. was born on December 10, 1975 in Sakété, which is in the region of Plateau, southeast of Benin. She is married and a mother of three children, where one of them is no longer under her care. She is a dressmaker by profession, but after close to two years, she became a lingerie and baby clothing retailer. She gets her supplies in Lomé, Togo and makes bulk deliveries to certain clients before displaying the rest for sale. She requests her first loan to meet difficulties that arise from low inventory.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 10 Décembre 1975 à Sakété dans le département du Plateau au Sud-Est du Bénin, dame F. Raïmathou Masunmonla est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont l'un n'est plus à sa charge. Elle est couturière de Profession, mais depuis près de deux ans, elle est devenu revendeuse de sous-vêtements et d'habits pour enfants. Elle fait ses approvisionnements à Lomé au Togo et vient faire la livraison en gros à certains de ses clients avant d'étaler le reste. Elle sollicite son premier crédit faire face aux difficultés d'approvisionnement.

loans.use: Buy 30 dozens of undergarments and 15 dozens of baby clothing

loans.name: Sikiratou

texts.fr:
Ms. Sikiratou G. was born in 1980 in Pobè , which is in the region of Plateau, south of Benin. She is married to Issifou ADAM, an auto mechanic. She is the mother of two children - Anifath, age 9 and in 4th grade, and Djemilath, age 5 and in 3rd grade. Sikiratou sells toothpaste and toothbrushes. She also wishes to be more involved in retail of hygiene and beauty products. She is here to request her third loan to prevent difficulties that arise from lack of supplies.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers 1980 à Pobè dans le département du Plateau au Sud-Est du Bénin, dame G. Sikiratou est mariée à ADAM Issifou réparateur des vélo-moteurs. Elle est mère de deux filles que sont Anifath âgée de 9 ans en classe de CE2 et Djemilath âgée de 5 ans est en clase de CI. Dame G. Sikiratou est revendeuse des pâtes dentifrices et des brosses à dents auxquelles elle désire associer des produits de beauté. Elle vient sollicitr son troisième crédit pour faire face aux difficultés d'approvisionnement.

loans.use: Buy 7 cartons of toothpaste, 3 dozen toothbrushes, and 2 dozen beauty products

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.fr:
Born in 1957 in Hèvié, which is within the village of Adjarra, which is located in the region of l'Ouémé, southeast of Benin, Ms Rosaline H. is married and a mother of two: Joël, aged 3 and Francine is 1 year old. She sells fast and ready to eat meals. She buys sacks of corn to use when preparing boiled corn paste (also known as "Akassa"). She is unable to satisfy all her clientele due to financial resources. She seeks her third loan to remedy this situation.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

 Née vers 1975 à Hèvié dans la commune d'Adjarra dans le département de l'Ouémé au Sud-Est du Bénin, dame H. Rosaline est mariée et mère de deux enfants que sont Joël âgé de trois ans et Francine âgée d'un an. Elle est vendeuse de repas prêt à manger. Elle achète des sacs de maïs pour s'en servir dans la préparation pâte bouillie de maïs communément appelée "Akassa" Les moyens financier faisant,elle n'arrive pas à satisfaire toute sa clientèle. Elle demande son troisième crédit pour remédier à cette situation.

loans.use: Buy 2 sacks of corn, one that's a meal of cassavoc root and one of fish.

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Ms. Safiatou I. is originally from Sakete, which is the region of Plateau. She was born around 1968 in Cotonou, south of Benin. She is married to Mr. Sanoussi Razack and they have three children. Their firstborn Adjara is unschooled. I. sells toothbrushes and toothpaste. She wishes to establish herself in a home-based business in a space her husband built in their house. Just as equally, she is considering to strengthen her cosmetics products business, but she does not have enough funds. Therefore, she requests this loan to meet all her expectations.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Dame I. Safiatou, originaire de SAKETE dans le département du Plateau, est née vers 1968 à Cotonou au sud du BENIN. Mariée à Monsieur SANOUSSI Razack, elle a à charge trois enfants dont l'ainée Adjara n'est pas scolarisée. I. vend des brosses à dents et des pâtes dentifrices. Elle désire s'installer dans une baraque que son mari lui a construite en leur domicile. Egalement, elle envisage renforcer son activité par la vente de produits cosmétiques mais elle n'a pas suffisament de liquidité. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour combler toutes ses attentes.

loans.use: Buy 12 boxes of cosmetic products

loans.name: Anita

texts.fr:
Born on October 26, 1972 in Cotonou, south of Benin, Ms. Anita I. is a hairdresser. Anita is married to a teacher and they have 6 children. Having already benefited from four loans (and repaid) from our institution, she requests a fifth loan to invest not only in headgear and braids, but also in cooking oil and various articles of clothing.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 26 Octobre 1972 à Cotonou au sud du BENIN et coiffeuse de profession, dame I. Anita s'est mariée à un instituteur avec qui elle a eu 6 enfants. Ayant déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits auprès de notre l'institution qu'elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite un cinquième crédit pour investir non seulement dans la coiffure et la tresse, mais aussi dans la commercialisation d'huile alimentaire et d'articles vestimentaires.

loans.use: To buy 15 cans of 10 L cooking oil, 50 sets of wavy hair, 10 sets of natural hair, 5 cartons of shampoo, 2 bales of skirts and blouses

loans.name: Laure Adelaïde Afiav

texts.fr:
Born December 16th, 1959 in Azove in the Benin Department of Mono, Mrs.Laure Adelaide Afiavi K. is the mother of two children. She has been in the charcoal and cloth sales business for almost seven years. Mrs.K. is seeking a loan to buy cloth and for restocking and storage of bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Née le 16 Décembre 1959 à AZOVE dans le département du MONO au BENIN, dame K. Laure Adelaïde Afiavi est mère de deux enfants. Commercialisant depuis bientôt sept ans, du charbon et du tissu,elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des tissus et pour l'approvisionnement et le stockage des sacs de charbon.

loans.use: Purchase 50 bags of charcoal and 20 sheets of cloth.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alidé - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr:
Mrs. Emilienne Kpeitcha lives in Tchonvi in the Oueme Department in Benin, where she was born around 1979. Married, with 6 children, she sells food products in the local market with her children. She is seeking a loan to reinforce her capital so that she can purchase fresh fish, condiments, and various groceries.

Translated from French by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Dame K. Emilienne vit à Tchonvi, dans le département de l'OUEME au BENIN où elle est née vers 1979. Mariée et mère de 6 enfants, elle vend des produits vivriers dans le marché de ladite localité avec un de ses enfants. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son capital, pour l'achat de poissons frais, des condiments et divers produits vivriers.

loans.use: Purchase three bags of corn, three boxes of fresh fish, and 2 cans of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Born around 1974 in the Department of Couffo in Benin, Mrs.Jeanne K. is married to Mr.Severin Anagonou - a mechanic by training. Mrs.K. is the mother of two children, Juliette and Carole, ages 7 and 5 respectively. A hair dresses by training, she owns two beauty salons with six apprentices under her. Apart from this, she also retails cosmetic and personal care products to her clients. She is seeking a loan in order to stock up on supplies.

Translated from French by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Née vers 1974 dans le département du COUFFO au BENIN, dame K. Jeanne est mariée à Monsieur ANAGONOU Sévérin,mécanicien de profession. Elle est mère de 2 enfants, Juliette et Carole respectivement âgées de 7 et 5 ans. Coiffeuse de profession, elle a deux salons de beauté avec six apprentis sous sa responsabilité. En dehors de cette profession, elle revend à ses clients, des produits cosmétiques et de soins corporels. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour s'approvisionner.

loans.use: Purchase 4 boxes of cosmetic products and 5 dozen hair extensions

loans.name: Sefiath

texts.fr:
Born in 1977 in the town of Cotonou located in the Department of Littoral in the South of Benin, Mrs.Sefiath L. takes her roots from the Department of the Plateau in the South-East of Benin. She is married and is the mother of two children: Ikbal, who is ten years old and in the 4th grade, and Abdel, who is five years old and is in preschool. Mrs. Sefiath L. runs a hardware and bike accessories shop. She is applying for a second loan to increase her capital and to be better-positioned in the very competitive market of hardware goods.

Translated from French by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Née vers 1977 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin, dame L. Sefiath est originaire du département du Plateau au Sud-Est du Bénin. Elle est Mariée et mère de deux enfants que sont Ikbal âgé de dix ans et en classe de CE2 et Abdel âgé de cinq ans et en classe de CI. Dame L. Sefiath dispose d'une boutique de quincaillerie et d'accessoires de vélo. Elle sollicite son deuxième crédit pour renforcer son capital et pour mieux se positionner sur le marché combien concurrentiel de la quincaillerie.

loans.use: Purchase several  cans of paint and plumbing materials.

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr:
A native of Benin, Mrs.Yvette T. was born around 1965 in the town of Drkanme in the Department of Oueme. She is married to Jerome Ahannougbe, and has three children: Diane, 17 years old, is an apprentise dressmaker, José, age 16, is in 10th grade, and Nicole, age 13, is in 9th grade. Mrs.Yvette locally retails red vegetable oil made from the oil palm, corn, bread, and various condiments. In order to strengthen her business, she is asking for a loan with which to buy more products.

Translated from French by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

De nationalité béninoise, dame T. Yvette est née vers 1965 à Dékanmè dans le département de l'OUEME. Elle est mariée à Monsieur AHANNOUGBE Jerôme et mère de 3 enfants: Diane âgée de 17 ans est apprentis couturière, José âgé de 16 ans et en classe de seconde (2nde) et Nicole 13 ans en classe de Troisième (3ème). Elle revend en son domicile de l'huile végétale rouge produite à partir du palmier à huile, du maïs, du pain et divers condiments. Pour renforcer son activité, elle sollicite ce crédit afin de s'approvisionner.

loans.use: Purchase of 5 cans of red vegetable oil, 2 bags of corn, 10 trays of eggs, and 5 boxes of biscuits.

loans.name: Adèle Agossi

texts.fr:
Mrs. Adele Agossi A., a native of Benin, was born around 1979 in the town of Agbalilame, in the department of Oueme. Married to Christian Kpatinvoh, welder by training, she is mother of two children, Nicole and Charles, who are still in her care. She is a traveling sales person who retails cloth, women's bags, and shoes. In order to secure client loyalty, she has received orders but she lacks the funds to purchase them. To meet the needs of her client base she is asking for her third loan.

Translated from French by Anya Ezhevskaya, Kiva volunteer.

Dame A. Adèle Agossi de nationalité béninoise est née vers 1979 à AGBALILAME dans le département de l'OUEME. Mariée à KPATINVOH Christian, soudeur de profession, elle est mère de deux (02) enfants: Nicole et Charles tous deux encore à sa charge. Elle est ambulante et revend des tissus, des sacs pour femme et des chaussures. En vue de fideliser une clientèle bien ciblée dont elle a reçu des commandes et pour lesquelles les moyens financiers font défaut, elle demande son troisième crédit pour répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 7 pairs of shoes, 8 sheets of cloth, and 5 bags.

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr:
D. Marcelline was born on the 22 of March, 1976 in Adjohoun, located in the Department of Oueme in Benin. She is married to André Houinssou and has 3 children that are still dependent on her. She was selling petroleum, but a year ago begun selling corn and millet instead. She is asking for the loan in order to be able to travel to Glazoué, a city in the center of Benin, where she will be able to purchase goods.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Née le 22 Mars 1976 à ADJOHOUN dans le département de l'OUEME au BENIN, dame D. Marcelline est mariée à Monsieur HOUINSSOU André et mère de 3 enfants encore à sa charge. Elle commercialisait le pétrole qu'elle a abandonné depuis bientôt 1 an au profit de la vente du maïs et du mil. Dans l'intention d'étendre son activité, elle sollicite ce concours financier pour un voyage sur Glazoué, une ville du centre du BENIN afin de s'approvisionner.

loans.use: Purchase 5 bags of corn and 2 bags of millet

loans.name: Alice Abebi

texts.fr:
Alice Abebi O. was born in 1962 in the city of Pobe in the Plateau department. She is married to Jean-Marie Zinsoule and has 4 children 3 of which are still dependent on her. At her house, located in Kpakpakanmè, she resells various items such as lanterns, soap and sugar. She also delivers and sells shoes to local retailers. She also sells shoes retail herself. Considering how many retailers are comming to her to purchase shoes for sale, she is asking for a third loan to be able to satisfy the demand.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Née vers les années 1962 à POBE dans le département du Plateau, dame O. Alice Abebi est mariée à Monsieur ZINSOULE Jean-Marie et mère de 4 enfants dont 3 sont encore à sa charge. A son domicile, situé à Kpakpakanmè, elle revend divers articles tels que les lanternes, du savon, du sucre. Aussi, vend-t-elle des chaussures qu'elle livre à des détaillants. Elle aussi vend en délails les chaussures. Compte tenu de l'augmentation du nombre de détaillants qui viennent s'approvisionner auprès d'elle, elle sollicite son troisième crédit afin de satisfaire leur sattentes.

loans.use: Purchase 60 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Folakè

texts.fr:
O. Folakè was born in 1980 in the city of Pobe. She is married to a professional photographer Razack Elegbele. She is in business of reselling undergarments, toothbrushes and toothpaste. She is currently experiencing some difficulty restocking merchandise, especially since she has to decided that from now on she will purchase her goods in Togo, a neighboring country in order to decrease the costs.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Née vers 1980 à POBE dans le département du PLATEAU et d'ethnie Yoruba, dame O. Folakè est mariée à Monsieur ELEGBELE Razack, photographe de formation. Elle est revendeuse de sous-vêtements, de brosses à dents et de pâtes dentifrices. Elle éprouve actuellement quelques difficultés pour s'approvisionner surtout qu'elle a décidé de s'approvisionner désormais au TOGO,un pays voisin au nôtre, pour amoindrir les coûts d'achat de ses marchandises.

loans.use: Achat de 15 douzaines de sous-vêtements et de 5 cartons de pâtes dentifrices.

loans.name: Brice Finagnon

texts.fr:
Brice D. was born on the 5th of April, 1976 in the city of Cotonou. He is married and has a 3 year old child. He is a fashion designer by profession. Several years ago he has started a business loaning out sound equipment (loud speakers, amps, mixers, microphones, CDs and other) for numerous events such as for example graduations, baptisms and even marriages. His equipment is needed for these happy events. Brice has come for a loan to be able to purchase a new amp.

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Née le 5 Avril 1976 à Cotonou, Monsieur D. Brice est marié et père d'un enfant âgé de 3 ans. Couturier de profession, il s'est lancé depuis quelques années dans la location des appareils de sonorisation (hauts parleurs , amplificateurs, mixeurs, microphone, CD et autres), pour de nombreuses manifestations telles les remises de diplômes, les baptêmes et même les mariages. Ses appareils sont sollicités pour la sonorisation de ces différentes manifestations joyeuses. Il a fait recours à notre service financier pour acquérir un nouvel amplificateur.

loans.use: Purchase a new amp

loans.name: Prisca Emilola

texts.fr:
Ms Prisca Emilola A. was born on the 26th of October in 1984. She was born in the city of Cotonou in the south of Benin. She is not married and does not have any children. She manages a phone booth and also sells charcoal. In order to be able to stock up on charcoal she has come to us for a loan. She is asking for a second loan of $250.00 (100000.00 XOF).

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Célibataire sans enfant, Mademoiselle A. Prisca Emilola est née le 26 Octobre 1984 à Cotonou au sud du BENIN. Elle gère une cabine téléphonique et vend parallèlement des sacs de charbon. Pour constituer un stock assez important, elle sollicite notre apport financier à hauteur de 100000F CFA à travers le renouvellement de son deuxième crédit.

loans.use: Purchase 20 bags of chargoal

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr:
Sophie V. was born around 1977 in the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Moïse Zabada, who works as a driver of vehicles of category B. She has 3 children, Juliette, Obidole and Arnaud, all three of which are going to school and are dependent on the parents.For about 10 years now Sophie has been selling women's clothing and various other goods in Kowebo, one of the most popular parts of Cotonou. This is the third loan for Sophie. She has successfully paid off her previous loans. Currently she needs a loan to purchase more goods in order to satisfy the demand of her clients as well as increase the variety of goods she has for sale. She would like to start selling baskets, jewlery and other items. 

Translated from French by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Née vers les années 1977 à COTONOU dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame V. Sophie est mariée à ZABADA Moïse conducteur de véhicule catégorie B dans un projet et mère de 3 enfants dont Juliette, Obidole et Arnaud tous scolarisés et à la charge de leurs géniteurs. Installée  à KOWEGBO l’un des quartiers les plus populaires de la ville de COTONOU depuis une dizaine d’années où elle exerce son activité de vente de vêtements de femmes   et  des produits divers. Dame V. Sophie est à son troisième crédit et s’est toujours montrée crédible. Actuellement elle éprouve des difficultés dans l’approvisionnement de ses produits raison pour laquelle elle sollicite ce prêt afin de satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle et aussi d’élargir son champ d’activité à d’autres produits tels que les pagnes, les bijoux et autres.

loans.use: Purchase 10 boxes of biscuits and 72 dresses.

loans.name: Thérèse

texts.fr:
Born February 23, 1953 in the historic part of Benin, Mrs. Thérèse A. is a married mother of three children: Martin, 22, who is a student; Ariane, 18, who is in the equivalent of eighth grade; and Cédric, 11, who is in fourth grade. Since she was widowed last August, she has been responsible for taking care of her children and paying the rent. She has lived in the Hindé neighborhood, near the Dantokpa market, for eight years, but she began her business 32 years ago. After selling yams for 20 years in her village, Mrs. Thérèse A. developed her business by beginning to sell onions, which she has done for the last 12 years. After her first loan of 75,000 CFA francs in 2005, her business boomed to the point that, today, she is having trouble satisfying all of her customers, as she does not have the means to replenish her supplies for any long period of time. To do so, she is requesting this loan so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 23 février 1953 à Abomey dans la cité historique du BENIN, dame A. Thérèse est mariée et mère de trois enfants : Martin 22ans, étudiant ; Ariane 18ans, en classe de 4ème et Cédric, 11ans en classe de CM1. Veuve depuis le mois d’août dernier, c’est à elle que revient désormais la charge des enfants et le payement des frais de loyer. Installée au quartier Hindé à proximité du marché Dantokpa depuis huit ans, elle a pris goût au commerce il y a 32ans. Après avoir vendu pendant 20ans de l’igname dans sa ville natale, dame A. Thérèse a accru son activité par la vente d’oignons depuis 12ans. Après son premier crédit de 75.000 F CFA en 2005 son activité a connu une explosion à tel point qu’aujourd’hui, elle éprouve quelques difficultés à satisfaire la totalité de sa clientèle car elle n’a pas les moyens pour faire un approvisionnement sur de longue durée. Pour remédier à cet état de chose elle sollicite ce prêt afin de satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 18 bags of yams

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr:
Born around 1976 in IFANGNI in the Plateau district in the south of Benin, Ms. Célestine M. is married and the mother of three children:  Doniale, age 8, and Hornela, age 5, who are both in elementary school, and Romeo, 8 months old.  Her husband Anastase Jean AVOCE, is a tile mason.  Célestine M. is a distributor of goods, such as:  rice, pagnes (colorful print cloth), different types of oil, soap, and various other goods.  She gets her supplies notably from the biggest marketplace of Benin, DANTOKPA.  Following some financial difficulties tending to handicap her from improving her business, she came to apply for an initial loan of 40,000 francs CFA in March 2007.  Due to her very fruitful initial efforts, and to fend off her inventory shortages, she asked for a second loan of 70,000 francs in September of the same year.  Currently, she wants to increase her stock but is experiencing difficulties achieving her goal.  This is why she is requesting this loan, not only to meet customer demands, but also to improve living conditions for her family. 

 Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer


Née vers les années 1976 à IFANGNI dans le département du Plateau au sud du Bénin, dame M. Célestine est mariée et mère de trois enfants; Doniale 8ans, Hornela 5ans, tous au CI et Roméo 8 mois. Son mari AVOCE Anastase Jean Paul est carreleur. M. Célestine est distributrice des produits comme :  le riz,  les pagnes, différentes sortes d’huiles,  des savons et autres produits divers. Elle s’approvisionne notamment dans le plus grand marché du BENIN, DANTOKPA. Suite à des difficultés financières tendant à l’handicaper dans l’évolution de ses activités, elle vint contracter en mars 2007 un premier crédit de 40.000fcfa. Forte de sa première expérience très fructueuse et pour parer à la rupture de stock de ses marchandises, elle demande en septembre de la même année, son deuxième crédit d’un montant de 70.000fcfa. 
Actuellement, elle veut augmenter sa réserve mais éprouve des difficultés à atteindre son but. Pour cela elle sollicite ce crédit non seulement pour satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle mais aussi pour améliorer ses conditions de vie et de famille.

loans.use: To buy 5 boxes of OMO detergent, 2 boxes of FANICO soap, 2 sacks of rice, and a 25-liter drum of oil

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Alidé - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ernestine Assiba

texts.fr:
Born around 1959 in OUIDAH, in the Atlantique district in the south of Benin, Ms. Ernestine Assiba W. is a widow and the mother of four children, who are all in school. Previously, she used to sell food in the bus station parking lot in Cotonou Porto-Novo Cotonou, the nerve center for travelers. As a result, the crowds were so big that it had been difficult to meet the ever-demanding customer expectations, due to financial means. This is why, in order to improve, she came to obtain her first loan of 50,000 francs CFA in 2006. For her second loan, she obtained 100,000 francs. Currently, she lives in her father-in-law's house near the DANTOKPA marketplace, opposite the exposed gutter, where she switched to selling beverages (products of the Béninoise de Brasserie Company), imported beverages, and charcoal. She started this business about four years ago. The demand is growing so much that, at midday, she no longer has anything for the numerous customers lining up in front of her shop. To be able to get supplies in sufficient quantities and to meet the demand without fail, she is requesting a fourth loan of 250,000 francs. She is aiming at devoting 2/3 of these fund to buying beverages and the rest for buying charcoal.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née vers les années 1959 à OUIDAH dans le département de l'Atlantique au sud du Bénin, dame W. Ernestine Assiba est veuve et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Auparavant, elle vendait de la nourriture sur le parc auto gare Cotonou Porto-Novo Cotonou, point névralgique des voyageurs. L’affluence était donc si importante qu’il lui était devenu difficile de satisfaire la demande de plus en plus exigeante des clients, faute de moyens financiers. C’est ainsi que pour se renforcer elle vint prendre son premier crédit de 50.000fcfa en 2006. Pour son deuxième crédit, elle prit 100.000fcfa. Actuellement elle vit dans la maison de son beau père proche du marché DANTOKPA en face du caniveau à ciel ouvert où elle s’est reconvertie dans la vente de boissons (produits de la Société Béninoise de Brasserie), des boissons importées et du charbon de bois. Elle a débuté cette activité il y a environ 4ans. La demande est si croissante que déjà à la mi-journée elle n’a plus de quoi satisfaire les nombreux clients qui font la queue devant sa boutique. Pour pouvoir s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante et satisfaire sans faille les demandes, elle sollicite un quatrième prêt de 250.000fcfa. Ainsi, elle vise à consacrer 2/3 de ces fonds à l’achat des boissons et le reste à l’achat de charbon de bois.

loans.use: To buy 20 boxes of beer in cans, 20 boxes of soft drinks in cans, and 25 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Rosine

texts.fr:
Rosine L. was born on January 1, 1980 in Ghana. Married to Pierre DOSSOUGOUIN, a welder by profession, she is the mother of two children, who are both in school, in the 6th grade and in kindergarten, respectively. Trained as a master hairdresser, Ms. Rosine L. used to practice her trade in a shop in Xwlacodji behind the public primary school in that area, and she used to market cosmetics there, too. But with the rarity of customers, she dedicated herself much more to selling these cosmetic products and moved towards the downtown, in the Sikècodji district, while still marketing cosmetics. To do so, she came to apply for an initial loan of 30,000 francs CFA enabling her to stock enough supplies. It was a very profitable experience because her capital accrued and the demand grew, such that she lacked, due to means, the merchandise to meet the demand. The profit that she earns from this business enables her to support her family. One loan after another, since the demand is ever-growing, she is presently requesting her fifth loan in the amount of 180,000 francs CFA in order to achieve these objectives.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

L. Rosine est née le 1er janvier 1980 au GHANA. Mariée à DOSSOUGOUIN Pierre, soudeur de profession, elle est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés respectivement en classe de 6ème et à la maternelle. Maîtresse coiffeuse de formation, dame L. Rosine exerçait dans son atelier à Xwlacodji derrière l’école primaire publique de ladite zone et y commercialisait aussi des produits cosmétiques. Mais avec la rareté de la clientèle, elle se consacrait beaucoup plus à la vente de ces produits et déménagea vers le centre ville au quartier Sikècodji menant toujours la vente des produits cosmétiques. Pour ce faire, elle vint contracter un premier prêt de 30.000fcfa qui lui permis de s’approvisionner suffisamment. L’expérience fut très profitable car son capital s’est accru et la demande grandissante à tel point qu’elle manquait, faute de moyens, de produits pour leur satisfaction. Les bénéfices qu’elle tire de cette activité, lui permettent d’apporter un appui à la famille. De prêt en prêt, puisque la demande ne cesse d’accroître, elle sollicite actuellement pour son 5ème prêt un montant de 180.000fcfa afin d’atteindre ces objectifs.

loans.use: To buy 10 dozen hair extensions and 3 boxes of beauty products

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr:
Born around 1960 in DJOUGOU, in the north of Benin, Ms. Henriette A. Z. is married to Rigobert AHOMONTIN, a retiree who no longer has a stable income. Residing in the Agontinkon district, she is going to buy shoes in Lomé in Togo that she will then sell at the grand marketplace of DANTOKPA. In order to deal with the growing demand she was no longer managing to meet due to insufficient capital, she came to obtain an initial loan of 75,000 francs CFA in 2005. This was, by the way, a nice experience because she saw her capital increase, and she easily coped with family expenses. For her second loan, and given the explosion of commercial activity, she obtained 130,000 francs.

Currently, Ms. Henriette A. Z. is experiencing some difficulties meeting the orders of her growing and demanding customer base. And so, she is requesting her fourth loan, in the amount of 200,000 francs CFA, to satisfy the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née vers les années 1960 à DJOUGOU au nord du Bénin, dame A. Z. Henriette est mariée à AHOMONTIN Rigobert , un retraité qui n’a plus un revenu stable. Résidant au quartier Agontinkon, elle va acheter des chaussures à Lomé au Togo qu’elle vient revendre au grand marché de DANTOKPA. Afin de parer à la demande croissante qu’elle n’arrivait plus à satisfaire pour raison d’insuffisance de capital, elle vint faire un premier prêt de 75.000fcfa en 2005. Ce fut d’ailleurs une belle expérience car elle vit son capital augmenté et faisait face aux charges de la famille sans difficulté. Pour son 2ème prêt et vu l’explosion de son activité commerciale, elle a obtenu 130.000fcfa.

Actuellement, dame A. Z. Henriette éprouve quelques difficultés à répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante et exigeante. Pour cela, elle sollicite pour son 4ème prêt un montant de 200.000fcfa pour satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy five dozen shoes, three dozen women's purses

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr:
Anna A. was born around 1964 in COTONOU in the economic capital of BENIN. She is the mother of six children including the eldest, age 26, a student. Three other children are in school, in grades 10, 9, and 6, respectively. She resides in the ENAGNON PLAGE district in AKPAKPADODOME (Cotonou) with her husband, Thomas ADODO, a motorbike taxi driver in the city of COTONOU. In the beginning, Ms. Anna A. used to sell staple foods and had operating funds of about 40,000 francs CFA. To buy her merchandise, she used to go to AZOVE in the Mono but wasn't able to create a large enough inventory due to her limited means. She then came to obtain an initial loan of 50,000 francs CFA to grow her capital. From there, she added to her business the sale of condiments, since after the initial loan, her operating capital increased. With the experience she acquired with regards to commerce, and because of growing demands from customers, she is presently requesting a third loan of 100,000 francs. With these funds, she is thinking of again diversifying her business by buying, in Lomé in Togo, children's clothing for distribution, which is also going to enable her to find other types of customers.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

A. Anna est née vers les années 1964 à COTONOU dans la capitale économique du BENIN et mère de six enfants dont le plus âgé, 26ans, est étudiant. Trois autres sont scolarisés respectivement en classe de 2nde, 3ème et 6ème. Elle réside au quartier ENAGNON PLAGE à AKPAKPADODOME (Cotonou) avec son mari, ADODO Thomas, conducteur de taxi moto dans la ville de COTONOU. A ses débuts, dame A. Anna vendait des vivres et avait un fonds de roulement estimé à 40.000fcfa. Pour l’achat de sa marchandise, elle se rendait à AZOVE dans le Mono, mais n’arrivait pas à faire un approvisionnement suffisant vu ses moyens limités. Elle vint alors contracter un premier crédit de 50.000fcfa pour accroître son capital. De là, elle a ajouté à son activité la vente des condiments puisque après le premier prêt, son fonds de roulement a augmenté. Avec l’expérience qu’elle a acquise en matière de commerce et en raison des demandes croissantes de la part des clients, elle sollicite actuellement un 3ème crédit de 100.000fcfa. Avec ces fonds, elle pense varier à nouveau ses activités avec l’achat à Lomé au Togo des vêtements pour enfants pour la distribution ce qui va aussi lui permettre de rechercher d’autres types de clients.

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of charcoal and some condiments

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.fr:
Born on June 23, 1971 in COTONOU, Ms. Jocelyne H. is married to Honoré KOUTON, a caretaker at the Ministry of Justice, Legislation, and Human Rights. The couple have four children, all in school, including the eldest in the 6th grade, and the other three are in elementary school. She has been residing in the Habitat district of Cotonou for about nine years. A seller of various goods for a dozen years, Ms. Jocelyne H. started in the catering business a year ago. In order to bolster her business, she requested an initial loan of 30,000 francs CFA in 2006. She improved a great deal in selling various goods, and the catering is coming along just as nicely for her. At present, she is requesting a fifth loan, in the amount of 100,000 francs, to meet the expectations of her customers.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née le 23 juin 1971 à COTONOU, dame H. Jocelyne est mariée à KOUTON Honoré, agent d’entretien au Ministère de la Justice, de la Législation et des Droits de l’Homme. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont l’aîné en classe de 6ème et les trois autres au cours primaire. EIle réside au quartier Habitat de Cotonou il y a environ neuf ans. Vendeuse de divers depuis une dizaine d’années, dame H. Jocelyne s’est lancée dans la restauration il y a un an. Afin de renforcer son activité, elle a sollicité en 2006 un premier prêt de 30.000fcfa. Elle a beaucoup évolué dans la vente de divers et la restauration marche aussi bien pour elle. A présent, elle sollicite pour son 5ème prêt un montant de 100.000fcfa afin de répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of corn, one sack of rice, and various goods

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr:
Ms. Antoinette H. is married to François MITCHODJEHOUN, a city taxi driver who became mentally ill three or more years ago. She is the mother of five children, three of whom are in her care and attending school in grades 7, 5, and 2, respectively. Ms. Antoinette H. was born on October 25, 1976 in COTONOU and resides in the same city, in the GBEDJEWIN district. Her main business was selling porridge for four years. Last September, she requested a loan of 20,000 (francs) to increase her business by selling cakes. Her daily receipts come to at least 3,500 francs CFA. Thanks to her improvements, she is presently requesting a fifth loan of 100,000 francs CFA to make bulk purchases and to improve her family's situation.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Dame H. Antoinette est mariée à MITCHODJEHOUN François qui fût conducteur de taxi urbain mais devenu malade mental depuis plus de 3 ans. Elle est mère de 5 enfants dont 3 sont à sa charge et tous scolarisés respectivement en classe de 5ème, CM2 et CEI. Dame H. Antoinette est née le 25 octobre 1976 à COTONOU et réside dans la même ville au quartier GBEDJEWIN. Elle avait pour activité principale la vente de bouillie depuis 4 ans. Elle a sollicité au mois de septembre dernier un prêt de 20000 pour augmenter son activité par la vente de gâteaux. Elle fait une recette journalière de 3500fcfa au moins. Grâce à son évolution, elle sollicite à présent un 5ème crédit de 100000 FCFA pour effectuer des achats en gros et pour améliorer la situation de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of corn, one sack of sugar, one sack of flour, and 10 kg of peanuts

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr:
Born on May 1, 1954 in Cotonou, Benin’s economic capital, Mrs. Elisabeth Z. is the mother of four children, two of whom are deceased. Her two surviving children are aged 30 and 27. She has been living in the Yagbe neighborhood for seven years, where she runs a business selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) and other products. This has enabled her to attract a lot of customers to the extent that she is no longer able to satisfy them because of lack of funds. For this reason she took out a first loan in 2006 of CFA 40,000 in order to strengthen her business. The experience was beneficial as she was able to meet all the demand. Mrs. Elisabeth now plans to start a restaurant business. However, the capital to which she has access is vastly insufficient and for this reason she is requesting her fifth loan in order to achieve her goals.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 1er mai 1954 à COTONOU dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame Z. Elisabeth est mère de quatre enfants dont deux décédés. Ses deux enfants vivants sont respectivement âgés de 30ans et de 27ans. Installée au quartier YAGBE depuis sept ans où elle exerce son activité de vente de pagne et des produits divers. Ceci lui a permis de s’attirer beaucoup de clients à telle enseigne qu’elle n’arrivait plus à les satisfaire tous faute de moyens. C’est ainsi qu’elle vint contracter en 2006 un premier prêt de 40.000fcfa afin de renforcer son commerce. L’expérience lui fut profitable car elle pouvait faire face à toutes les demandes. Actuellement, dame Elisabeth projette de se lancer dans la restauration. Mais le capital dont elle dispose est très insuffisant et pour ce faire elle sollicite son 5ème prêt afin d’atteindre ses objectifs.

loans.use: To buy 20 pieces of printed African cloth like the brand “Hitarget”

loans.name: Léontine

texts.fr:
Born in Porto Novo, Benin’s political capital, Léontine Toï is 40 years old and the mother of five children, four of whom are in her care. Véronique and Barnabé, ages 17 and 15 respectively, are both in 9th grade. She married a soldier who has since retired and thus without regular income. Living in Yenawa, one of Cotonou’s shantytowns, she prepares and sells corn paste. She makes CFA 10,000 a day and this enables her to provide for her family’s needs. She has flourished in this business and today is on her fourth loan. She is now requesting a fifth loan in order to strengthen her business and also to increase her capital in order to prepare for the potential risk of lacking financial means to buy supplies of corn.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Porto-Novo dans la capitale politique du BENIN, TOÏ Léontine est âgée de 40ans et mère de cinq enfants dont quatre à sa charge : Véronique et Barnabé, respectivement âgés de 17ans et 15 ans sont tous en classe de 4ème. Elle a épousé un militaire qui est aujourd'hui à la retraite et donc sans revenu stable. Résidant, à YENAWA , un bidonville de la ville de COTONOU, elle prépare et vend de la pâte de maïs bouillie. Elle réalise par jour une recette de 10.000fcfa et cela lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Elle a beaucoup évolué dans cette activité et est aujourd’hui à son quatrième crédit. Actuellement, elle sollicite son cinquième crédit afin de renforcer son activité et aussi d’augmenter son capital pour parer aux risques éventuels de manque de moyens financiers pour s’approvisionner en sacs de maïs.

loans.use: To buy 5 bags of corn

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr:
Born around 1962 in Porto Novo, Benin’s political capital, Mrs. Georgette H. B. is married and the mother of five children, three of whom are in her care and at school.
