She has been living for more than 12 years in Sodjatime, a suburb of Cotonou, where she runs a business selling fresh eggs. The main characteristic of her business is wholesale distribution, a mixture of wholesale and retail, and sometimes just retail. Her minimum daily income is CFA 20,000. She is on her third loan, for which she is requesting CFA 100,000 in order to meet demand.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1962 à PORTO NOVO dans la capitale politique du BENIN, dame H. B. Georgette est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 3 sont à sa charge et tous scolarisés. Elle réside depuis une dizaine d’années à SODJATIME l’une des banlieues de COTONOU où elle exerce son activité de vente d'œufs frais. La particularité de son activité est la distribution en gros, semi gros et parfois en détails. Elle réalise un chiffre d’affaire minimum journalier de 20 000 francs cfa. Elle est à son troisième crédit pour lequel elle sollicite 100 000F CFA pour faire face à ses demandes.

loans.use: To buy 50 trays of fresh eggs

loans.name: Angèle

texts.fr:
Angèle A. was born on May 4, 1974 in the department of Mono. Married to Gérard Edah, a driver with the National Water Company of Benin, she is the mother of four children, all of whom are at school. For more than 12 years she has been selling mattresses and pillows, which she makes herself, outside the Post Office. She has been living in Yagbe, a busy neighborhood of Cotonou, for eight years and commutes between Parakou and Kpanhouignan to buy supplies of raw material to make these mattresses. For her first loan in 2006 she obtained the sum of CFA 30,000 and so far she has proved to be reliable. Given the growing number of requests for mattresses, she wants to increase production. To do so, she wants to buy 20 bags of cotton fiber and have a reserve of CFA 20,000. However, Mrs. A. lacks the financial means to achieve her goals and is asking for her fourth loan in an amount of CFA 120,000.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

A. Angèle est née le 04 mai 1974 à ADJAHA dans le département de Mono. Mariée à EDAH Gérard, chauffeur à la Société Nationale des Eaux du Bénin, elle est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Depuis une douzaine d’années, elle vend aux abords de la clôture des Postes et Télécommunications des matelas et des oreillers qu’elle fabrique elle-même. Elle réside depuis huit ans à YAGBE, un quartier populaire de Cotonou et fait la navette entre PARAKOU et KPANHOUIGNAN pour s’approvisionner en matière première pour la fabrication de ces matelas. Elle avait obtenu pour son premier crédit en 2006 un montant de 30.000fcfa et s’est jusqu’ici montrée crédible. Vu le nombre croissant de demandes en matelas, elle veut accroître sa production. Pour ce faire, elle veut acheter vingt sacs de coton fibre et de la couverture pour 20.000fcfa. Mais dame A. Angèle manque de moyens financiers pour atteindre son objectif et sollicite pour son 4ème crédit d'un montant de 120 000fcfa.

loans.use: To buy 100 50-kg bags of cotton and have a reserve of CFA 20,000

loans.name: Léontine

texts.fr:
Born around 1960 in Cotonou, Mrs. Léontine K. is the mother of four children, two of whom are at school in grades four and six. She lives in Xwlacodji, a busy neighborhood of Cotonou. Her husband, a rubber worker by profession, is often not up to meeting the family expenses. He therefore has to ask his wife on a regular basis to help make up the shortfall. His wife, who runs a peanut oil business, draws on all the family’s resources for the business and is in great need of our help to sustain her activity. This is also why she has been part of our institution for the last 10 years. For the renewal of her 12th loan, she is requesting the sum of CFA 100,000 to increase her level of activity.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née vers les années 1960 à COTONOU ,dame K. Léontine est mère de 4 enfants dont 2 sont scolarisés et respectivement en classe de CMI et de 6è. Elle réside à Xwlacodji, un quartier populaire de Cotonou . Son mari, vulcanisateur de profession n’est pas souvent à la hauteur des charges familiales. Il est donc obligeé de solliciter régulièrement l’aide de sa femme pour le complément. Cette dernière exerçant le commerce d’huile d'arachide puise toute la ressource familiale dans cette activité et a fortement besoin de notre soutien pour péréniser son activité. C’est ce qui justifie d’ailleurs sa présence dans notre institution depuis 10 ans. Pour le renouvelement de son douzième crédit, elle sollicite un montant de 100 000 pour augmenter le niveau de son activité.

loans.use: To buy two casks of peanut oil

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr:
Born on March 15,1962 in Cotonou and the mother of 3 children, the eldest of whom is aged 26 and in the third year of university, the second aged 21 and in the first year of university and the youngest aged 15 and in high school, Mrs. Louise E. lives in Godomey Salamè and runs a business in Cotonou. She sells menswear and womenswear. She is married to Barthélemy K. Dossou, an accountant by profession, who works at the oil factory Fludor. Mrs. E. has been running her business for 20 years and gets her supplies from Lomé (Togo). Ever-increasing demand has meant that she has had to turn to our institution over the past year in order to satisfy her very keen clientele. For her second loan, she is requesting CFA 350,000.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 15 mars 1962 à Cotonou et mère de 03 enfants dont le premier âgé de 26 ans et en 3è année d’Université, le second âgé de 21 ans et en classe de 1ère année d’Université et le dernier âgé de 15 ans est en 5è du cours secondaire. Dame E. Louise réside à Godomey Salamè et exerçe son commerce à COTONOU. Elle vend des vêtements pour homme et pour dame. Elle est mariée à DOSSOU K. Barthélemy comptable de profession et exerçant à la société d’huilerie FLUDOR .Dame E. Louise exerce cette activité depuis 20 ans et s’approvisionne à Lomé ( TOGO ). La demande de plus en plus forte l’a obligé à faire recours à notre institution depuis l’année passée pour satisfaire sa clientèle très active. Pour son second crédit, elle sollicite un crédit de 350 000 francs CFA.

loans.use: To buy 60 dozen t-shirts and men’s undergarments, 38 dozen t-shirts and women’s undergarments, and 18 packs of caps

loans.name: Abilio Guillermo

texts.es:
Mr. Abilio B. is a 54-year-old married father of a 2-year-old-son. Mr. B.’ wife looks after their son and the house. He and his family live in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua.

Mr. B. has been working as a driver for ten years. He needs this loan for home improvements such as building a cement wall that used to be made of wood.

He plans to finish building his cement house in order to provide his young son with more safety.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Abilio tiene 54 años de edad, es casado y habita en el barrio Hialeah, tiene un niño de 2 años de edad, su esposa es quien se encarga de cuidar la casa y el niño.

Don Abilio trabaja como conductor y lleva diez año laborando en esta profesión. El préstamo lo requiere para hacer mejoras en su vivienda, como es la construcción de una pared de concreto que anteriormente era de madera.

Sus planes es terminar de construir su casa de concreto, para darle mayor seguridad a su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Build cement wall

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for AFODENIC - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Heriberto Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Heriberto A. is a 55-year-old married man who lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood of Managua.

His wife helps him run the general store. They have been in business for four years. Mr. A. is also a mechanic.

He is requesting this loan for home improvement, such as replacing part of the roof of his house. In the future, he wishes to finish building his house and to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Heriberto tiene 55 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casado, su esposa le ayuda en la pulpería.

El negocio de don Heriberto es una pulpería y lleva cuatro años de experiencia, a parte de eso el es mecánico.

Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para mejoras en su vivienda y cambiar parte del techo de su casa de habitación. A futuro es terminar de construir su casa y ampliar el negocio.

loans.use: Home improvement (roofing)

loans.name: Eger Oswaldo

texts.es:
Mr. Eger lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua, Nicaragua. He is 30 years old, married, and has two children ages 14 and 16. His wife works as a cook in a private home and helps with the household expenses. Mr. Eger has worked in a restaurant as a waiter for two years. The loan that he is requesting is for the construction of a room. In the future he wants to keep improving his home and to educate his children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Eger habita en el barrio Hialeah, es casado y tiene 30 años de edad, le tienen dos hijos de 14 y 16 años de edad, su esposa trabaja como cocinera de una casa particular y ayuda a los gasto del hogar. Don Eger trabaja en un restaurante desempeñándose como mesero, lleva dos años de estar laborando. El préstamo que esta solicitando es para la construcción de un cuarto. A futuro es seguir mejorando su vivienda, educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Build a 14-square meter bedroom

loans.name: Paola Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Paola is 48 years old and lives in the Omar Torrillo neighborhood of Managua, Nicaragua. She is married and has two children ages 20 and 27. Her husband is retired but contributes to the household expenses, and Mrs. Paola works as a secondary school teacher. The loan that she is requesting will be used to improve her home with the construction of a porch for her family to be more comfortable and secure. She plans to improve the standard of living for her family and make them more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Paola tiene 48 años de edad, habita en el barrio Omar Torrillo, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 20 y 27 años de edad, su esposo es jubilado y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Doña Paola trabaja en una institución como docente de secundaria, el préstamo que esta solicitando es para mejoras de la vivienda en la construcción de un porche para estar más cómoda y segura. Sus planes son mejorar el nivel de vida para brindar más comodidad a su familia.

loans.use: Begin construction of a porch for her house

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es:
Eva is married and they have one son, but her husband is unemployed due to health problems. She started her business because of financial necessity, as her husband had worked as a supervisor on a farm at the coast, but because of his health problems he had to leave the job. The development of his diabetes prevented him from working in order to provide for his family. Thus Eva began her business 6 years ago when she realized that she would need to work because her husband had been the breadwinner and she had taken care of their son, but after her husband developed diabetes money for food and school tuition became tight. She began by selling beauty products, which has given her the opportunity to make money to maintain her home and help get her son ahead, without neglecting him so much.

Eva needs a loan for $650, which she will repay over 6 months, to purchase merchandise and in this way have more inventory which will allow her to look for new customers. She will be able to offer them more products, and earn more income. With your help Eva and her family will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Eva esta casado, su esposo se encuentra desempleado por motivos de salud, tienen1 hijo. Ella inició el negocio por necesidad economica y ya que su esposo trabajaba como supervisor en un campo de la costa pero debido a problemas con su salud tuvo que dejar de labor, el desarrollo diabetes por lo que ya no pudo seguir trabajando para sostener a su familia. Asi fue como Eva empezo su negocio hace 6 años, cuando se vio en la necesidad de trabajar ya que su esposo era el sustento del hogar y ella se dedicaba al cuidado de su hijo, pero por la diabetes que le dio a su esposo empezaron a escasear los alimentos y a tener problemas con los pagos de la educacion del hijo, empezo vendiendo productos de belleza lo que le ha dado la posibilidad de generar recursos para ayudar a mantener el hogar y sacar adelante a su hijo, sin descuidarlo tanto.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $650 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y tener mas inventario ya que buscara tener nuevos clientes y ofrecerles mas productos para i generar mas ganacias. Con tu apoyo Eva y su familia saldran adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business #53919

loans.name: Victor Ignacio

texts.es:
Victor is married, lives in the Oswaldo Manzanarez neighborhood and is 43 years old. He has three children who are 2, 20 and 25 years of age. His wife helps him with their business. Victor rents out rooms and also has a sorbet shop. He started these businesses 10 years ago with his own funds. The loan that he is requesting is to improve his sorbet shop so that he may provide better service to his customers. In the future, he plans to grow his shop since it is located on a strategic route allowing him to increase capital and earn better income.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Víctor es casado, habita en el barrio Oswaldo Manzanarez, y tiene 43 años de edad, le tienen tres hijos de 2, 20 y 25 años de edad, su esposa ayuda en el negocio que tienen. El negocio del Sr. Víctor es el alquiler de cuartos y tiene una sorbeteria, lleva diez años de experiencia el inició con fondos propios. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para mejoras de local en el negocio de la sorbeteráa para dar mejor servicio con el ambiente a sus clientes. A futuro es seguir ampliando el local de la sorbeteria ya que esta en una ruta estratégica para seguir aumentando el capital y así tener mejores ganancias.

loans.use: Invest in infrastructure of his sorbet shop.

loans.name: Zenaido

texts.es:
Zenaido is married and has two children, one that is 20 years old and one that is 10 years old. His wife is a housewife. He began his business to pay the expenses of the house, as well as the hospital and medical expenses from a car accident that his son had, and to pay for the repairs to the car. So that he would not get off track with the expenses of the house, he decided to get extra income to help and that is how, 8 years ago, he began his grocery store and moved himself forward.

He is asking for a loan of US$975 that he will pay in 6 months in order to buy merchandise and offer better service to his clients. With your help, you will contribute to the growth of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Zenaido es casado y tiene 2 hijos de de 20 y 10años, su esposa es ama de casa. Inicio su negocio para solventar los gastos de su casa ademas de los gastos hospitalarios y atencion medica de un accidente automovilistico que tuvo su hijo y para pagar las reparaciones del carro ,sin desbalancearse con los gastos de casa, decidio conseguir un ingreso extra para ayudarse y fue asi como, hace 8 años inicio su tienda de abarrotes y poco ha salido adelante.

El solicita un prestamo por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancia y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu apoyo contribuiras al crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Cosme

texts.es:
Cosme is married to Mrs. Judith Martínez Suárez, who is a homemaker. They have 3 sons: Juan Cosme (38, married); Ever Javier (29, married); Eduarudo Isaac Elisa (27, lives and works outside of the city).

He started his business after having worked for several companies under a fixed contract, but never receiving seniority. He was also a self-employed public transportation driver, so he never had the chance to retire nor earn a pension, which motivated him to start his own business to get ahead.

He started in February of 2006 when he asked his wife to order some silver jewelry from her provider because at that time, she was the one who sold jewelry. He then started to sell jewelry to his fellow taxi cab drivers because his one of his sons owns a taxi cab and sometimes lets him borrow it in the evenings so that he can make extra money. That is when he seizes the opportunity to sell silver jewelry and watches to his co-workers. He has been prosperous in this business so far.

He needs a loan of $300.00 USD, which he will repay in 3 months, so that he can purchase more jewelry and watches, offering a greater selection of merchandise to his customers and increasing both his sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Cosme está casado con la Sra. Judith Martínez Suárez, quien se dedica a las labores del hogar. Tienen 3 hijos: Juan Cosme de 38 años, casado; Ever Javier de 29 años, casado y Eduardo Isaac Elisa de 27 años, el vive y trabaja fuera de la ciudad.

Inició el negocio despues de trabajar en varias empresas, en todas ellas por contrato fijo y nunca hizo antigüedad, además de que fei chofer de transporte público por su cuenta, por lo que no tuvo la posibilidad de jubilarse o pensionarse, esto lo motivo a iniciar su propio negocio para salir adelante.

Comenzó en Febrero de 2006, cuando le pidio a su esposa que le encargara con su proveedor un lote de joyería de plata, ya que en ese entonces ella era la que vendía joyería, lo cual hizo y empezo a venderla entre sus compañeros taxistas, ya que tiene un hijo que es propietario de un taxi y a veces se lo presta por la tarde para que obtenga un ingreso, y es ahí cuando aprovecha para yvenderla a sus compañeros los artículos de plata y relojes y desde entonces le ha ido bien.

El necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar más joyería y relojes y tener una mejor variedad de artículos que ofrecer a sus clientes y asi incrementar sus ventas y ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise (jewelry and watches)

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba lives in the Fuente neighborhood. She is married and is 41 years old. She has two children who are in school. Her husband works as a master worker and takes care of the family's bills. Alba works in an institution as a primary teacher and has two years experience. The loan she is requesting is to improve her home by replacing the roof. Her goals are to help her family get ahead and provide her children with an education so that they may become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Alba habita en el barrio la Fuente, es casada y tiene 41 años de edad, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando, su esposo trabaja como maestro de obra y aporta a los gastos de la familia. La Sra. Alba trabaja en una institución como docente de primaria lleva dos años de experiencia. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para mejoras de su vivienda en el cambio de techo de su vivienda. Sus planes son poder sacar a su familia adelante, brinadrles educación a sus hijos y poder darles una profesión.

loans.use: Replace the roof of her home.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene is 39 years old and lives in the Ticuantepe area. She is married and has two children who are 16 and 21 years of age. Her husband works as a credit promotor and he takes care of the family's bills. Irene buys and sells pigs and already has several years experience with this business. The loan she is requesting is to replace her home's roof since it is in disrepair. Her goals are to expand her business buying and selling pigs.

 Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer. 


La Sra. Irene tiene 39 años de edad, habita en el municipio Ticuantepe, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 16 y 21 años de edad, su esposo trabaja como promotor de crédito y aporta a los gastos del hogar. 

Doña Irene vende y compra cerdos,  lleva ya varios años  en el negocio, con este préstamo que esta solicitando es para cambio de techo de su vivienda ya que esta en mal estado. Sus planes son poder expandirse el negocio de la compra y venta de cerdos.

loans.use: Replace her home's roof.

loans.name: Deyli Levinea

texts.es:
Deyli is married to Mr. Ever Javier C. Martinez, who works as a taxi driver. They have 1 daughter, Elisa Yisel, who is one and a half years old.

Deyli began her business because she was moved by a desire to progress economically and give her daughter a good education and a better quality of life. She wanted to earn extra income to help her husband with the costs of the home and between the two of them, to be able to help their daughter and have the possibility of paying for her college education when she is grown.

She began in August of 2006 when her mother-in-law encouraged her to sell cosmetics and women's handbags. First she began to sell them among her friends and neighbors and little by little her clients increased. She has done very well due to this and is thinking of establishing a business in the future.

She needs a loan of US$300 that she will pay in 3 months to acquire a larger selection of beauty products and handbags that are in style to O. better attention to her clients. With your help, Deyli will reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Conover, Kiva.org volunteer. Deyli está casada con el Sr. Ever Javier C. Martínez, quein trabaja como taxista. Tienen 1 hija Elisa Yisel de 1 año y medio. Inició el negocio movida por el deseo de progresar económicamente y darle a su hija una buena educación y un mejor nivel de vida. Ella deseaba obtener un ingreso extra al de su esposo para ayudarlo con los gastos de la casa y entre los dos poder sacar adelante a su hija y tener la posibilidad de que cuando crezca costearle una carrera universitaria. Comenzó en Agosto de 2006 cuando su suegra la animó a vender cosméticos y bolsas de mano para dama, empezo primero vendiendo entre sus amigas y vecinas y poco a poco fueron aumentando sus clientes, por lo cual le ha ido muy bien y esta pensando en un futuro establer el negocio.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para adquirir un mejor surtido de productos de belleza y bolsas de mano de temporada para brindarle una mejor atención a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Deyli lograra su meta

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa is married to Javier Adán Jiménez Ruiz, who works as a chauffeur. She has three children: Juan who is 11 years old and is in elementary school, Christian who is 5 years old and in pre-school and Cristina, who is 23 months old. She began her business out of the desire to work, get ahead, and be an independent person. She wants her own income so that she can offer a better future to her children since her husband's salary sometimes is not enough. Her children are already in school and her daughter Cristina was born with a disability. She had to buy special medicines and provide therapies that ended up being expensive. She began her business in February 2006 when a promoter who sold a particular type of jewelry invited her and left her with some merchandise to try out. This provided good results and in this way, she continued to acquire more products to sell to her friends, neighbors and family members. Since that time, she has done well thanks to her efforts.

Maria needs a loan of US $300 which she will repay in four months, in order to purchase more merchandise which will allow her to have variety to offer to her customers, and in this manner, increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Luisa está casada con el Sr. Javier Adán Jiménez Ruiz, su esposo trabaja como chofer. Tiene 3 hijos: Juan de 11 años estudiante de primaria, Christian de 5 años que estudia la pre-primaria y Cristina de 1 año 11 meses. Inició el negocio por el deseo de trabajar y salir adelante, de ser una persona independiente con deseos de superación y así poder obtener su propio ingreso para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ademas de que con el sueldo de su esposo a veces no les alcanzaba y sus hijos ya estaban estudiando además de que Cristina su hija nació con una discapacidad y tenía que comprarle un medicamento especial así como llevarla a terapias que resultaban caras para su presupuesto . Comenzó su negocio en Febrero de 2006, cuando una promotora de las que vendia este tipo de joyería la invitó y le dejó un poco de mercancía para que probara y ver como me iba, lo cual hizó obteniendo muy buenos resultados y así fui adquiriendo cada vez mas productos para seguir vendiendo entre sus amistades, familiares y vecinos y desde entonces me ha ido muy bien gracias a su esfuerzo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $.300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar más mercancía que me permita tener variedad para ofrecer a mis clientes y de esta manera aumentar mis ingresos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Noe Magdiel

texts.es:
Noe is married to Mrs. Ma. Guadalupe Arriaga Piñón who is a homemaker. They have two children: Cinthia who is 11 years old and Erick who is 6 years old. Both are in elementary school. Noe began his business as he had always liked sales and it allowed him to bring in extra income to give his family a better quality of life since his salary, as an employee, was very low and it didn't allow him to meet his growing financial obligations. Additionally, his children were constantly requesting more things for school and Noe didn't have the money. As a result, he searched for another activity, which would allow him to continue to work his regular job without neglecting his family -- he found sales. He began in March 2006 when a neighbor invited him to help her sell jewelry. He began to offer these products to his work colleagues who began to buy items for their wives and daughters. Noe realized that it was a good business and he decided to go out on his own to earn more money. In this way, he began his business.

Noe needs a loan of US $300, which will be repaid in four months, to purchase merchandise and fulfill his customers' order and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Noe esta casado con la Sra. Ma. Guadalupe Arriaga Piñón, quien se dedica a las labores del hogar Tienen 2 hijos: Cinthia de 11 años y Erick de 6 años, ambos estudiantes de primaria. Inició el negocio por que siempre le han gustado las ventas y además de esta forma obtiene un ingreso extra para darles un mejor nivel de vida a mi familia, ya que su salario como empleado era muy bajo y no les alcanzaba ya que sus compromisos economicos eran cada vez mas grandes, sus hijos cada vez pedían mas cosas para la escuela y no tenía dinero, por eso busco alguna otra actividad a la cual dedicarse sin descuidar su trabajo y su familia y lo encontré en las ventas. Comenzó en Marzo de 2006, cuando una vecina lo invitó a que le ayudara a vender joyería y el empezó a ofrecerla entre sus compañeros de trabajo los cuales le empezaron a comprar para sus esposas e hijas y como se dío cuenta que era buen negocio decidío independizarse para obtener más ganancias y fue así como inició su negocio.

El necesita un prestamo por US $300 que pagara en 4 meses para comprar mercancía y surtir los pedidos de sus clientes y asi incrementar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Mrs. Josefa is 48 years old and lives in the suburb Villa Venezuela. She is married and has four children, two of whom live on their own and two who are still students. Her husband works in construction and contributes to the household expenses.

Mrs. Josefa has owned a business selling food for the past three years. She began the business with her own money and help from her husband. With this loan she wants to invest in the purchase of products such as rice, oil, and meat, in order to always be able to offer delicious and varied dishes to her customers. In the future, she would like to improve the quality of her service.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Josefa tiene 48 años de edad, habita en el barrio anexo Villa Venezuela, casada le tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos son independientes y dos están estudiando, su esposo trabaja en la construcción y aporta a los gastos para el hogar.

El negocio de Doña Josefa. es venta de comida y lleva tres años de experiencia e inició con fondos propios y ayuda de su esposo, con el préstamo lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos: arroz, aceite, carnes, para ofrecer siempre sus ricos variados platos a sus clientes. A futuro es mejorar la calidad del servicio.

loans.use: Purchase rice, meat, oil, and perishables to use in her dishes

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Mrs. Trinidad is 37 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. She is married and has four children, two of whom live on their own and two who are still students. Her husband works as a bricklayer and contributes to the household expenses.

Mrs. Trinidad has worked in a private home as a maid for the past four years. She wants to use the loan she is requesting to improve her home by building a porch, which will make things more comfortable. She hopes to be able to give her children all the education that they need.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Trinidad tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, dos de ellos son independiente y dos están estudiando, su esposo trabaja como albañil y aporta a los gastos de la familia.

Doña Trinidad trabaja en una casa particular como doméstica, lleva cuatro años de estar laborando, con el dinero que está solicitando es para la mejora de su vivienda en la construcción de un porche para estar más cómoda. Espera poder darle toda la educación necesaria a sus hijos.

loans.use: Begin construction of a porch for her home

loans.name: Rahaj Enterprise Group

texts.en:
Rashid K. is the group leader of Rahj Enterprise. Rahj Enterprise has five members but the other three members are busy on their farms. Rashid is 49 years old and married with 4 children. He sells a few bags of cement and soft drinks. With his previous loan, he diversified the business and would like to expand it. He is therefore requesting a loan to purchase more crates of soft drinks.

Mohamed is a carpenter and also sells timber. He needs more capital to increase his stock of timber. Their businesses are the sole source of income for their families and their aim is to generate income to send their children to college.

loans.use: Purchase timber, soft drinks and bags of cement

loans.name: Umbrella Komeh Avenue Group

texts.en:
Abdul is the group leader and the group has been functional for two years as a savings and rotating club. Abdul is 42 years old and married with 4 children, all in school. Abdul said that his dream is to see his children through their education so that they will be able to take care of him in his old age. School expense is the largest budget item for Abdul and he works hard to meet his budget.

Aminata Kabbia sells shoes and both members would like to expand their businesses to generate more income. Therefore, they are requesting a loan of Le.1,600,000

loans.use: Increase stock of basic medicines, and shoes

loans.name: Tawakaltu Group

texts.en:
Mariatu K. is the group leader of Tawakaltu. She is 29 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband also has a small business and both are working hard to make their family to poverty-free.

The group members sell dried fish and assist each other in purchasing the fish from the supplier in turns. Before their previous loans, the members purchased the fish on credit and thus earned less profit, but the loan enabled them build their capital. The group members would like to increase their stocks and are therefore requesting a loan of Le.2600000 for the purpose.

loans.use: To increase stock of dried fish

loans.name: Abibatu

texts.en: Abibatu is a mother of 3 children and has been managing her small business for more than 3 years, but on a very small scale.  With her previous loan from Kiva, she increased her stock and was able to meet her children's school expenses.  Abibatu sells rice, salt, cooking oil, etc. and her husband helps her in running the business.  Abibatu said that she did not have good education but she will work very hard to educate her children to university level, and the loan will enable her make her dreams come true.  She is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1,500,000.

loans.use: To increase inventory and income

loans.name: Hands Together Group

texts.en:
Ibrahim Bangural is 50 years old and a father to 6 children. He has been self-employed as a tailor for 30 years. With his previous loan from Kiva, he purchased 2 sewing machines and employed two tailors to assist with the business. Ibrahim is happy that his business is growing and 2 of his children will soon enter college. He is requesting another loan to purchase more materials as his clientele has increased.

Other group members are engaged in various retail businesses and would like to expand their businesses. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.3,800,000.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machine, sewing materials, and inventory for general stores

loans.name: Mohammad Zahar

texts.en: Mohammad Zahar lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he has a shoe shop. He has been involved in this business for more than 5 years. During this time he attracted more clients and he wants to enlarge his shop so he has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and make his business more successful and more popular in the town. He would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business of selling fruits and vegetables in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros N., a widow with two children, works as a goldsmith making and decorating a variety of fashionable bracelets, necklaces, rings, earrings, and so on. She also trains a few workers who would like to become goldsmiths. Each day she can typically make around $30 in revenue. As well, once a year a broker comes to her house to purchase a mat placed beneath her goldsmith tables to collect small pieces of gold that have descended during her work activities. The mat can generate around $100 per year for her. 
Mrs. Ros N. and her co-workers now need more goldsmith tools in order to work  faster and more productively and render even better service to the customers.

loans.use: To buy more tools to facilitate her work as a goldsmith.

loans.name: Kao

texts.en: Kao N., 45, and her husband have six children, four of whom are students, while another is a taxi driver and another no longer lives at home. They have grown rice since 1979, and on average make $1.50 each day.   Currently, the price of rice keeps rising due to a shortage caused by last year’s drought in provinces such as Siem Reap and the fact that most of the farmers sold their harvest to neighboring countries such as Vietnam.  Kao N. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to acquire more land to grow rice as well as purchase a motorbike for her son for transportation to his job.  (Mrs. Kao is pictured with her little daughter.)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and farmland.

loans.name: Teab

texts.en: Teab S., 33, is married and lives in Siem Reap Province with her four children. She works in a grocery store, making around $2 each day, while her husband typically makes $2 every day as a trailer driver. Inflation has driven up prices all across Cambodia, and many are facing economic struggles. Teab S. has approached CREDIT for a loan of $1,000 to make two investments. First, she would like to purchase groceries in bulk, saving money and allowing her to achieve a greater profit. Second, she would like to purchase a motorbike to transfer groceries to and from the market, as current public transportation costs have made it difficult to increase profits.  Teab S. feels that these investments can help increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk, as well as a motorbike.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok S., 33, is a mother of two children who are students. She lives in Kampong Cham province in Cambodia and she works in a vegetable store in a busy market, typically earning around $5 each day. Her husband, Ben Saroeun, makes approximately $10 every day from his taxi business. To help her and her husband's businesses, Mrs. Sok would like to apply for a loan of $1,000. She would like to purchase more vegetables for her store as well as provide her husband with the funds necessary to repair his car. She sees this loan as a way to increase their cumulative income and is confident that their business ventures can be successful with this help. The couple is pictured above.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services throughout both rural and urban communities in Cambodia.

loans.use: To repair the taxi and invest in the vegetable store business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Houk

texts.en:
Houk T., 47, is married and lives with her five children in Siem Reap Province, where she works in a grocery store and her husband works in security. Their combined revenue is above $50, but their profits are low and the cost of living is high. They are also supported by one of their children who sells souvenirs by the temple.

Inflation has driven up prices across Cambodia, and even attaining basic necessities such as food and gasoline have become daily struggles for many people. Houk T. has approached CREDIT for a loan of $300 to purchase more groceries for her store. She feels that this sustainable investment will help increase her profits and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries.

loans.name: Soy

texts.en:
Soy R., 39, is married and lives in Siem Reap Province with her five children. She sells fish in the market, making $3 each day, while her husband works in construction, making about $5 every day. They are also supported by one of their children, who is employed in the area.

Inflation has driven up prices across Cambodia, and many are facing severe economic struggles. Soy R. has approached CREDIT for a loan of $500 to purchase some wood to repair her leaking house. She believes this will be a sustainable investment that will significantly raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase wood to repair home.

loans.name: Sima Duong Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Mrs Sima D. and this group comprises of five members in Dem Popel Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs Sima D. is currently in the business of Khmer noodle selling and she requested a loan in order to expand it since her business activity is working very well. Her husband, Mr Sophal Chea, is a fish seller in the local market.

Mrs Sima D. is 49 and the mother of four children, two of whom are enrolled in school while the other two are staying at home because they are still too young to work or study.

One of the group members, Mr Vin N., could not come to take a loan so he is not presented in the photo, but his wife came instead. Thus, she is presented in the picture.

loans.use: To expand her Khmer noodle selling in order to improve her living condition.

loans.name: Puth

texts.en: Puth M., 44, lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and two children. She works with her husband selling firewood, and their combined income is typically $8 each day. Many in Cambodia are facing economic difficulties with rising inflation making the price of food, especially rice, soar. Puth M., though, has an entrepreneurial mindset and sees how she can expand her business through the purchase of a trailer to transport the firewood. She has asked CREDIT for a loan of $500 to make this investment, which she believes will both  increase her daily income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to transport firewood.

loans.name: Dam

texts.en: Dam S. M., 32, is married and lives with her four children, two of whom are employed while the other two are students. She and her husband are farmers who together earn around $3 each day  growing yams, beans and peppers. To get more output in the near future, this couple would like to obtain a loan from Kiva to purchase good quality seed and hire some workers to help plant the crops.

loans.use: To purchase good quality seed and hire some workers to help plant the crops.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men K., 27, is married and lives with her two young children in Siem Reap Province. She works as a chef at a local guest house, making $2 every day, while her husband, Mok Sokon, is a construction worker, making $5 per day. Inflation problems and soaring food prices in Cambodia have hit many people hard, forcing them to reduce expenses and find ways to save money. Men K. and her husband see an opportunity to save on public transportation costs through the purchase of their own motorbike. They have therefore approached CREDIT for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike that will allow them to save more money and raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Saroeurn Chum Group

texts.en:
Mr Saroeurn C. is the leader of this group of five in Dem Popel Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. He is a security guard in a company. His wife, Mrs Nai Ros, is an egg seller in the local market. Since Mrs Nai Ros’s business is improving, she needs to expand it. Unfortunately, Mrs Nai Ros does not have enough money to purchase more eggs to sell, so her husband, Mr Saroeurn C., requested a loan to buy more eggs for this purpose.

Mr Saroeurn C. is 43 and the father of eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the remaining six attend school. He will share this loan with the members of the group.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs for his wife to sell for an income.

loans.name: Preap

texts.en: Preap P., 20, is married to Nut Meatie and lives in Siem Reap Province. He works at a coffee shop that provides him with a daily income of $3, while his wife is a teacher at church, making about $4 each day. Preap P. has an entrepreneurial mindset and believes that there is a good business opportunity in his area. He has approached CREDIT for a loan of $400 to combine with his personal savings to purchase a computer with which he hopes to transfer music onto cell phones. Cell phones are everywhere, especially in the urban areas, and transferring music to them is very popular. He wants to capitalize on this current trend and add to his daily income.

loans.use: To purchase a computer.

loans.name: Tem

texts.en: Tem S., 41, lives in Siem Reap Province with his wife, Seng Socheat (seen in the picture), and their two children. He is a taxi driver and typically makes $4 each day, but his motorbike is old and in need of replacement, so he is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase another one.  This new piece of equipment is essential to an opportunity Tem has to expand his business and make some extra income. He has ambitious goals, including a plan to open a store in the market in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Phary Phai Group

texts.en:
Five people in Dem Popel Village in Kampong ChhnA. Province will join in this group to get a loan. Mrs Phary P. is the group leader and she is currently in watermelon selling. Mrs Phary P. is now requesting a loan to buy more watermelons as her business is doing really well. She is 43 and a widow with five children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the other four are attending school.

Previously, Mrs Phary P. obtained a loan from AMK to start her current business. She will share this loan with the members of her group.

loans.use: To buy more watermelons to sell.

loans.name: Khen Sok Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Mrs Khen S. and this group comprises five members in Dem Popel Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs Khen S. and her husband, Mr Soeurn Bun, are cake sellers in the local village. Mrs Khen S. now wants to expand her business; unfortunately, she does not have enough money to purchase more cakes to sell. Therefore, Mrs Khen S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Mrs Khen S. has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factoR. while the others are enrolled in the local school.

Previously, Mrs Khen S. obtained a loan to buy four pigs for breeding. She will share this loan with her group members.

loans.use: To purchase more cakes to sell.

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Moa K., 42, is married and lives with three of her children in Siem Reap Province. She and her husband work together in a fishing business, selling their catch in the market, earning about $5 each day; their family is also supported by two of the children who are construction workers.  Heavily dependent upon weather conditions, the fishing business is a difficult one. Moa K. is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase some new equipment to replace gear that is old and in need of repair.  She would also like to purchase a new net,  which will allow her to increase her daily catch and increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy R., 46, is married and lives with her six children in Siem Reap Province. Daily she goes to the market to sell Khmer desserts for a profit of $4, while her husband, Sek Saroeun, works in construction. They are also supported by two of their sons who work in construction and one of their daughters who is a waitress at a local restaurant. The family is now in need of some capital, requesting a loan of $500 both to invest further in the dessert business and to purchase a motorbike to replace the family’s old and unreliable one. Tuy R. sees these investments as a great opportunity to increase the family’s income and standard of living.

loans.use: To invest in the dessert business and replace the motorbike.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Vanna Phet Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Mrs Vanna P.. She is a state teacher in Soben Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. This job generates only $25 per month, which is not enough to support a family. Her husband, Mr Samorn P., is a farmer and rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and sell at a better price later in the year. Since Mrs Vanna P.'s husband's business has improved, Mrs Vanna P. wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs Vanna P. asked for a loan to purchase more rice to keep in stock. Mrs Vanna P. has two children, both of whom are attending the local school.

Previously, Mrs Vanna P. obtained a loan from AMK to start her husband's middleman business. She will share this loan with her group members.

loans.use: To buy rice to keep in stock and sell at a better price later in the year.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en: Lim S., 41, is married and lives with one of her children in Siem Reap Province. Daily, she goes to the market to sell Khmer desserts, while her husband, Chea Sarann, works as a photographer, making $8 per day. The family’s home is in disrepair, however, and Lim is requesting a loan of $1000 to complete the construction.  She sees this as a great opportunity to raise her standard of living and to improve the conditions of her home.

loans.use: To complete their housing construction.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mr. Suon D., 45 years old, offloads cement from trucks into factories. Normally, he hires some laborers to help him with the process, paying them when he is remunerated by the factory owner. Suon’s wife has a business making and selling food to the workers from a food stand, earning, on average, $5 per day. Suon’s wife is a good cook and in the future she wants to open a small restaurant. He has requested a loan of $1,000 from Kiva to expand his wife’s food stand, with the remaining money to be used to pay for his laborers’ wages until the factory owner pays him later in the month.

His wife is pictured because Mr. Suon Dara was not available.

loans.use: To expand his wife's food stand and pay for his laborer's wage.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng L., 53, is a widowed grocery store worker who lives in Siem Reap Province. She has thirteen children, but they have all married and moved out of the home. As a grocery store worker, she typically makes $2 each day and is now in need of some capital. Inflation has been soaring in Cambodia over the course of the past year, and food prices are very high, substantially increasing the economic struggles many Cambodians experience. Cheng L., seeking to increase her income and improve her standard of living, has asked for a loan of $500. With that loan, she would like to purchase more groceries and expand her business, while using the remaining money to repair her home’s leaky roof.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and repair a leaky roof.

loans.name: Hem Leng Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hem L. is the group leader I. this small group I. Soben Village I. Kampong Chhnang Province. She is currently I. the business of Khmer noodle selling. Her husband is a motorbike-taxi driver who can generate only a small income to support the family. Mrs Hem L. is 41 and the mother of two children, both of whom are enrolled I. school. Mrs Hem L. and the family members are now I. poor conditions and they live I. an old house. Mrs Hem L. is requesting a loan to increase her profit to build a new house to replace the old one.

Previously, Mrs Hem L. obtained a loan to expand her Khmer noodle business. She will share this loan with her group members.

loans.use: To increase her profit in order to build a new house to replace the old one.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang R., 40, is a widow living in Siem Reap Province with her six children. Daily, she goes to the market to sell meatballs and dried meat, making around $15 to support her large family. Three of her children also work: two sons earn $50 each month, and another child is a waitress, but Sang lacks access to capital to expand her business. She sees the Siem Reap area as a good opportunity to increase her income and is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a variety of souvenirs for her children to resell in front of the temples.

Siem Reap has benefited lately from a large increase in tourism, especially at Angkor Wat. With so many people coming to visit the city each year, Sang R. sees increased business opportunities, so in the future, she would like to set up a grocery store to increase her daily income and better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of souvenirs to resell.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en: Thon M., 49, is married and lives in Siem Reap Province with her four children. Daily, she goes to the market to sell porridge, making around $12.50, while her husband sells firewood, typically making $5 each day. The family is also supported by a few of the children who are able to work. One child is a farmer, another works with Thon M., another works with her husband, and the last is a student. Thon M. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a pig to raise. It is a difficult time economically for most Cambodians, because inflation has soared, and raising pigs will be a good way for Thon M. to generate some extra income for her family and raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a pig.

loans.name: Tak

texts.en: Tak M., 56, is married and lives with three of her children in Siem Reap Province. She and her husband are supported by two of their children who sell souvenirs in front of the temple, typically making $3 each day, while the third child is a student. She sees an opportunity to expand her children’s business through purchasing more souvenirs and is requesting a loan of $600. This loan will be of great assistance to a family living in Cambodia during a difficult time. Inflation has caused prices to soar and many impoverished Cambodians are experiencing the effects. Tak M. sees this loan as an opportunity to raise her income and standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more souvenirs to resell.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas S., 30, stays at home cooking and caring for the entire family. Her husband, Chi Saroeun, 27, stationed at one of the big hotels in Phnom Penh, has been a motor-taxi driver since 2007. His clients are tourists who he takes to the main attractions in and around Phnom Penh. Chi must now spend over half of his earned revenue on gas and motor repairs, so he is requesting a loan of $800 from Kiva to help replace an old unreliable motorbike. A new motorbike will enable him to retain more of his earnings. (Chi is pictured because Mrs. Meas S. was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for her husband's  business.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en: Rin T., 28, is married and lives in Siem Reap Province with her three young children. She sells soft drinks, making $3 each day, while her husband sells souvenirs in front of the temple, making around $3 every day as well. Rin T. wishes to expand her business to reach more customers, but she lacks the capital necessary to do so. She is therefore requesting a loan of $500 to invest in her family’s businesses. She would like to put $300 into her husband's souvenir business and $200 into her own soft drink business. She believes that these sustainable investments will increase the family's daily income. Rin T. has an entrepreneurial mindset and would like to see these businesses expand even more in the future.

loans.use: To invest in both the souvenir business and the soft drink business.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo M., 45,  sells groceries in the market. Her husband, Mr. Un Pheurk, 48, helps Mrs. M. with her grocery business by transporting groceries to sell in other areas. They both live with their four children in Thmor Pouk District, Banteay Meanchey Province. Now, Mrs. M. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase an additional inventory of groceries for her business. The loan will allow her to expand her business and thereby increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of groceries

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom C., 37, sells dried fish and smoked fish at her local market. She earns around $7 per day from these activities. Her husband, Mr. Chek Saroeun, 37, is a repairman of grinding machines, earning approximately $5 per day. They have two children, both of whom live in the family home in Donteav Village, Battambang Province. 

C. requests a loan of $900 to purchase more dried and smoked fish for her business. This loan will allow her to increase her inventory and thereby increase her revenue from sales.

loans.use: To purchase more dried and smoked fish

loans.name: Chuk

texts.en: Chuk S., 42, lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband (pictured above) and three children. She and her husband are farmers, earning a combined total of $2 every day. They are also supported by two of their children who earn a combined daily total of $5 working in construction. Chuk S. has asked CREDIT for a loan of $800 to purchase a small tractor to plow their farm. Farming has been difficult this past year due to inconsistent weather patterns, rising food prices, and general inflation. With this loan, Chuk S. sees the opportunity to raise their standard of living and to better care for their family. She believes that this loan will change their lives.

loans.use: To purchase a small tractor.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Nhiv

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhiv Sombou, 44 years old, has four children and resides with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Two of her children are employed by the same organization, and Nhiv has been working as a grocery vendor in front of her house since 2000, selling basic food stuffs to the people in her community. Each day she can make a profit of $5 while her husband, a car mechanic in a small garage, also earns about $5 per day
To meet growing customer demand, Mrs. Nhiv Sombou would like to borrow $500 from KIVA to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To expand her inventory to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Soum

texts.en:
Mrs. Soum P., 59, is a farmer who earns $2 per day. Her husband, Mr. Thorn Lom, 72, is a manager for a construction crew. He can earn around $5 per day. They live with their three children in Samdach Village, Battambang Province. Two of their children are construction workers. 

Mrs. P. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a blacksmithing machine for her husband’s construction business. This machine will allow him to find additional work and will thereby increase the family's income. Mrs. Soum P.'s husband is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase a blacksmithing machine for her husband’s construction business

loans.name: Hay

texts.en: Hay N., 28, lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and one young child. She works in the market selling vegetables, earning about $5 each day, while her husband makes $4 every day working at a local hotel. Hay N. has approached CREDIT for a loan that will enable her to expand her business and save money. She has asked for $1200 to purchase a motorbike to commute to and from work in order to save on the high public transportation costs. She would also like to use some of the money to increase her stock of vegetables and expand her business. She believes that this loan will be a sound investment, raising both her income and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To invest in the vegetable business and purchase a motorbike.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rorng

texts.en: Rorng S., 33, lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and their four children. Her husband operates a business pumping sand, making $3 each day, while their four children are students at the local school. Rorng S. has seen an opportunity to expand her husband’s business and increase the family’s income, and therefore has asked CREDIT for a loan of $1000 to purchase a piece of land that will allow them to pump more sand. She believes that their standard of living can be improved and that she can better care for her family through this loan and purchase.

loans.use: To purchase land.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Mrs. Lia L. is a housewife and her husband is a wood carver. Mr. Reth purchases pieces of wood to carve and earns around $10 per day from the sale of his craft. They live with three children in Orkhcheay Village, Battambang Province. Their first son helps Mr. Reth with his wood carving business. The second is a construction worker.

They are requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more wood to carve. The loan will allow them to expand their business and thereby increase their income.

loans.use: To purchase more wood to carve

loans.name: Muk

texts.en: Muk N., 61, is a widow living in Siem Reap Province with two of her children. She sells firewood, making $2 every day, and she is also supported by her two children, one a motor taxi driver and the other a cleaner at the temple. Her son’s motor taxi has become unreliable recently, creating an unnecessary burden for the family. She has asked CREDIT for a small loan of $200 to replace it. Muk N. sees this investment as a way to reduce the costs of repairs and expand the number of her son's customers, thereby increasing his daily income and raising the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.

loans.name: Tem

texts.en: Tem K., 30, is married and lives with her three children in Siem Reap Province. She goes to the market each day to sell the fish that her husband catches, typically making $5 each day, but has seen how her income can be increased. She would like to purchase some new fishing tools and expand the business through a loan of $300. With better tools, her husband can increase his daily catch and she can be more effective in selling the fish. Tem K. believes this investment will both raise her income and the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok V. and her husband (he is pictured because Sok V. was not available) have been rice farmers since they married. They have four children, two of whom are garment workers.  Rice is a high-demand crop in Cambodia, but its price continues to escalate due to last year’s drought and large exports to neighboring countries such as Vietnam.   
The family is requesting a loan from KIVA for $400 to buy fertilizer, gas, seeds and a water pump in order to increase their crop yield and water supply.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, fertilizer, seeds and gas.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en: Pen A., 27, lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and young child. She sells groceries and ice out of her home, making around $3 each day, while her husband, a fisherman, sells his catch for $3 each day. Inconsistent weather conditions and high inflation have made Cambodia a very difficult place to earn a living as a fisherman. In the midst of economic struggles, though, Pen A. has seen how she can expand her husband’s business through the purchase of some new tools. She has therefore approached CREDIT for a loan of $200 to purchase some new fishing equipment to enable her husband to increase his daily catch.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Thi Hoa

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Lương (MS: 13010030), 35 years old, is loved by her villagers and has reputation as a trustworthy woman in the village. Beside farming activities her family has a small grocery stand which earns a stead income. She has two children. One is still in school age, the other is grown up and has a job with a wage of 50,000 VND a month. She is applying for a loan of 4,256,000 VND to expand her grocery stand. Her group has 4 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount as hers.
  • Trịnh Thị Mười (MS: 080003), 59 years old, applies for a loan to invest in small business.
  • Hoàng Thị The (MS: 080004), 25 years old, applies for a loan to raise pigs.
  • Tạ Thị Duyên (MS: 080013), 49 years old, applies for a loan to invest in small business.
  • Lý Bích Thủy (MS: 080014), 46 years old, applies for a loan to invest in livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Đậu Thị Hoa (MS: 080002), năm nay 49 tuổi. Cô là người có uy tín trong làng và được mọi người yêu mến. Gia đình cô có cửa hàng nhỏ, tạo thu nhập thường xuyên. Nghề chính của gia đình cô là làm nông nghiệp. Cô có hai con, một con đang còn đang đi học, con lớn đi làm có thu nhập bình quân 50.000 VND/ tháng. Cô vay 4.256.000 VND để đầu tư mở rộng của hàng.
  • Trong nhóm cô gồm có:
  • Trịnh Thị Mười (MS: 080003), năm nay 59 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ.
  • Chị Hoàng Thị The (MS: 080004), năm nay 25 tuổi. Chị vay 3.360.000 VND để nuôi lợn.
  • Cô Tạ Thị Duyên (MS: 080013), năm nay 49 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND đầu tư buôn bán nhỏ.
  • Cô Lý Bích Thủy (MS: 080014), năm nay 46 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi.

loans.use: livestock and small business

loans.name: Patt

texts.en: Patt Y., 43, is married and lives with her three children in Siem Reap Province where she raises pigs, typically making $5 each day, while her husband is a farmer earning less than $1 per day.  Inconsistent weather conditions and high inflation have made Cambodia a very difficult place for farming. Many farmers are struggling to make ends meet with the high food prices and lack of necessary rains. In the midst of economic struggles, though, Patt Y. has seen how she can expand her pig business and increase her daily income. She has asked CREDIT for a loan of $700 to split the money between the purchase of more pigs and the purchase of pig feed. She believes this will be a sustainable investment that can increase her income in the long-term and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and feed.

loans.name: Thi Hoan

texts.vi:
Mrs. Đỗ Thị Hoán (MS: 030001), 43 years old, lives with husband and two children. The family’s average monthly income is 2,500,000 VND. She likes the loan offered by SEDA and is excited to join. She is applying for a loan of 4,256,000 VND to invest in livestock and business of bamboo handicraft. Her group has 4 other members. They all apply for loans of the same amount of 3,360,000 VND.
  • Hoàng Thị Liễu (MS: 030003), 48 years old, applies for a loan to invest in livestock.
  • Trần Thị Thu (MS: 030004), 30 years old, applies for a loan to invest in livestock.
  • Hoàng Thị Thường (MS: 030005), 52 years old, applies for a loan to buy raw material for making brooms, fans.
  • Nguyễn Thị Hoa (MS: 030007), 40 years old, applies for a loan to invest in livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Cô Đỗ Thị Hoán (MS: 030001), năm nay 43 tuổi. Cô hiện đang sống cùng chồng và hai con. Cô và chồng thường ngày đan các giỏ hoa để bán cho các của hàng buôn hoa. Ngoài ra cô còn chăn nuôi để có thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình cô là80.000 VND/ngày. Cô rất thích với việc trả dần vốn vay, vì vậy cô luôn mong muốn được tham gia vay vốn chương trình. Cô vay 4.256.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi và đan lát.
  • Trong nhóm còn có:
  • Cô Hoàng Thị Liễu (MS: 030003), năm nay 48 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
  • Chị Trần Thị Thu (MS: 030004), năm nay 30 tuổi. Chị vay 3.360.000 VND đầu tư chăn nuôi.
  • Cô Hoàng Thị Thường (MS: 030005), năm nay 52 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để mua nguyên liệu làm quạt, chổi.
  • Cô Nguyễn Thị Hoa (MS: 030007), năm nay 40 tuổi. Cô vay 3.360.000 VND để đầu tư chăn nuôi.

loans.use: livestock and bamboo handicraft

loans.name: Hou

texts.en: Hou S. lives in Siem Reap Province with her husband and two children. She sells souvenirs by the temple each day and makes around $15 in revenue. Her husband is a teacher at the local school, making around $10 each day. Inflation has been very high in Cambodia over the past year and it has affected food prices and the costs of other basic necessities. Hou S. is requesting  a loan of $1200 to expand her business through the purchase of more souvenirs. She sees this investment as a way to increase her family’s daily profit and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more souvenirs to resell.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun K. is 75 years old. He repairs motorcycles and bicycles from his home, earning around $2 per day. His wife, Mrs. Din Khann, 65, makes then sells Cambodian cakes in the market, earning around $1.50 per day. They live with three children in the Anchanh Village, Battambang Province. One of their children is a motorcycle-taxi driver, one is a carpenter and the last is a tailor. 

K. is seeking a loan of $500 to purchase materials to use in his repair business. The loan will allow him to expand his business and thereby increase his family’s income. (The picture is K.'s wife)

loans.use: To purchase materials to use in his repair business

loans.name: Bann

texts.en: Bann P., 52, is married and lives with five of her children in Siem Reap Province. Her husband is a farmer in the area, making $3 per day to support the family, while her son makes $5 each day as a construction worker. Inflation has been very high in Cambodia over the past year and it has affected food prices and the costs of other basic necessities. Bann P. wants to expand her land to increase rice production and is requesting a loan of $1000.  Land values have increased over the last few years and she sees this investment as a good way to increase her daily income and  provide for her family in the future.

loans.use: To purchase farmland.

loans.name: Sun Kheom Group

texts.en:
Five people in SobE. (Dream) Village in Kampong Chhnang Province formed a borrowing group. Mrs Sun K. is the group leader and she is a grocer. Previously, Mrs Sun K. obtained a loan to start her business. Her business has grown fast so Mrs Sun K. would like to expand her inventory. In order to be able to purchase more grocery goods for her customers she asked for a loan.

Mrs Sun K. is 68 and a widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory. She will share this loan with her group members.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery goods for her customers.

loans.name: Sak

texts.en:
Sak R., 31, is a grocer in Siem Reap Province, living with her husband and five children. She typically makes $15 in revenue at her store, while her husband brings home $3 each day as a construction worker. The family is also aided by one daughter who sells souvenirs in front of the temple each day.

Inflation has been very high in Cambodia over the past year, greatly increasing the price of food and other basic necessities. Sak R. would like to expand her business to account for these rising costs and so is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more groceries to add to her inventory. She sees this as a stable investment that can increase her profits and improve her ability to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Kinh

texts.en: Kinh S., 37, works with her husband selling fish at home. Everyday they purchase fish from a market vendor and resell them to the people in their area, making, on average, $9 per day in revenue. This couple has four children, all of  whom are students. Now Kinh is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more fish from the market to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to meet her clients' needs.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Sophorn Iy Group

texts.en:
The group leader in this small group is Mrs Sophorn I. who lives in Soben (Dream) Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is currently in the business of fish selling in the local market. Since Mrs Sophorn I.’s business has improved, she would like to expand it. Unfortunately, Mrs Sophorn I. does not have enough money to purchase more fish to sell to the market. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fish for this purpose. Her husband, Mr Sophy Veng, is a state teacher who can generate a small salary to support the family. Mrs Sophorn I. is 46 and the mother of two children, both of whom are attending the local school.

Mrs Sophorn I. will share this loan with the other members of her group.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell to the market.

loans.name: Thea Yan Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thea Y. is the group leader of four in Soben (Dream) Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells soup to the villagers. Her husband, Mr Sophal P., is a construction worker. They have five children, three of whom are attending school while the other two are staying at home because they are too young to work or enroll in school. Mrs Thea Y.’s family not only lives in poor conditions, but they also live in an old house. Thus, Mrs Thea Y. decided to ask for a loan to increase her profit so she can build a new house. Previously, Mrs Thea Y. obtained a loan to start her current business.

Mrs Thea Y. will share this loan with her other group members.

loans.use: To increase her profit to build a new house.

loans.name: Tep

texts.en:
Tep Y., 64, sells porridge and rice. She has been doing this for the past eight years and earns approximately $5 per day. Her husband, Mr. Hy Chrun, 67, is a retired civil servant. They have three children, one of whom is married, and lives in Kork Khleng Village in the Phnom Penh City. Their two other children are working in a garment factory and they make a combined income of $80 per month. 

Tep Y. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase ingredients and expand her business. She hopes that the loan will empower her to sell more porridge and rice, and thereby increase her family's income. Mrs. Y.'s husband is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and expand her business

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Mahbuba A. is 45 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of two children. Her husband is a businessman.

Mahbuba is in the cattle-selling business and she currently has 4 cows. About twenty years ago, her family faced mounting financial problems, so she decided to become a cattlewoman. Specifically, Mahbuba buys small cattle at the market at a low price, feeds them, and then re-sells them at the same market at a higher price to generate profits. Her elder sons also work with her in this business. Mahbuba works extremely hard in order to make the business successful and to generate a sufficient amount of income for the family.

Now, Mahbuba is planning to purchase additional cattle to raise and to thereafter sell for a profit. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting $600 for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan she has requested, but Mahbuba asserts that she will not be delinquent in any way and will promptly repay the loan according to its terms.

loans.use: To expand her business and to better support her family by purchasing additional cattle.

loans.name: Anora

texts.en:
Anora R. is 44 years old. She is married and she has three children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Anora is a very hard-working woman, which she attests to her dear parents who forged in her an attitude of determination and dedication to self-improvement.

Anora has been running her business for 15 years and she has gained a great deal of experience in doing so. In practice, she purchases young cattle at the local market and fattens them in order to sell them in the local markets. Because of this activity, she is able to support her three dear children so that they receive a quality education.

Anora is now seeking a loan in the amount of $600 for the term of 12 months. With the loans proceeds, she is planning to purchase small cattle in order to expand the business and to thereby improve the living conditions of her family. Please support this woman who has a great deal of courage and will to live.

loans.use: To expand her business and to improve her family's standard of living by purchasing small cattle

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs.Chan S. I., age 39, is a mother of three children and lives with her husband on the outskirts of Phnom Penh. One of her children is a waiter, another a  student, and one is too young to attend school.  Mrs. Chan is a garment worker earning, on average, $2.50 each day, while her husband, Srun Vuthy, works with his son in a nearby restaurant as a waiter. To achieve additional income, this couple is requesting a $500 loan to purchase cows to breed. In the future, the family also hopes to raise poultry.

loans.use: To purchase cows to breed for additional profit.

loans.name: Muhtaram

texts.en:
Muhtaram S. is 32 years old. She is married and she has four children. Her husband is a farmer. From a very young age, she has understood and recognized the value of hard work because she has had to deal with very difficult circumstances and various hardships in her life. Muhtaram is an extremely hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration, and she has always looked to provide extra income for the benefit of her family.

For approximately 8 years, she has been in the business of purchasing young cattle from the local market and fattening them up so that they can be sold in the local markets. More specifically, she wakes up very early each morning to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of fattening them and thereafter selling them at the highest price possible at the local market. She started this occupation after her beloved aunt had recommended it and taught her about the business. Thanks to this activity, she is able to support her children so that they receive a good education. Indeed, she wants them to continue to receive a good education because she hopes that they will reach the goals that they have laid out for themselves.

With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $600, for the term of 12 months, to buy a calf in order to expand her business and to thereby improve her family's standard of living. Please support this brave woman who has a great deal of courage and strength to live. Your generosity can change her life.

loans.use: To expand her business and to improve her family's living conditions by purchasing a calf

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len S. is a 44 year old widow and works collecting and buying the recyclable items from her village and around her community and resells them to the recycling plant. On average, she makes $4 each day. One of her children is married and no longer lives at home, two are employed as a garment workers, and the youngest is a student at primary school.
In order to expand her revenue, she would like to take out a loan to purchase more recyclable items from her villagers.

loans.use: To purchase more recyclable items to expand her revenue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restock a small clothes selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add some chic pants and blouses to her inventory in order to attract new clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in used clothing to retail in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in perfumes, beauty products, and other goods for a small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase clothing to sell in her community in order to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase beauty products and clothing for a small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in alcoholic beverages for a small bar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in raw materials and to repair a freezer in order to keep producing ice cream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase plastic and paper bags to sell in her community.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora I. is 26 years old. She is married and she has two kids. Her husband is a taxi driver. Nigora’s kids are small now but she and her husband work extremely hard to ensure that her children will have a bright future and will receive a good education.

She sells the national dresses and trousers for women, and also “Sherozi,” which is used to decorate the national dresses and trousers. Nigora purchases high-quality goods and sells such goods at reasonable prices because her clients merely have average levels of income. As a very nice and friendly woman by nature, Nigora does her best to satisfy her clients in such a way that they will be repeat customers. She notes that her business is stable and thus allows her to contribute considerably to her family's budget.

Now, Nigora would like to purchase more modern styles of the national dresses, trousers, and “Sherozi” in order to increase the range of goods she sells.
