She wants to grow her business and diversify the products offered in order to satisfy her loyal clientele.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Mère Astou B. comme on a l'habitude de l'appeler est une commerçante de produits divers qu'elle vend devant sa maison sise à Keur massamba Gueye Peulh. Gérante d'une très grande famille elle est mariée et mère de 7enfants. Elle est à son 10ème prêt avec U-IMCEC car elle est membre de la mutuelle depuis 2001. Elle veut renforcer et varier ses produits pour satisfaire sa fidèle clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various products

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es:
Mr. Marcelo C. B. sells basic consumer products from a store in his house. He started the business four years ago with a small loan provided by FAPE.

His wife tends to the business, while he dedicates himself to other activities such as farming and commerce.

Thanks to his efforts the general store has grown. Together with his wife he has been able to help his ten children, all of whom are in school studying, get ahead.

The loan would be used to invest into more products for the business, and he hopes to grow and provide better service while tending to the needs of his customers.

His dream is for his children to advance and continue with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Marcelo C. B., tiene una venta de productos de consumo diario en su casa, este negocio el lo inicio hace 4 años con un pequeño préstamo que FAPE le dio. Su esposa atiende el negocio, mientras el se dedica a las actividades de agricultura y comercio. Gracias a sus esfuerzos su negocio de la tienda ha crecido, y con su esposa están sacando adelante a sus 10 hijos, y todos sus hijos están en la escuela estudiando. El préstamo lo utilizara para invertir en mas productos de su negocio, y desea crecer y atender de mejor manera las necesidades de sus clientes. Su sueño es sacar a sus hijos adelante y que sigan con sus estudios.

loans.use: Purchase basic merchandise to offer for sale.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FAPE - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati is 25 years old and is an unmarried young woman. She has been selling sugar for the past 5 years. She obtains her supply of sugar from wholesalers and retails it to her customers, who are mostly food vendors like porridge sellers, coffee and tea makers, and bread bakers. She wants to use her loan to buy sugar in bulk to cater to the demands of her customers. She wants to use the proceeds from her operation to further her education, since she could not continue due to financial difficulty. Fati is a member of the group called Blessing. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a form of social collateral to repay the loan. Her photograph was taken during her group meeting.
Fati is pictured in the photo with brownish hair.

loans.use: To buy sugar in bulk

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Jesús L. has a business raising chickens and pigs at her house.

She has had the business for thirteen years, and thanks to this has been able to get ahead with her five children. Her husband works in construction.

She tends to and feeds the chickens and pigs, which she buys when they are small. She then sells them to the local market. Thanks to her great care, she has customers who seek her out at home to purchase her animals of different sizes.

She has fought hard to advance with her family. Her oldest daughter, age thirteen, is in school continuing her studies which makes Maria very happy.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria Jesús L. tiene un negocio de crianza de pollos y marranos en su casa. Tiene 13 años de haberse iniciado en este negocio, y gracias a el ha salido adelante con sus 5 hijos. Su esposo trabaja en la industria de la construcción. Ella cuida y alimenta a los pollos y marranos los cuales compra pequeños, y después los vende en su casa y el mercado local, gracias a sus buenos cuidados tiene clientes que la buscan en su casa para comprarle los animales de diferentes tamaños. Ella ha luchado mucho para salir adelante con su familia, su hija mayor de 13 años ya esta en el ciclo básico de educación, y eso la pone a ella muy contenta

loans.use: Purchase chicken and pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en: Rakia is 23 years old and is an unmarried young woman. She has been selling sugar for the past 3 years. She obtains her supply of sugar from wholesalers and retails it to her customers, who are mostly food vendors like porridge sellers, coffee and tea makers, and bread bakers. She wants to use her loan to buy sugar in bulk to cater to the demands of her customers. She wants to use the proceeds from her operation to build a small container shop to start selling groceries. Rakia is a member of the group called Blessing. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a form of social collateral to repay the loan. Rakia is pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To buy sugar in bulk

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Charcoal is one of the most popular sources of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes due to its affordability. This has created businesses for a lot of Ghanaian women. Diana is one of these women. She is 60 years old and divorced with 4 children. She has been selling charcoal for the past 15 years, at least, and is the oldest seller in her neighborhood. With the charcoal business, she has supported all of her children to finish school and start working. She still enjoys selling and takes a lot of pride in serving her customers. Diana wants to use the loan to purchase charcoal in bulk to enable her to reduce her costs to raise a good income. She hopes to use part of her profit to complete a shelter for her family. She is a member of the community group called Blessing Trust group. The group guarantees a loan through a repayment pledge. Peer pressure and support provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the repayment amount.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Emmanuella

texts.en: Emmanuella is 20 years old and an unmarried young woman. She realizes the need to support her family with additional income, so she decided to start a trade. She has been selling detergents like soaps and bleaches for the past 2 years. She obtains her supply of soaps and bleaches from wholesalers and retails them to her customers, who are mostly families, food vendors, drivers, etc.  She wants to use her loan to buy soap and bleach in bulk to cater to the demands of her customers. She wants to use the proceeds from her operation to further her education because she could not continue due to financial difficulty. Emmanuella is a member of the group called Blessing. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and use peer pressure to repay the loans. Her photograph was taken during a group meeting. Emmanuella is in the photo with a broad smile.

loans.use: To buy soaps and bleaches in bulk

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia is a member of the Kusikuy Community Bank. Kusikuy means ‘Be happy’ in the Quechua language.

Zenobia is 42 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in the hilly area of Cuchipampa, which is a Quechua word meaning ‘field of pigs’. Every week Zenobia travels to the various fairs in the region where she sells groceries and buys cheese, meat, and grain which she then sells door to door. She also knits sweaters by hand and sells them at the fairs. The income she generates from these businesses is used for the education of her children.

Zenobia needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy rice, sugar, barley, and beans.

Her dream is to build her own house, to run a profitable business from her home, and to have children with professional jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Zenobia es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alegrate en quechua.

Zenobia es casada, tiene 42 años y 6 hijos, Zenobia vive en la loma de un cerro llamado Cuchipampa que significa pampa de cerdos en quechua, Zenobia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región todas las semanas, donde vende abarrotes y de las ferias compra quesos, carne, cereales que vende de casa en casa. Además Zenobia teje chompas a mano los cuales los vende también en las ferias, gracias a los ingresos que genera en sus negocios esta educando a sus hijos.

Zenobia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, cebada, haba.

Los sueños de Zenobia son construir su casa, tener una tienda estable en su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Zenobia needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy rice, sugar, barley, and beans.

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr:
Originally from Keve, a village located 40 kilometers northwest of Lomé, Mrs. Akossiwa K. was born April 18th, 1965. She is a widow and is caring for four children. After the death of her husband in 2005, she started doing business selling fabric in the Agoè neighborhood of Lomé. She has to travel around ten kilometers by foot each day to make good sales. She is seeking for the first time a loan to buy 100 lengths of Hitarget brand fabric. With income from retail sales, she will be able to pay next year’s school fees for her children.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Originaire du village de KEVE, localité située à 40 Km au nord ouest de Lomé, Madame K. Akossiwa est née le 18 avril 1965. Elle est veuve et a 4 enfants à charge. Après la mort de son mari en 2005, elle a commencé le commerce de pagne dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Elle parcourt en moyenne 10 km à pieds par jour pour pouvoir bien vendre. Elle sollicite pour la première fois ce crédit pour acheter 100 pièces de pagne de marque Hitarget. Avec le revenu de cette activité, elle pourra supporter les frais de scolarité de ses enfants pour l’année prochaine.

loans.use: Purchase 100 lengths of fabric

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa is a member of the Kusikuy Community Bank. Kusikuy means ‘Be happy’ in the Quechua language.

Felipa is 42 years old, married, and has ten children. She lives in the hilly area of Cuchipampa, which is a Quechua word meaning ‘field of pigs’. Felipa knits beautiful sweaters by hand which she sells in various regional fairs. Every week Zenobia travels to the fairs to buy cheese and meat that she then sells door to door.

Felipa needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy cheese, wool, and various grains.

Her dream is to see her business grow, to have a nest egg of her own, to have children with professional jobs, and to have good health.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alegrate en quechua.

Felipa es casada, tiene 42 años y 10 hijos, Felipa vive en la loma de un cerro llamado Cuchipampa que significa pampa de cerdos en quechua, Felipa teje bellas chompas a mano que vende en las diferentes ferias de la región, sus viajes los realiza semanalmente, de las ferias compra queso, carne, que vende caminando de casa en casa.

Felipa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de queso, lana y cereales variados.

Los sueños de Felipa son que su negocio crezca, tener capital propio, sus hijos sean profesionales y estar bien de salud.

loans.use: Felipa needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy cheese, wool, and various grains.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Timotea is a member of the Banco Comunal Azucenas.

She is 48 years old, married, has six children, and lives in simple house maD. of local materials in the Asociación Las Rosas. She and her children work as artisans using alabaster to make religious artefacts and useful items like candlesticks. Their workshop is in their home. Timotea’s son is responsible for the designs of the products which they sell on a stall in the crafts market in Ayacucho. With this new loan, Timotea is planning to buy a knitting machine that she will use to make sweaters.

She needs a loan of 1200 in order to buy a knitting machine.

Timotea’s dream is to expand her business, to export her products directly, and to have this new enterprise succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Timotea es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas.

Timotea es casada, tiene 48 años y 6 hijos, Timotea vive en la Asociación Las Rosas su vivienda es D. material rustico, Timotea junto a sus hijos realizan trabajos artesanales en piedra D. Huamanga (alabastro) como iglesias, utilitarios entre otros, su taller esta en su misma casa y su hijo es el que se encarga D. los diseños, sus productos son vendidos en un puesto del mercado artesanal D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Timotea con el nuevo préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar una maquina D. tejer para confeccionar chompas.

Timotea necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. una maquina D. tejer.

Los sueños D. Timotea son ampliar su negocio, exportar sus productos directamente, que le vaya bien en el nuevo negocio que emprenderá.

loans.use: Timotea is requesting a loan of 1200 soles that she will use to buy a knitting machine.

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr:
Born in Kpalimé November 10th, 1977, Mr. Anani M. is single and has one child. In 2003, he established Bar Horeb where he sells drinks and cell phone credit recharge cards. He is seeking his first loan to buy 45 cases of drinks and 50 recharge cards. He is requesting this loan to replenish his stock which is sold out.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Né à Kpalimé la 10 novembre 1977, Monsieur M. Anani est célibataire avec un enfant. En 2003, elle a crée BAR HOREB dans lequel il vend des boissons et cartes de recharge. Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 45 casiers de boissons et 50 cartes de recharge. Il fait cette demande son stock est épuisé et il voulait faire le réapprovisionnement.

loans.use: Purchase drinks and cell phone recharge cards

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa is a member of the Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.

She is 59 years old, married, has four children, and was born in the city of Cuzco. With the help of her husband, she runs a recreation area called Tradiciones Cuzqueñas y Huamanguinas in a rented space located on the main avenue in Ayacucho. On weekdays she sells a range of meals, and on weekends she specializes in local dishes from Ayacucho and Cuzco. She also runs a catering service for various events.

Rosa needs a loan of 1600 soles in order to buy rice, sugar, oil, meat, and potatoes.

Her dream is to expand her business, to have her children work in the same business, to improve her premises, and to better market her restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.

Rosa es casada, tiene 59 años y 4 hijos, Rosa es natural D. la ciudad D. Cuzco, Rosa tiene un recreo llamado Tradiciones Cuzqueñas y Huamanguinas en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida principal D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo, los días lunes a viernes ofrece platos variados, mientras que los sábados y domingos venD. comida típica D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho y D. Cuzco. Además Rosa brinda el servicio D. preparación D. comidas para diferentes compromisos.

Rosa necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite, carne, papa.

Los sueños D. Rosa son ampliar su negocio, que sus hijas tengan el mismo negocio, implementar más su local y promocionar su restaurante.

loans.use: Rosa is requesting a loan of 1600 soles which she will use to buy rice, sugar, oil, meat, and potatoes.

loans.name: Epifania Elvira

texts.es:
Epifania is a member of the Banco Comunal Glorioso.

She is 50 years old, married, and for the last 26 years has operated a seafood restaurant called El Pino with her husband. The restaurant specializes in dishes made from fish and shellfish. It is located in an air-conditioned space in her mother-in-law’s house. Epifania is helped in the restaurant by some young employees whom she treats as her children—for this reason she is concerned about their education and future prospects.

Epifania needs a loan of 2200 soles in order to buy ingredients and so she can go for a health check up in Lima.

Her dream is to have her own home, to expand the business, and to be able to offer a stable future to her employees.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

Epifania es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.

Epifania es casada, tiene 50 años y 26 años, Epifania junto a su esposo tiene una marisquería llamado “El Pino” la especialidad de su restaurante son las comidas elaboradas a base de pescados y mariscos, su negocio que esta ubicado en la casa de su suegra en local acondicionado para su restaurante, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de empleados jóvenes que ella considera sus hijos, Epifania se preocupa por la educación y superación de ellos.

Epifania necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de sus ingredientes y para el chequeo de su salud en la ciudad de Lima.

Los sueños de Epifania es tener casa propia, ampliar su negocio, brindarles estabilidad a sus empleados.

loans.use: Epifania is requesting a loan of 2200 soles to buy ingredients and have a health check up in Lima.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es:
Celedonia is a member of the Comunal Bank Los Laureles

Celedonia is married, is 49 years old and has six children. Celedonia has a restaurant in a rented store front located in a principal avenue in the city of Ayacucho. Caledonia also sells beverages with the help of employees.

Celedonia needs a loan of $350.00 which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and other condiments.

Caledonia’s dreams are to purchase land, to expand her business and that her children will be successful professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Celedonia es socia del Banco Comunal Los Laureles.

Celedonia es casada, tiene 49 años y 6 hijos, Celedonia tiene una restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado en una avenida principal de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Celedonia también vende bebidas con la ayuda de empleados.

Celedonia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y otros condimentos.

Los sueños de Celedonia son comprar un terreno, ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar and other condiments.

loans.name: Djidoula Agoè Group

texts.fr:
Established in 2007 by a group of three energetic women in Agoè neighborhood, the DJIDOULA Association’s goal is improving living standards through income-generating activities. This association operates mostly in the clothing sector. The group leader does business in fabric, the second member in hair extensions and cosmetic products, and the third member is a seamstress and sells haberdashery items. This is the first time the women are seeking a loan since creating the assocation. They would like to buy more haberdashery products for a total cost of 30,000 Francs CFA, fabric totalling 50,000 Francs CFA, and finally hair extensions and cosmetic products for 50,000 Francs CFA.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Créée en 2007 par un groupe de trois femmes dynamiques du quartier Agoè, l’Association DJIDOULA a pour objectif l’amélioration des conditions de vie à travers l’exercice des initiatives porteuses de revenus. Cette association œuvre plus dans le domaine vestimentaire. La responsable fait le commerce de pagnes, la deuxième personne le commerce de mèches et de produits cosmétiques et enfin la troisième qui est une couturière et vends les articles de mercerie. Depuis la création de cette association, c’est leur première fois de solliciter un crédit. Elles désirent acheter les articles de mercerie pour un montant total de 30.000 FCFA, les pagnes pour un montant total de 50.000FCFA et enfin les mèches et les produits cosmétiques pour un montant de 50.000FCFA.

loans.use: Purchase haberdashery items, fabric, and cosmetic products

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is 37 years old. She is married with 3 children, who are currently in school. She is a trader who deals in cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets, and plates. She balances her stock on her head and moves to the doorsteps of her customers, popularly known as hawking. This is very tiring and neck breaking. Diana is an achiever, and her focus is to build a container shop from her savings to enable her to have a station for her sales. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She is a member of the community group called Blessing Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as a form of social collateral in order to access loans and use peer pressure to repay the loans. Diana’s photograph was taken during her group meeting, and she is very alert in the photo.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets

loans.name: Villa Ascencion Group

texts.en:
Maria J. B. understands what it is like to struggle to survive. Each day of her life has been hand to mouth as she tries to provide for her 10 children. An immigrant from Haiti, Maria and her husband, Wilson, live in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic. Maria sells sweets made out of cocoa, peanuts, and sugar to provide for the seven children that are currently living in her house. (The others are still in Haiti). She dreams of owning her own home one day but is primarily concerned with supporting her children for the time being.

Maria J. B. is just one member of the 10-person micro-bank, Villa Ascencion, which means “Ascended Town”. Each of these unique Dominican entrepreneurs unite in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would otherwise never be able to receive on their own. The concept of this group bank paying their loan together is to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the other members gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together. Some of the other women in this particular bank make a living selling clothing or running small salons, and one owns a small colmado, or store that sells basic groceries and snacks.

On behalf of Maria, the Villa Ascension, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, peanuts, and cocoa, as well as clothing, shoes, and inventory for a small store.

loans.name: Woedi Agoe Group

texts.fr:
The WOEDI Agoè Assocation was created in 2006 in the Avédzi neighborhood of Lomé. The members of this association are involved in small business activities. The goals of the four women in the association are self-help and profit-seeking opportunities. They are married and mothers with families. They are very talented in business practice, having over ten years of small business experience. WOEDI Agoè Association is in its third loan cycle and is seeking a loan to buy 34 bolts of fabric, one bag of corn, four bags of rice, and a crate of tomatoes.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

L’Association WOEDI Agoè est créée en 2006 dans le quartier d’Avédzi à Lomé. Les activités des membres de cette association sont les petits commerces. Les quatre femmes de cette association ont pour objectif l’entraide mutuelle et la recherche du profit sur leurs activités. Elles sont mariées et mères de famille. Elles sont douées dans l’exercice de leur activité car ayant des expériences de plus de 10 ans dans le petit commerce. L’association WOEDI Agoè est à son 3ème cycle de près et sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 34 pièces de pagne, 1 sacs de maïs, 4 sacs de riz, un carton de boîte de tomates.

loans.use: Purchase basic goods merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Born on August 4, 1964 in Sokodé in Tchaoudjo Prefecture, Mrs. Ablavi S. is married and the mother of four children. Since the year 2002, she has been selling "wax prints", lengths of traditional African print cloth, and handbags in the Hédzranawoé neighborhood of Lomé. Her shop is located near the neighborhood's open-air market and does a brisk business, especially on market days.

After reimbursing her first loan in a timely manner, she is requesting this loan to buy 21 lengths of "bazin" (traditionally dyed cloth) for US$ 400 and 16 handbags for $200.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Née le 04 août 1964 à Sokodé dans la préfecture de Tchaoudjo, Madame S. Ablavi est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Depuis l’année 2002, elle exerce le commerce de pagne et de sacs de sortis dans le quartier de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle a son magasin proche du marché du quartier et fait de bonnes recettes par jour surtout les jours de marché.

Après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit, elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter 21 pièces de bazin pour un montant de 168.000FCFA et 16 sacs de sortie pour un montant de 82.000FCFA

loans.use:
Purchase of 21 lengths of "bazin", traditionally dyed cloth

Achat de 21 pièce de bazin

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for WAGES - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Issaka

texts.fr:
Mr. Issaka A. was born on April 9, 1969 in Torégadé in Tchaoudjo Prefecture. He has three children and is married to Ms. Téné Fousseni, who is a seamstress. In 2006 he opened a general store selling grocery staples in the Agoè neighborhood. He needs to complete his inventory and is asking for this first loan to buy 7 sacks of rice, 10 cases of tomatoes, 10 cases of soap, and 8 cases of pasta.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Issaka est né le 9 avril 1969 à Torégadé dans la préfecture de Tchaoudjo. Il a trois enfants et s’est marié à mademoiselle FOUSSENI Téné qui est une couturière. Il a ouvert en 2006 un magasin de vente des produits de premières nécessités dans le quartier d’Agoè. Il désire refaire son stock et sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 7 sacs de riz, 10 cartons de tomates, 10 cartons de savons et 8 cartons de pâtes alimentaires.

loans.use:
Purchase of grocery staples for resale

Achat des produits de premières nécessités

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Mr. Yawo M. was born on September 9, 1970 in Lomé. He is a bachelor and lives in the Hédzranawoé neighborhood in Lomé. He retails electrical goods next to the service station that is located near the market of Hédzranawoé. His plan is to equip a store where he can keep his goods, so he won't have to bring things back and forth every day. He has already reimbursed one loan correctly.

In order to realize his little project, he is asking for this second loan to outfit a store he has rented and buy 20 cases of electrical wire and 10 cases of switches.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur M. Yawo est né le 09 septembre 1970 à Lomé. Il est célibataire et réside dans le quartier Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Il est revendeur de matériels d’électricité à côté de la station d’essence située à côté du marché de Hédzranawoé. Son projet est d’aménager un magasin pouvant lui permettre de stocker ses matériels et d’éviter des allers-retours à la fin de chaque journée. Il a une fois bénéficié du crédit et a bien remboursé.

Pour la réalisation de son petit projet, il sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour faire l’aménagement d’un magasin qu’il a loué et acheter 20 cartons de fil électrique et 10 cartons de réglette.

loans.use:
Purchase of electrical goods

Achat de matériels électriques

loans.name: Cruz Freddy

texts.es:
Mr. Cruz G. is a hard working gentleman that dedicates himself to cattle raising in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of Leon. He dedicates himself to this business with the goal of supporting his three children who are currently of school age.

The necessity that Mr. Cruz is currently faced with is the need to purchase pregnant cows. This is why he is seeking the support of Ceprodel with the goal of being the beneficiary of a loan that will allow him to purchase the cows so that he can sell them and continue to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Cruz G. es un caballero muy trabajador que se dedica al negocio de la ganadería en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León. Se dedica a este negocio con el propósito de mantener a sus tres hijos que actualmente se encuentran en edades escolares.

La necesidad que hoy en día atraviesa el caballero Cruz es que necesita la compra de vacas en estado de preñez. Por eso es que sin duda busca el apoyo en Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiado con un crédito que se permita la compra de las vacas para comercializarlas en su sector y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su familia

loans.use: Purchase of pregnant cows.

loans.name: Gustavo De Jesus

texts.es:
Gustavo Icavalzeta is a gentleman that dedicates himself to the business of farming and livestock. He attends to his farm and livestock in the municipality of El Sauce in the city of Leon. He is the father of three children who he supports with the goal that they will study and that they will not lack anything in their home.

The necessity that he is currently faced with is the need to invest in the purchase of cattle. For this simple reason he is seeking the support of Ceprodel to obtain a loan to purchase cattle to sell. He is a loyal client having paid off all his loans on time and according to the terms established by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Gustavo Icavalzeta es un caballero que se dedica al negocio agropecuario atendiendo su finca y su ganado en el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León. Es padre de tres hijos los que mantiene con el objetivo de que ellos estudien y no les haga falta nada en el hogar.

La necesidad que hoy en día él atraviesa es que necesita invertir en la compra de ganado y por esta sencilla razón busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito para la compra del ganado para comercializarlo. Hoy en día es un fiel cliente habiendo cancelado todos sus créditos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido en la institución.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock.

loans.name: Maxima Lidia

texts.es:
Maxima H. dedicates herself to the business of farming and livestock in her municipality of El Sauce in the city of Leon. With a lot of work she has been able to improve her business as a result of her great efforts to help her two small children in their studies.

The necessity the she is currently faced with is the need to acquire the economic resources to purchase pregnant cows. For this reason she is seeking a loan through Ceprodel to purchase the cows so that she can continue with her livestock business in the municipality of El Sauce.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Máxima H. se dedica al negocio agropecuario en su municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos pequeños en sus estudios.

La necesidad que ella actualmente atraviesa es que necesita adquirir el recurso económico para la compra de vacas en preñez. Por este motivo busca en Ceprodel un crédito para la compra de las vacas y de esta manera continuar con su negocio de ganado en el municipio de El Sauce.

loans.use: Purchase of pregnant cows.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Mr.Santos I. dedicates himself to the business of farming and livestock in the city of Leon in the municipality of El Sauce. He distinguishes himself by having a lot of experience when it comes to cultivation and livestock. He supports his four children and also provides for their education. It is important to note that thanks to his hard work he has been able to give his children his support so that they can get ahead.

He is seeking the support of Ceprodel with the goal of obtaining a loan that will allow him to purchase steers to raise so that he may sell them to his clients. Both he and his loving family will benefit from this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Santos I. se dedica al negocio agropecuario en la ciudad de León en el municipio de El Sauce. Se destaca por tener amplia experiencia en el trato con el cultivo y los animales del ganado. Es padre de cuatro hijos en la obligación de mantener y proporcionarles sus respectivos estudios. Es de importancia destacar que gracias a sus esfuerzos ha logrado brindarles su apoyo para que estos salgan adelante.

Hoy en día busca el poyo en Ceprodel con el objetivo de obtener un crédito que le permita comprar de novillos para desarrollarlos y cuando crezcan venderlos a sus clientes. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su amada familia.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
In the municipality of El Sause in the city of Leon, Francisca A. works hard to achieve her goal of improving her household living conditions by purchasing a solar panel to generate electricity because her community does not have electricity. This panel will be installed on the roof of her house and in this way will provide her house with electricity.

Now that she has bought the solar panel she would like to repay her debt. For this reason she is seeking Ceprodel's support to obtain the necessary loan to pay for the panel so that she can continue to work hard and be able to perform household chores using the electricity from the solar panel.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León, la señora Francisca A. se dedica a laborar fuertemente con el único propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por medio de la compra de un panel solar el cual genera energía eléctrica ya que en su comunidad nunca ha contado con esta. Este panel solar se instala en el techo de la casa y de esta manera abastece a la vivienda en general con energia electrica.

Hoy en día, al haber adquirido el panel solar tiene la obligación de cancelar esta deuda y por esta razón es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para el pago del panel para así continuar con su ardua labor y poder realizar los quehaceres del hogar con el apoyo del panel solar.

loans.use: To pay for a solar panel to supply her house with electricity

loans.name: Brenda Lorena

texts.es:
My name is Brenda Lorena Girón Gómez and I am 32 years old. I’m originally from the capital city, and it has been eight years since I started a business selling of slushies from my doorstep. This enterprise went very well for me and I was able to save money, as well as obtain a loan from the Shalom bank which allowed me to buy new children’s clothing that I sell from my home. I also sell my merchandise by foot on the local streets, as well as used clothing which has also been a successful endeavor for me. Although my earnings have improved, I still want to increase my sales. This requires obtaining additional merchandise, and is the reason why I am seeking new capital.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Brenda Lorena Girón Gómez tengo 32 años de edad, soy originaria de la ciudad capital, hace ocho años inicie mi negocio el cual consistía en la venta de granizadas, las cuales las vendía en la puerta de mi casa, donde me fue bastante bien y pude ahorrar alfo de dinero y con un préstamo que hice en el banco de confianza Shalom, pude comprar ropa nueva de niño, la cual la vendo en mi casa y tengo un puesto ambulante en la calle, actualmente también me dedico a vender ropa de paca donde me ha ido muy bien , debido a que se han incrementado mis ganancias y quiero aumentar mis ventas pero debo surtir mi producto para eso necesito el capital que he solicitado.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for clothing sales.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar lives in the county of Jayaque in the department of La Libertad. For 15 years he has been working as a builder and this is how he has supported his wife and 2 kids. His dream is to give his family a good quality of life, but for him he will not be happy until his mother has a better quality of life, and in some way he would like to repay all the love and care that she gave to him.

Currently his mother lives in a room made of bricks and metal sheets. Her room is very small and very insecure as it is not all made of brick so lots of water gets in in winter which creates puddles in the room which attracts mosquitos and flies which carry diseases. Due to this Oscar would like a loan to make his mother's last days very happy.

Transalted from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Don Oscar, vive en el Municipio de Jayaque, del Departamento de La Libertad. Desde hace 15 años trabaja en la albañilería, con dicho oficio y con el ayuda de su esposa a sacado adelante a sus dos hijos. Su mayor ilusión es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, pero el dice que su felicidad no estará completa hasta que logre mejorar las condiciones de vida de su mamá y de alguna manera poderle retribuir todo el amor y cuidados que le brindo cuando estaba con ella. Actualmente la mamá vive en un cuarto construido de ladrillo y de lamina metálica, este cuarto es bastante pequeño y muy inseguro, ya que por no estar construido totalmente de ladrillo filtra mucha agua en el invierno que provoca charcos dentro del cuarto que contribuyen a la ploriferación de mosquitos y zancudos, exponiéndola a enfermedades. Debido a ello Don Oscar esta solicitando un préstamo para lograr hacer ese sueño realidad y ver a su mamá viviendo felices los últimos días de su vida.

loans.use: To build a room for his mum/Para Construir el cuarto de la mamá

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27112&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Vilma is a member of the Comunal Bank Yanapanakusun.

Vilma is married and has a daughter and a grandaughter. Vilma and her husband have a small photography business. They service different family events as well as institutional events. Most of their events are on weekends. Vilma and her daughter also have a store where they sell clothing, groceries, meat and vegetables.

Vilma needs a loan of $1050.00 which she will invest in the purchase of wallets, clothing, rolls of film and DVDs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Primer prestamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=27112&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun.

Vilma es casada, tiene 1 hija y una nieta, Vilma junto a su esposo tienen una pequeña empresa de foto-filmaciones Miranda, hacen los servicios en diferentes compromisos familiares, eventos en instituciones. Los días que tienen más eventos son los fines de semana. Además Vilma junto a su hija tienen una bodega surtida donde vende ropa, abarrotes, carne, verduras.

Vilma necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de carteras, ropa, rollos y DVD.

Los sueños de Vilma son tener una tienda grande, ampliar su casa para alquilar y viajar al extranjero.

loans.use: Purchase of wallets, clothing, rolls of films and DVDs.
